title: Tube Investments of India shares fall over 2% in Tuesday's session
content: Shares of Tube Investments of India Ltd declined 2.20% to Rs 3,071.70 in Tuesday's session. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Quarterly Financials: The consolidated revenue for Tube Investments of India Ltd has shown a fluctuating trend over the last five quarters. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 5,309.06 Crore, up from Rs 5,149.96 Crore in March 2025. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 303.28 Crore. Key quarterly financial data is presented below:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 4,577.92 CroreRs 4,924.55 CroreRs 4,812.22 CroreRs 5,149.96 CroreRs 5,309.06 CroreNet ProfitRs 313.80 CroreRs 299.30 CroreRs 280.22 CroreRs 158.22 CroreRs 303.28 CroreEPS11.6410.6910.012.4110.28 Annual Financials: The consolidated annual revenue for Tube Investments of India Ltd has increased steadily over the past five years. For the year-ending March 2025, the revenue stood at Rs 19,464.65 Crore, compared to Rs 16,890.33 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 1,054.67 Crore. The following table presents key annual financial data:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 6,083.29 CroreRs 12,525.30 CroreRs 14,964.73 CroreRs 16,890.33 CroreRs 19,464.65 CroreNet ProfitRs 304.69 CroreRs 994.31 CroreRs 1,177.98 CroreRs 1,187.51 CroreRs 1,054.67 CroreEPS15.1339.8949.5062.1234.83BVPS130.07193.12256.63348.74286.08ROE13.1825.0324.1823.5412.17Debt to Equity0.610.260.160.150.08 Annual Income Statement: The total income for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 19,835 Crore, while the total expenditure was Rs 18,118 Crore. The EBIT stood at Rs 1,717 Crore. The annual sales has increased by approximately 15% from March 2024 to March 2025. Quarterly Income Statement: For the quarter-ending June 2025, the total income was Rs 5,380 Crore and total expenditure was Rs 4,914 Crore. The EBIT for the same period stood at Rs 465 Crore. Balance Sheet: As of March 2025, Tube Investments of India Ltd reported total liabilities of Rs 15,964 Crore and total assets of Rs 15,964 Crore. The company's fixed assets amounted to Rs 4,730 Crore, and current assets were Rs 9,429 Crore. Cash Flow: The cash flow from operating activities for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 1,213 Crore. Investing activities resulted in a cash outflow of Rs 1,615 Crore, while financing activities provided a cash inflow of Rs 522 Crore. Financial Ratios: The basic EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 34.83, and diluted EPS was Rs 34.80. The book value per share (excluding revaluation reserve) was Rs 286.08. The company's debt to equity ratio stood at 0.08 as of March 2025. The P/E ratio stood at 79.51 and P/B (x) was 9.69 as of March 2025. Corporate Actions: Tube Investments of India Ltd announced a final dividend of Rs 1.50 per share (150%) on May 15, 2025, with an effective date of July 25, 2025. An interim dividend of Rs 2.00 per share (200%) was announced on February 3, 2025, with an effective date of February 7, 2025. Tube Investments of India Ltd has informed the Exchange about General Updates - ESG Ratings by CRISIL ESG Ratings & Analytics Limited on August 19, 2025. The ESG Rating assigned by CRISIL ESG Ratings & Analytics Limited on August 19, 2025. The stock's movement occurred at 11:31 am.

title: M&M shares fall 0.71%; stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of M&M were trading lower in Tuesday's session. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty 50 index, with the share price declining by 0.71% to Rs 3,291.90 at 11:30 am. Among other stocks that were the top losers on Nifty 50 were Dr Reddys Labs (down 0.66%), UltraTechCement (down 0.54%), Maruti Suzuki (down 0.45%), and Asian Paints (down 0.43%). Here is a detailed look into the financial performance of M&M: Financial Performance: The following table presents the consolidated quarterly financial data for M&M:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 37,217.72 CroreRs 37,923.74 CroreRs 41,470.05 CroreRs 42,599.31 CroreRs 45,529.19 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,221.34 CroreRs 2,894.71 CroreRs 3,317.22 CroreRs 3,102.48 CroreRs 3,898.44 CroreEPS29.4428.4328.5129.5236.58The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 45,529.19 Crore, which is an increase compared to Rs 37,217.72 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 3,898.44 Crore, compared to Rs 3,221.34 Crore in June 2024. The EPS for the same period increased to 36.58 from 29.44. The debt-to-equity ratio has remained relatively stable, fluctuating slightly around 1.5. Dividends: M&M has a history of distributing dividends to its shareholders. The most recent final dividend was announced on May 5, 2025, at Rs 25.30 per share. Bonus Issues: The company has issued bonus shares on several occasions, with the most recent being a 1:1 bonus on November 10, 2017. Rights Issues: M&M had a rights issue on September 30, 1992, with an existing ratio of 5:1. Stock Splits: The company had a stock split on January 25, 2010, where the face value was split from Rs 10 to Rs 5. M&M's recent announcements include a dilution of stake in Mahindra Last Mile Mobility Limited and analyst/investor meet intimations. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 3,291.90, M&M has seen a slight decline in today's session and is among the top losers on the Nifty 50.

title: Power Grid Corp among top gainers on Nifty 50; stock rises 2.57%
content: Shares of Power Grid Corp were up 2.57% to Rs 287.05 in Tuesday's session, making it one of the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index at 11:30 am. This increase reflects a positive movement from its previous close. Financial Highlights: The company has demonstrated steady financial performance over the past few years. Hereâ€™s a look at some key figures: Consolidated Quarterly Data:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 11,006.18 CroreRs 11,277.76 CroreRs 11,233.03 CroreRs 12,275.35 CroreRs 11,196.22 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,694.90 CroreRs 3,897.63 CroreRs 3,866.72 CroreRs 4,172.45 CroreRs 3,675.02 CroreEPS4.004.084.154.463.90The revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 12,275.35 Crore, which decreased to Rs 11,196.22 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2025. The net profit also saw a decrease from Rs 4,172.45 Crore in March 2025 to Rs 3,675.02 Crore in June 2025. The EPS decreased from 4.46 in March 2025 to 3.90 in June 2025. Consolidated Yearly Data:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 39,639.79 CroreRs 41,616.34 CroreRs 45,581.28 CroreRs 45,843.10 CroreRs 45,792.32 CroreNet ProfitRs 11,821.76 CroreRs 16,745.60 CroreRs 15,499.24 CroreRs 15,592.71 CroreRs 15,631.70 CroreEPS23.0124.1222.1017.3616.69BVPS133.68109.31119.0193.7099.63ROE17.2122.0618.5717.8716.75Debt to Equity1.871.771.521.421.41The annual revenue saw a slight decrease from Rs 45,843.10 Crore in 2024 to Rs 45,792.32 Crore in 2025. Net profit increased marginally from Rs 15,592.71 Crore in 2024 to Rs 15,631.70 Crore in 2025. The EPS decreased from 17.36 in 2024 to 16.69 in 2025. involved in various corporate actions. Recent announcements include changes in senior management and being declared a successful bidder under TBCB. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 1.25 per share (12.5%) on May 19, 2025, with an effective date of August 19, 2025. Additionally, a second interim dividend of Rs 3.25 per share (32.5%) was announced on January 28, 2025, and was effective from February 7, 2025. The company had also announced bonus issues, including a bonus ratio of 1:3 announced on July 31, 2023, with the ex-bonus date on September 12, 2023, and another one with bonus ratio of 1:3 announced on June 17, 2021, with the ex-bonus date on July 29, 2021. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 287.05, Power Grid Corp has shown a strong performance as one of the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index.

title: Bosch shares hit all-time high, up 0.67%; stock part of Nifty Next 50
content: shares of Bosch touched an all-time high of Rs 41,356.95 on the BSE on Tuesday. At 11:20 am, the stock was trading at Rs 41,060, a gain of 0.67% and is a constituent of the Nifty Next 50 index. title: Sun TV shares surge 6% as Avendus upgrades stock to "buy" on strong IPL growth outlook
content: Shares of Sun TV Network rallied 6 percent to Rs 581 apiece on September 2 after brokerage firm Avendus Spark turned bullish on the stock for the first time in five years. The brokerage upgraded Sun TV to â€œbuyâ€ from â€œsellâ€ and significantly raised its price target to Rs 680 for the next 12 months and Rs 840 over the next three years. These targets imply an upside potential of 25 percent in the short term and 54 percent over the long term. Avendus Spark said it now views Sun TV as a fast-growing sports company rather than a stagnating linear TV broadcaster. It highlighted that Sun TV has the highest listed exposure to the Indian Premier League (IPL) among media peers, making it the purest proxy for investors to participate in Indiaâ€™s sports monetisation opportunity. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog The brokerage expects Sun TVâ€™s IPL revenue to grow at a compounded annual growth rate (CAGR) of 9 to 12 percent between 2025 and 2027, reaching Rs 15,000 crore. Its IPL franchise, Sunrisers Hyderabad, is projected to contribute nearly 60 percent to the companyâ€™s sum-of-the-parts (SOTP) valuation. Avendus Spark has applied a 40x price-to-earnings multiple to Sun TVâ€™s IPL business and 10x to its core broadcasting business. In a strategic move to expand its sports portfolio, Sun TVâ€™s board in July approved the acquisition of a 100 percent stake in Northern Superchargers Ltd., a London-based cricket franchise that competes in The Hundred, a professional league run by the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB). The deal is valued at Â£100.5 million (approximately Rs 1,161 crore). title: National Aluminium Company shares surge 3.03% amid high volume
content: Shares of National Aluminium Company experienced a surge of 3.03% in Tuesday's trading session, with the stock price reaching Rs 197.60. The stock demonstrated high and unusual trading volume during the session, also triggering a jump in volume. In terms of financial performance, National Aluminium Company has shown substantial growth. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,806.94 Crore, compared to Rs 2,856.10 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 1,063.86 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 601.22 Crore in the previous year. Here's a detailed look at the company's quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 2,856.10 CroreRs 4,001.48 CroreRs 4,662.22 CroreRs 5,267.83 CroreRs 3,806.94 CroreNet ProfitRs 601.22 CroreRs 1,062.18 CroreRs 1,582.90 CroreRs 2,078.37 CroreRs 1,063.86 CroreEPS3.205.708.5311.265.71The annual consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 16,787.63 Crore, a significant rise from Rs 13,149.15 Crore in March 2024. The annual net profit also saw substantial growth, reaching Rs 5,324.67 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 2,059.95 Crore in the previous year. The company's Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased from Rs 10.83 in March 2024 to Rs 28.68 in March 2025. The sales for March 2025 reached Rs 16,787 Crore, while other income contributed Rs 357 Crore, bringing the total income to Rs 17,144 Crore. Total expenditure amounted to Rs 9,950 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 7,194 Crore. After accounting for interest (Rs 58 Crore) and tax (Rs 1,810 Crore), the net profit stood at Rs 5,324 Crore. The companyâ€™s cash flow statement indicates that cash flow from operating activities was Rs 5,806 Crore, from investing activities was -Rs 3,970 Crore, and from financing activities was -Rs 1,757 Crore. The net cash flow was Rs 77 Crore. The balance sheet shows that as of March 2025, the share capital was Rs 918 Crore and reserves & surplus was Rs 16,887 Crore. Current liabilities were Rs 3,498 Crore and other liabilities were Rs 1,578 Crore, bringing the total liabilities to Rs 22,882 Crore. The assets included fixed assets of Rs 12,684 Crore, current assets of Rs 9,139 Crore and other assets of Rs 1,058 Crore. Total assets stood at Rs 22,882 Crore. Key financial ratios for March 2025 include a basic and diluted EPS of Rs 28.68, and a book value per share of Rs 96.95. The company's dividend per share was Rs 10.50, with a face value of Rs 5. Margin ratios showed a gross profit margin of 47.01%, an operating margin of 42.85%, and a net profit margin of 31.71%. Return ratios included a return on net worth/equity of 29.58%, ROCE of 37.11%, and return on assets of 23.02%. Liquidity ratios showed a current ratio of 2.61 and a quick ratio of 2.07. Leverage ratios indicated a debt to equity ratio of 0.01 and interest coverage ratio of 133.85. In corporate action news, National Aluminium Company Limited was imposed a fine of Rs. 7,51,660 by NSE, according to information shared with the exchange. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 2.50 per share (50%) on August 7, 2025, with an effective date of September 19, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 4.00 per share (80%) was announced on February 10, 2025, effective February 14, 2025. According to Moneycontrol analysis as of August 26, 2025, the sentiment towards National Aluminium Company is bearish. Shares of National Aluminium Company experienced a notable surge in today's session, accompanied by high trading volume and significant financial growth.

title: ACME Solar Exits 300 MW Project, Collects EMD as Flexibility Scheme Becomes Voluntary
content: ACME Solar (Symbol: ACMESOLAR) announced it has received confirmation to exit a Letter of Award (LoA) without penalty, securing the return of its Earnest Money Deposit (EMD) for a 300 MW solar project. PFC Consulting Limited (PFCCL), the bid coordinator, communicated the decision following the Ministry of Power's directive on January 21, 2025, which made participation in the Flexibility Scheme voluntary. The decision also follows a writ petition filed before the Delhi High Court by West Bengal State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (WBSEDCL), challenging provisions of the scheme; the matter remains sub judice. The Letter of Award, initially disclosed on February 6, 2024, concerned a 300 MW solar project at a tariff of â‚¹2.53/kWh under the Flexibility Scheme, with ACME Sigma Urja Private Limited as the project SPV. The Flexibility Scheme, introduced on April 12, 2022, aimed to introduce flexibility in the generation and scheduling of thermal/hydro power stations by bundling with renewable and storage energy. ACME Solar stated the project is currently generating no revenue or profitability, resulting in no material impact on the Company's financial performance.
summary_lexrank: ACME Solar (Symbol: ACMESOLAR) announced it has received confirmation to exit a Letter of Award (LoA) without penalty, securing the return of its Earnest Money Deposit (EMD) for a 300 MW solar project.
summary_luhn: The Letter of Award, initially disclosed on February 6, 2024, concerned a 300 MW solar project at a tariff of â‚¹2.53/kWh under the Flexibility Scheme, with ACME Sigma Urja Private Limited as the project SPV.
summary_lsa: ACME Solar (Symbol: ACMESOLAR) announced it has received confirmation to exit a Letter of Award (LoA) without penalty, securing the return of its Earnest Money Deposit (EMD) for a 300 MW solar project.

title: Manappuram, IIFL Finance, other gold financier stocks rise up to 3% as precious metal hits lifetime high
content: Gold financier stocks extended gains on September 2, as the yellow metal continued to trade at lifetime high levels. Gold futures have crossed the key Rs 1.05 lakh per 10 grams-mark on MCX. The rising gold prices bodes well for gold financiers, as it increases the value of the collateral while issuing loans. This reduces the risk of default, as the collateral becomes more valuable relative to the loan amount issued against it. Manappuram Finance shares gained nearly 3 percent to trade at around Rs 282 apiece, nearing a record high level after extending gains for the second consecutive session. The stock has now gained more than 8 percent in two days. IIFL Finance shares gained nearly 2 percent to trade at Rs 447.50 apiece, also extending gains for the second day. Muthoot Finance shares meanwhile gained over 2 percent to hit an intraday high of Rs 2,768 apiece. Gold futures with October expiry on the MCX hit an all-time high of Rs 1,05,937 per 10 grams yesterday. The contracts are hovering near the record high level today. This comes amid heightened global uncertainties. A weaker dollar and growing expectations for a U.S. interest rate cut this month are supporting the rising gold prices, said Manav Modi, Analyst â€“ Precious Metal -Research, Motilal Oswal Financial Services. Analyst expect the bull run in gold prices to continue. "A softer US dollar and renewed safe-haven demand supported the rally, as investors turned to gold amid ongoing uncertainty surrounding US monetary policy. Growing political pressure may accelerate the timeline for interest rate cuts, with markets largely pricing in a 25 bps reduction in Septemberâ€”a development that remains supportive for bullion," said Axis Securities. Manav Modi from Motilal Oswal Financial Services also noted that the precious metals were up on safe-haven buying. "Along with increasing rate cut expectations, tensions between Israel and Gaza and other geo-political tensions and the tariff escalations are continuously supporting buying in bullions, as increased expectations of a U.S. Federal Reserve interest rate cut this month lifted bullion's allureâ€¦Increase in festive and wedding demand, ETF buying and Increased premiums in China are some of the additional factors supporting goldâ€™s bull run," he added. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

summary_luhn: A weaker dollar and growing expectations for a U.S. interest rate cut this month are supporting the rising gold prices, said Manav Modi, Analyst â€“ Precious Metal -Research, Motilal Oswal Financial Services.

title: Accumulate Hindustan Unilever; target of Rs 2870: Deven Choksey
content: Deven Choksey's research report on Hindustan Unilever HULâ€™s Q1FY26 performance was mixed, as revenue was broadly in line with our estimates; however, EBITDA stood below our estimates (-2.8%) led by elevated operating costs, while net profit stood above our expectations (+5.7%), led by oneoff i.e., lower ETR. Consolidated revenue grew at a moderate pace of 5.1% YoY (+5.4% QoQ) to INR 1,65,140 Mn., in-line with our estimates. The growth was led by underlying volume growth (UVG) of 4.0%, driven by broad-based USG (underlying sales growth) across segments including Beauty and Wellbeing, Personal Care, Foods, and Home Care. Outlook We have roll-forwarded our valuation basis to Junâ€™27 estimates. We value Hindustan Unilever at 55.0x Junâ€™27 EPS (~to its 3-year Avg. NTM P/E), implying a target price of INR 2,870. We reiterate our â€œACCUMULATEâ€ rating on the stock, led by anticipated recovery in gross margin and enhanced competitive intensity through the remainder of FY26E. title: UPL share price falls 2.01% in today's session
content: Shares of UPL declined by 2.01% to Rs 713.35 in Tuesday's trading session, as of 10:59 am. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On the financial front, UPL's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 9,216 Crore, compared to Rs 9,067 Crore in June 2024, marking an increase. However, the company reported a net loss of Rs 194 Crore for the same period, against a loss of Rs 495 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The companyâ€™s EPS stood at -Rs 1.98 in June 2025 as compared to -Rs 6.02 in June 2024. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 46,637 Crore, compared to Rs 43,098 Crore in March 2024. The company reported a net profit of Rs 1,292 Crore for the same period, against a loss of Rs 1,636 Crore in the previous year. The companyâ€™s EPS stood at Rs 9.85 in March 2025 as compared to -Rs 17.80 in March 2024.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 38,694.00 CroreRs 46,240.00 CroreRs 53,576.00 CroreRs 43,098.00 CroreRs 46,637.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,453.00 CroreRs 4,303.00 CroreRs 4,257.00 CroreRs -1,636.00 CroreRs 1,292.00 CroreEPS36.4045.8745.79-17.809.85BVPS282.27344.08432.57330.76367.46ROE16.0316.7213.29-4.833.07Debt to Equity1.321.190.861.150.81The table illustrates UPL's financial performance over the past five years. Revenue has fluctuated, with a notable increase from Rs 38,694.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 46,637.00 Crore in 2025. Net profit saw a significant turnaround, recovering to Rs 1,292.00 Crore in 2025 after a loss of Rs -1,636.00 Crore in 2024. EPS followed a similar trend, rising to Rs 9.85 in 2025. The book value per share (BVPS) increased from Rs 282.27 in 2021 to Rs 367.46 in 2025, while the return on equity (ROE) improved to 3.07 in 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio has decreased to 0.81 in 2025. The company announced final dividend of Rs 6 per share (300%) on May 12, 2025 with effective date as July 11, 2025. Earlier, the company had announced bonus issue on May 17, 2019, with existing ratio of 2 and offered ratio of 1 with ex-bonus date as July 02, 2019. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment for the stock as of today. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 713.35, UPL has seen a decline from its previous close.

title: Steel Authority of India shares rise 2.13%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Steel Authority of India gained 2.13% to trade at Rs 123.67 on Tuesday. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at 10:58 am. On the financial front, Steel Authority of India's consolidated revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 25,921.76 Crore, compared to Rs 23,997.81 Crore in June 2024, marking an increase. The net profit for the same period was Rs 671.48 Crore, a significant rise from a net loss of Rs 24.87 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) stood at Rs 1.80 in June 2025, up from Rs 0.20 in June 2024. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 102,479.06 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 105,378.33 Crore recorded in March 2024. The net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 1,885.02 Crore, a decrease from Rs 2,628.06 Crore in March 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) stood at Rs 5.74 for the year ending March 2025, down from Rs 7.42 in March 2024. Key financial ratios include a Debt to Equity ratio of 0.51 as of March 2025. The P/E ratio stood at 20.07 and the P/B ratio was 0.81 as of March 2025.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to EquityMar 202169,113.613,680.3910.04109.939.130.78Mar 2022103,476.8411,825.3529.64131.2522.580.25Mar 2023104,447.721,530.865.27132.543.970.47Mar 2024105,378.332,628.067.42138.245.370.54Mar 2025102,479.061,885.025.74142.614.020.51The company announced a final dividend of Rs 1.60 per share, which will be effective from September 9, 2025. A Moneycontrol analysis on August 28, 2025, indicated a bearish sentiment for the stock. Shares of Steel Authority of India gained 2.13% to trade at Rs 123.67 on Tuesday and is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index.

title: Gokaldas Exports, Avanti Feeds rise up to 7% on US Treasury Secy's 'two great countries will get it solved' remark
content: Textile and shrimp stocks surged on September 2 after US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent expressed confidence that Washington and New Delhi can resolve the ongoing trade jitters, hours after Prime Minister Narendra Modi returned from China after attending the SCO Summit. Speaking to Fox News, Bessent said, "I think at the end of the day, two great countries will get this solved." He said the slow progress in India-US trade talks was one of the reasons behind US President Donald Trump-led US administration's decision to raise tariffs. He however criticised India's imports of Russian oil, which he said might be fueling Vladimir Putin's war in Ukraine. "The Indians have not been great actors in terms of buying Russian oil and then reselling it, financing the Russian war effort in Ukraine," he said. Speaking about Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to China for the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Summit, Bessent said it is largely performative. "I think at the end of the day, India is the most populous democracy in the world. Their values are much closer to ours and to China's than to Russia's," he added. Bessent's remarks may have spurred trade talk hopes between India and US, triggering a rally in the export-oriented textile and shrimp stocks. Gokaldas Exports shares jumped nearly 5 percent to trade at Rs 733 apiece, while KPR Mill shares surged nearly 3 percent. Raymond Lifestyle shares gained more than 3 percent, while Arvind Fashions sharers rose nearly 3 percent. Avanti Feeds shares rallied around 7 percent, while Apex Frozen Foods shares jumped more than 4 percent. Notably, these companies derive a major portion of their revenue from US exports. These stocks earlier tumbled after US increased its tariffs on Indian imports to a whopping 50 percent, the highest among its Asian peers. US President Donald Trump recently lashed out at India, calling the relationship between India and US "a totally one-sided disaster". In a post on Truth Social, Trump said, "What few people understand is that we do very little business with India, but they do a tremendous amount of business with us. In other words, they sell us massive amounts of goods, their biggest â€œclient,â€ but we sell them very little â€¦ They have now offered to cut their Tariffs to nothing, but itâ€™s getting late. They should have done so years ago." Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates
summary_lexrank: US President Donald Trump recently lashed out at India, calling the relationship between India and US "a totally one-sided disaster".
summary_luhn: In a post on Truth Social, Trump said, "What few people understand is that we do very little business with India, but they do a tremendous amount of business with us.
summary_lsa: Speaking about Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to China for the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Summit, Bessent said it is largely performative.
summary_textrank: Textile and shrimp stocks surged on September 2 after US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent expressed confidence that Washington and New Delhi can resolve the ongoing trade jitters, hours after Prime Minister Narendra Modi returned from China after attending the SCO Summit.

title: Phoenix Mills stock rallies 5% as Motilal Oswal upgrades to buy, sees 35% upside
content: Shares of mall operator and real estate player The Phoenix Mills rallied nearly five percent in trade on Tuesday, September 2, after domestic brokerage Motilal Oswal upgraded the counter to 'buy,' citing a strong growth outlook. The broking house upgraded its rating on the stock, while hiking its target price to Rs 2,044, which indicated a 35 percent upside from current levels. At 9.55 a.m., shares of the firm were quoting Rs 1,583.7, higher by 4.4 percent. During FY15-25, Phoenix Mills' retail portfolio witnessed an 11 percent CAGR in consumption, supported by ~7 percent like-for-like growth in the existing malls and the opening of new malls in Lucknow, Indore, Ahmedabad, Pune, and Bengaluru. Additionally, retail rental income clocked a similar 12 percent CAGR during this period, mirroring the consumption growth. Going ahead, Motilal Oswal anticipates this positive growth trend to continue, primarily driven by the ramp-up of new malls. The brokerage estimated a 21 percent CAGR in retail rental income over FY25-27E to reach Rs 2,800 crore by FY27E and total income to reach Rs 3,900 crore. While new malls continue to ramp up well, the firm is implementing measures to accelerate consumption at mature malls. These initiatives, along with a further increase in trading occupancy, will help Phoenix Mills sustain healthy traction in consumption. Further, the company continues to diversify and expand its office portfolio within its existing mall properties across key locations. Notable developments include office spaces at malls in Bengaluru (1.2msf), Chennai (0.4msf), and Palladium Mumbai (1.1msf). "Additionally, newly launched malls in Pune (1.2msf) and Bengaluru (1.2msf) are also contributing to the growth of Phoenix Mills' office segment. These strategic expansions highlight the firm's commitment to increasing its office presence in high-demand urban areas," said Motilal Oswal. Motilal Oswal also said Phoenix Millsâ€™ acquisition of the remaining 49 percent stake in Island Star Mall Developers (ISMDPL) will strengthen its premium retail portfolio and unlock long-term value. The deal is expected to be earnings-accretive from the first year, with further upside as rental income stabilizes and the 2.71 msf incremental FSI potential is developed over the medium term. Staggered payments over three years are likely to keep the net debt-to-equity ratio below 0.4x for the next two years. Follow our market blog to catch all the live updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

summary_luhn: The brokerage estimated a 21 percent CAGR in retail rental income over FY25-27E to reach Rs 2,800 crore by FY27E and total income to reach Rs 3,900 crore.
summary_lsa: Motilal Oswal also said Phoenix Millsâ€™ acquisition of the remaining 49 percent stake in Island Star Mall Developers (ISMDPL) will strengthen its premium retail portfolio and unlock long-term value.
summary_textrank: During FY15-25, Phoenix Mills' retail portfolio witnessed an 11 percent CAGR in consumption, supported by ~7 percent like-for-like growth in the existing malls and the opening of new malls in Lucknow, Indore, Ahmedabad, Pune, and Bengaluru.

title: Endurance Technologies, AU Small Finance stocks among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Endurance Technologies, AU Small Finance, and Motilal Oswal shares were among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at 10:00 am on Tuesday. Endurance Techn's stock declined by 2.64% to Rs 2,862.20. AU Small Financ's stock fell by 2.04% to Rs 706.85. Motilal Oswal's stock decreased by 2.03% to Rs 877.20. Max Healthcare's stock slipped by 1.3% to Rs 1,165.80, while Sundaram Fin's stock went down by 1.23% to Rs 4,394.10. Endurance Technologies Limited informed the exchange on August 26, 2025, about newspaper advertisements published in the Financial Express (English) and the Loksatta (Marathi) regarding public notice under the Investor Education and Protection Fund Authority's "Saksham Niveshak" campaign. The company also announced capacity addition for anti-lock braking system, disc brake systems, and brake discs on August 19, 2025. Multiple investor meets were scheduled for September 2, 2025, from 10:00 am to 4:30 pm. title: Phoenix Mills shares surge 4.51%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Phoenix Mills' stock is trading as one of the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index, with a significant rise of 4.51%. At 10:00 am, the stock was priced at Rs 1,585.50. Key highlights include:Bonus Issues:On July 31, 2024, a bonus ratio of 1:1 was announced, with a record date of September 21, 2024, and an ex-bonus date of September 20, 2024.A prior bonus issue on September 1, 2005, had a bonus ratio of 4:1, with a record date of December 16, 2005, and an ex-bonus date of December 9, 2005.Splits:A split was announced on December 19, 2007, changing the face value from Rs 10 to Rs 2, effective February 13, 2008, with a record date of February 20, 2008.Another split occurred on September 1, 2005, reducing the face value from Rs 100 to Rs 10, with a record date of December 16, 2005, and an ex-split date of December 9, 2005.Dividends:The company announced a final dividend of Rs 5.00 per share (250%) on May 17, 2024, effective August 20, 2024.The company has also made several announcements under Regulation 30 (LODR), including updates on acquisitions and analyst/investor meets. Phoenix Mills is trading as one of the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 at Rs 1,585.50, with a rise of 4.51% at 10:00 am.

title: Godrej Properties shares rise 2.12% in morning trade
content: Shares of Godrej Properties gained 2.12% to trade at Rs 1,993.60 in Tuesday's session. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On the financial front, Godrej Properties has demonstrated substantial growth in both quarterly and annual results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 434.56 Crore, while the net profit was Rs 625.59 Crore, resulting in an EPS of Rs 19.92. The company's annual performance also shows significant improvements. For the year-ending March 2025, the consolidated revenue reached Rs 4,922.84 Crore, a notable increase compared to Rs 3,035.62 Crore in March 2024. The net profit soared to Rs 1,507.83 Crore, up from Rs 719.32 Crore in the previous year, with the EPS rising to Rs 49.02 from Rs 26.09. Key financial metrics for Godrej Properties show a mix of growth and stability. The company's revenue has increased steadily over the past five years, with a substantial rise in net profit. The debt-to-equity ratio stood at 0.73 as of March 2025. The following table summarizes the key financial data for Godrej Properties:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPSBVPSROEDebt to Equity2021Rs 764.92 Crore-Rs 73.36 Crore-Rs 7.48Rs 299.33-2.270.542022Rs 1,824.88 CroreRs 539.28 CroreRs 12.68Rs 312.024.060.602023Rs 2,252.26 CroreRs 661.33 CroreRs 20.55Rs 334.056.160.692024Rs 3,035.62 CroreRs 719.32 CroreRs 26.09Rs 370.507.251.072025Rs 4,922.84 CroreRs 1,507.83 CroreRs 49.02Rs 574.828.080.73Godrej Properties announced several corporate actions, including analyst/investor meets and press releases. On August 25, 2025, the company informed the exchange regarding a press release. The company had a split in the past where Old FV was Rs 10 and New FV was Rs 5. The ex-split date was November 21, 2013 and record date was November 22, 2013. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,993.60, Godrej Properties has seen a rise of 2.12% in Tuesday's session.

title: HUDCO shares rise 2.06%; among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of HUDCO gained 2.06% to trade at Rs 215.71 in today's session. The stock is among the top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150. On the financial front, Housing & Urban Development Corp's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,937.31 Crore, compared to Rs 2,844.99 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025, and Rs 2,188.35 Crore in the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 630.23 Crore, down from Rs 727.74 Crore in the previous quarter, but up from Rs 557.75 Crore in the same quarter last year. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 3.15, compared to Rs 3.64 in the previous quarter and Rs 2.79 in the quarter-ending June 2024.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 2,188.35 CroreRs 2,517.72 CroreRs 2,760.23 CroreRs 2,844.99 CroreRs 2,937.31 CroreNet ProfitRs 557.75 CroreRs 688.62 CroreRs 735.03 CroreRs 727.74 CroreRs 630.23 CroreEPS2.793.443.673.643.15The company's consolidated annual revenue has shown consistent growth over the past few years. title: Mobikwik shares jump 11% as ADIA fully exits stake via block deal
content: Shares of One Mobikwik Systems surged 11 percent to Rs 262 apiece on September 2 after key shareholder Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) exited its stake in the payments solutions provider via block deals a day earlier. According to block deal data on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), ADIA sold 16.44 lakh equity shares of Mobikwik at an average price of Rs 238.45 per share, taking the total deal value to Rs 39.21 crore. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog The number of shares offloaded represents 2.1 percent of Mobikwikâ€™s outstanding equity, which matches ADIAâ€™s stake as per the June quarter shareholding pattern. Apart from ADIA, Peak XV Partners (9.92 percent), Cisco Systems (1.54 percent), and American Express Travel Related Services Company Inc. (1.34 percent) are among the prominent public shareholders in Mobikwik. Other foreign portfolio investors include Government Pension Fund Global (3.01 percent), Societe Generale (1.2 percent), and Citigroup Global Markets (1.12 percent). On the earnings front, Mobikwik reported a consolidated loss of Rs 41.9 crore for the June quarter, as its high-margin financial services business came under pressure amid ongoing strategic overhaul efforts. The company expects recovery and EBITDA breakeven by the second half of fiscal 2026. Revenue from operations stood at Rs 271.3 crore, down 20.7 percent from Rs 342.2 crore in Q1 FY25. Sequentially, losses narrowed from Rs 56 crore in Q4 FY25, while revenue saw a marginal uptick of 1.3 percent. Over the last month, Mobikwik shares have gained 12 percent, outperforming the flat-to-positive trend in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Sugar stocks rally up to 20% after govt allows ethanol production from sugarcane juice, molasses
content: Sugar stocks surged in morning trade on September 2 after the government decided to remove limits on ethanol production from sugarcane juice, sugar syrup, and molasses for the year 2025-26. The government had restricted production of ethanol from sugarcane juice, syrup and all types of molasses in the current marketing year amid a drop in sugarcane supplies. In the new ethanol supply year starting from November 1, sugar mills and distilleries will be allowed to produce ethanol without any quantitative restriction, the Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food & Public Distribution said. The Department of Food and Public Distribution (DFPD) will periodically review the sugar diversion to ethanol to ensure year-round domestic availability of the sweetener, it said. This comes as sugarcane supplies are expected to jump in the new season as ample monsoon rains for two straight years have helped farmers expand area under the crop. Balrampur Chini Mills shares jumped more than 7 percent to trade at Rs 580 apiece, while Shree Renuka Sugars shares rallied over 15 percent to trade at Rs 33 apiece. Bajaj Hindusthan Sugar and Godavari Biorefineries shares gained 12 percent and 5 percent respectively. Uttam Sugar Mills shares rallied over 9 percent, while Dhampur Sugar Mills and Magadh Sugar & Energy shares were trading around 10 percent higher. Triveni Engineering shares were up 4.5 percent, while Dwarikesh Sugar and other stocks gained up to 14 percent. Smallcap stock Rajshree Sugars & Chemicals meanwhile surged 20 percent to hit the upper circuit at Rs 45.26 apiece. Earlier yesterday, the Supreme Court dismissed a plea which challenged the nationwide rollout of 20 percent Ethanol Blended Petrol (EBP-20). The petitioner had alleged that vehicles manufactured in India prior to April 2023 are not compatible with ethanol mix petrol. Vehicles as new as 2 years old are also not compatible with ethanol mixed petrol wherein the percentage of ethanol is 20 percent, despite the cars being BS-VI compliant, the person added. The plea, filed by advocate Akshay Malhotra, had sought a direction to the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas to ensure availability of ethanol-free petrol at all fuel stations. A bench headed by Chief Justice of India BR Gavai, along with Justice K Vinod Chandran, dismissed the plea. Attorney General R Venkataramani, opposing the petition, said that the matter had already been thoroughly examined before the policyâ€™s rollout. He alleged that the petitioner was merely a â€œfrontâ€ for a larger lobby and stressed that the policy benefits sugarcane farmers while also conserving foreign exchange. â€œShould people outside the country decide what fuel India should use?â€ the AG remarked. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates
summary_lexrank: Balrampur Chini Mills shares jumped more than 7 percent to trade at Rs 580 apiece, while Shree Renuka Sugars shares rallied over 15 percent to trade at Rs 33 apiece.
summary_luhn: Sugar stocks surged in morning trade on September 2 after the government decided to remove limits on ethanol production from sugarcane juice, sugar syrup, and molasses for the year 2025-26.
summary_lsa: The petitioner had alleged that vehicles manufactured in India prior to April 2023 are not compatible with ethanol mix petrol.
summary_textrank: The Department of Food and Public Distribution (DFPD) will periodically review the sugar diversion to ethanol to ensure year-round domestic availability of the sweetener, it said.

title: Dr Reddys Labs share price falls 1.23%; stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Dr Reddys Labs were trading lower in Tuesday's session. The stock was priced at Rs 1,264.20, a decline of 1.23% on the NSE. At 9:30 am, the stock was identified among the top losers on the Nifty 50 index. Other stocks that were identified among the top losers on the Nifty 50 included Asian Paints, Hindalco, Tata Motors and Trent. Dr Reddys Labs is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,264.20, Dr Reddys Labs saw a decline of 1.23% from its previous close. Financial Performance of Dr Reddys Labs Here's an overview of Dr Reddys Labs' consolidated financial performance, with data on quarterly and yearly revenue and net profit. Quarterly Performance The consolidated revenue for Dr Reddys Labs in June 2025 was reported as Rs 8,938.55 Crore, slightly down from Rs 8,969.73 Crore in June 2024. The consolidated net profit for June 2025 stood at Rs 1,080.73 Crore, compared to Rs 1,150.07 Crore in the same quarter of the previous year. title: Dabur India shares rise 2.26% in early trade
content: Shares of Dabur India gained 2.26% to trade at Rs 535.50 in early trade. The stock's performance is noteworthy as it is a constituent of the NIFTY NEXT 50 index. On the financial front, Dabur India's consolidated quarterly revenue has shown fluctuations. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2024 was Rs 3,349.11 Crore, which decreased to Rs 3,028.59 Crore for the quarter-ending September 2024. It then increased to Rs 3,355.25 Crore for the quarter-ending December 2024, before falling to Rs 2,830.14 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The most recent quarter, ending June 2025, saw a rise to Rs 3,404.58 Crore. The net profit figures followed a similar trend. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2024 was Rs 494.55 Crore, which decreased to Rs 417.28 Crore for the quarter-ending September 2024. It then increased to Rs 515.32 Crore for the quarter-ending December 2024, before falling to Rs 312.72 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The quarter-ending June 2025, showed a rise to Rs 508.69 Crore. Earnings per share (EPS) also varied. EPS for the quarter-ending June 2024 was Rs 2.82, decreasing to Rs 2.40 for the quarter-ending September 2024. It increased to Rs 2.95 for the quarter-ending December 2024, then fell to Rs 1.81 for the quarter-ending March 2025, and rose again to Rs 2.90 for the quarter-ending June 2025. The following table summarizes the consolidated quarterly financial performance of Dabur India:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 3,349.11 CroreRs 3,028.59 CroreRs 3,355.25 CroreRs 2,830.14 CroreRs 3,404.58 CroreNet ProfitRs 494.55 CroreRs 417.28 CroreRs 515.32 CroreRs 312.72 CroreRs 508.69 CroreEPS2.822.402.951.812.90Dabur India's consolidated annual revenue has shown consistent growth over the years. In 2021, the revenue stood at Rs 9,546.60 Crore, increasing to Rs 10,888.68 Crore in 2022, Rs 11,529.89 Crore in 2023, Rs 12,404.01 Crore in 2024 and Rs 12,563.09 Crore in 2025. The net profit for the same period has also been relatively stable. In 2021, the net profit was Rs 1,695.96 Crore, increasing to Rs 1,744.10 Crore in 2022. There was a slight decrease to Rs 1,702.96 Crore in 2023, followed by an increase to Rs 1,811.82 Crore in 2024 and then a decrease to Rs 1,739.87 Crore in 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) has also seen fluctuations. The EPS in 2021 was Rs 9.58, increasing to Rs 9.84 in 2022 and decreasing to Rs 9.64 in 2023. It then increased to Rs 10.40 in 2024 before decreasing to Rs 9.97 in 2025. Book Value Per Share (BVPS) has steadily increased from Rs 43.57 in 2021 to Rs 60.94 in 2025. The Return on Equity (ROE) has decreased from 22.09 in 2021 to 16.36 in 2025. The debt to equity ratio has fluctuated, standing at 0.06 in 2021, increasing to 0.10 in 2022 and 0.11 in 2023 and 0.12 in 2024 before decreasing to 0.07 in 2025. The following table presents the consolidated annual financial data for Dabur India:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 9,546.60 CroreRs 10,888.68 CroreRs 11,529.89 CroreRs 12,404.01 CroreRs 12,563.09 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,695.96 CroreRs 1,744.10 CroreRs 1,702.96 CroreRs 1,811.82 CroreRs 1,739.87 CroreEPS9.589.849.6410.409.97BVPS43.5747.6453.2958.1460.94ROE22.0920.7519.0218.6716.36Debt to Equity0.060.100.110.120.07The annual income statement provides additional insights. Sales increased from Rs 9,546 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 12,563 Crore in March 2025. Other income also rose from Rs 325 Crore to Rs 550 Crore during the same period. Total income increased from Rs 9,871 Crore to Rs 13,113 Crore. Total expenditure increased from Rs 7,784 Crore to Rs 10,692 Crore. Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT) increased from Rs 2,087 Crore to Rs 2,420 Crore. Interest expenses rose from Rs 30 Crore to Rs 163 Crore, while tax expenses increased from Rs 361 Crore to Rs 517 Crore. Net profit increased from Rs 1,695 Crore to Rs 1,739 Crore. The following table summarizes the consolidated annual income statement of Dabur India:Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 12,563 CroreRs 12,404 CroreRs 11,529 CroreRs 10,888 CroreRs 9,546 CroreOther IncomeRs 550 CroreRs 482 CroreRs 445 CroreRs 393 CroreRs 325 CroreTotal IncomeRs 13,113 CroreRs 12,886 CroreRs 11,975 CroreRs 11,281 CroreRs 9,871 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 10,692 CroreRs 10,402 CroreRs 9,676 CroreRs 8,972 CroreRs 7,784 CroreEBITRs 2,420 CroreRs 2,483 CroreRs 2,298 CroreRs 2,309 CroreRs 2,087 CroreInterestRs 163 CroreRs 124 CroreRs 78 CroreRs 38 CroreRs 30 CroreTaxRs 517 CroreRs 547 CroreRs 517 CroreRs 526 CroreRs 361 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,739 CroreRs 1,811 CroreRs 1,702 CroreRs 1,744 CroreRs 1,695 CroreCorporate actions for Dabur India include several announcements. On August 13, 2025, the Exchange received a disclosure under Regulation 29(2) of SEBI (SAST) Regulations, 2011 for Asha Burman. On August 8, 2025, M/s Chandrasekaran Associates, Company Secretaries were appointed as Secretarial Auditors for 5 consecutive years and Mr. Mukesh Hari Butani was re-appointed as a Non-Executive Independent Director for a second term of 5 consecutive years. Dabur India has announced several dividends. A final dividend of Rs 5.25 per share was announced on May 7, 2025, effective July 18, 2025. Prior dividends include an interim dividend of Rs 2.75 per share announced on October 17, 2024, effective November 8, 2024, and a final dividend of Rs 2.75 per share announced on May 2, 2024, effective July 19, 2024. Dabur India has a history of bonus issues. The most recent bonus was announced on July 26, 2010, with an existing ratio of 1:1 and an ex-bonus date of September 8, 2010. Other bonus issues were announced on October 31, 2006 (1:2), October 24, 2005 (1:1), and September 30, 1993 (4:1). Dabur India had one stock split on November 3, 2000, with the old face value of Rs 10 split to a new face value of Rs 1, with exsplit date as November 27, 2000. According to Moneycontrol analysis as of August 28, 2025, the sentiment for Dabur India is neutral. The stock's performance is noteworthy as it is a constituent of the NIFTY NEXT 50 index.

Earlier dividends include an interim dividend of Rs 19 per share (1900%) and a special dividend of Rs 10 per share (1000%) announced on October 10, 2024, with effective date as November 06, 2024. The company has a history of bonus issues, including a 1:2 bonus ratio on September 30, 1991 (ex-bonus date: July 19, 1991), and a 1:1 bonus ratio on June 22, 1987. A stock split was announced on July 05, 2000, with an old face value of Rs 10 and a new face value of Rs 1 (ex-split date: July 03, 2000). Moneycontrol analysis indicates very bullish sentiment for Hindustan Unilever as of September 02, 2025. Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading at Rs 2,654.90 on Tuesday, up 0.20% from the previous close, as of 9:30 am.

title: Bharti Airtel shares rise marginally in early trade
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading at Rs 1,906.80 on Tuesday, up 0.33% from the previous close, at 9:30 am. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. Financial Snapshot: The following table summarizes the consolidated financial performance of Bharti Airtel:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 38,506.40 CroreRs 41,473.30 CroreRs 45,129.30 CroreRs 47,876.20 CroreRs 49,462.60 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,805.80 CroreRs 3,079.50 CroreRs 14,474.90 CroreRs 12,418.10 CroreRs 7,339.00 CroreEPS7.216.2125.5419.0210.26The company's revenue has shown consistent growth over the quarters, with revenue increasing from Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 49,462.60 Crore in June 2025. Net profit saw a significant increase in December 2024 and March 2025 before decreasing to Rs 7,339.00 Crore in June 2025. EPS also followed a similar trend, reaching 25.54 in December 2024 before declining to 10.26 in June 2025. Annual Financial Performance: The table below presents the consolidated annual financial data for Bharti Airtel:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 100,615.80 CroreRs 116,546.90 CroreRs 139,144.80 CroreRs 149,982.40 CroreRs 172,985.20 CroreNet Profit-Rs 23,327.90 CroreRs 5,882.00 CroreRs 11,535.30 CroreRs 5,848.60 CroreRs 33,778.30 CroreEPS-27.657.6714.8013.0958.00BVPS147.90164.46210.95216.40226.16ROE-25.586.399.197.3925.58Debt to Equity2.202.001.821.501.13The yearly data reveals a strong growth trajectory. Revenue increased consistently from Rs 100,615.80 Crore in 2021 to Rs 172,985.20 Crore in 2025. The company moved from a net loss of Rs 23,327.90 Crore in 2021 to a net profit of Rs 33,778.30 Crore in 2025. EPS also improved significantly, from -27.65 in 2021 to 58.00 in 2025. announcements: On May 13, 2025, a final dividend of Rs.16.00 per share (320%) was announced, effective July 18, 2025. On May 14, 2024, a dividend of Rs.8.00 per share (160%) was announced, effective August 7, 2024. On May 16, 2023, a final dividend of Rs.4.00 per share (80%) was announced, effective August 11, 2023. The company had a stock split on July 24, 2009, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split into a new face value of Rs 5. On August 29, 2021, the company announced a rights issue with an existing ratio of 14 and an offered ratio of 1, a face value of Rs 5, and a premium of Rs 530. The record date was September 28, 2021, and the ex-rights date was September 27, 2021, with a rights ratio of 1:14. Bharti Airtel was trading at Rs 1,906.80 in the current session.

title: Apollo Tyres shares surge 3.31% amid high volume in early trade
content: Shares of Apollo Tyres gained 3.31% to trade at Rs 483.10 in early trade today, driven by high volume. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. The company's consolidated financial performance shows consistent revenue growth. The annual revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 26,123.42 Crore, compared to Rs 25,377.72 Crore in the previous year. Net profit for the same period was Rs 1,120.65 Crore, down from Rs 1,721.51 Crore in the previous year. The companyâ€™s earnings per share (EPS) stood at Rs 17.66 for the year ending March 2025. Here's a summary of Apollo Tyres' key annual financial data:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROEDebt to EquityMar 202117,397.00350.195.68180.183.060.45Mar 202220,947.58638.5010.06185.045.430.52Mar 202324,568.131,104.3917.39202.778.570.43Mar 202425,377.721,721.5127.11218.9012.380.28Mar 202526,123.421,120.6517.66232.497.590.23The company's revenue increased by approximately 29.47% from Rs 20,212.13 Crore in 2022 to Rs 26,123.42 Crore in 2025. The net profit witnessed an increase of approximately 7.59% from Rs 1,043.39 Crore in 2023 to Rs 1,120.65 Crore in 2025. Apollo Tyres' quarterly consolidated revenue has shown a rising trend over the past five quarters. The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 6,560.76 Crore, up from Rs 6,334.85 Crore in June 2024. However, the net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 was significantly lower at Rs 12.82 Crore compared to Rs 301.98 Crore in the same quarter last year.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 20246,334.85301.984.76Sep 20246,437.03297.314.68Dec 20246,927.95337.045.31Mar 20256,423.59184.322.91Jun 20256,560.7612.820.20The total income for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 6,579 crore as compared to Rs 6,365 crore in June 2024. Apollo Tyres announced a final dividend of Rs 5.00 per share with effective date as July 11, 2025. Earlier splits happened on August 17, 2007, where old face value of 10 was split to new face value of 1. The annual ratios for Apollo Tyres show a Debt to Equity ratio of 0.23 as of March 2025. Valuation ratios include a P/E ratio of 24.13 and a P/B ratio of 1.83 as of March 2025. As of August 26, 2025, Moneycontrol analysis gave the stock a neutral sentiment.

title: Endurance Technologies shares fall 2.35% in early trade
content: Shares of Endurance Technologies declined by 2.35% to Rs 2,870.90 in early trade. The fall comes as the stock is trading on the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index at 9:32 am. The stock's movement reflects a price fall of 2 percent. Endurance Technologies Limited is enclosing newspaper advertisements published on August 26, 2025, in the Financial Express (English) and the Loksatta (Marathi), giving public notice under the Investor Education and Protection Fund Authorityâ€™s campaign, â€œSaksham Niveshakâ€. title: Larsen & Toubro shares trade marginally higher in early session
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading at Rs 3,601.80 in Tuesday's early session, up by 0.09% from the previous close at 9:20 am. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. Financial Performance: Consolidated Quarterly Results: The company's consolidated quarterly revenue has shown consistent growth. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,678.92 Crore, compared to Rs 55,119.82 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 4,325.57 Crore, up from Rs 3,440.11 Crore. title: MRF shares rise 2.05% in early trade, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150 today
content: Shares of MRF gained 2.05% in Tuesday's early trading session, with the stock price reaching Rs 147,800. The rise positions the stock among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. At 09:26 am, the stock demonstrated positive movement. Regarding MRF's financial performance, the consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 7,675.69 Crore, compared to Rs 7,196.45 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 500.47 Crore, while in June 2024, it was Rs 571.02 Crore. The EPS for June 2025 stood at Rs 1,180.04, down from Rs 1,346.38 in June 2024. The company's consolidated yearly revenue has shown consistent growth. In March 2025, revenue reached Rs 28,153.18 Crore, compared to Rs 25,169.21 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 1,869.29 Crore, while in March 2024, it was Rs 2,081.23 Crore. The EPS for March 2025 stood at Rs 4,407.51, down from Rs 4,907.24 in March 2024. title: Premier Energies shares rise 2.09% in early trade on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Premier Energies saw a 2.09% increase, trading at Rs 1,058.05 in Tuesday's early session, as of 9:23 am. Premier Energies is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Performance: Premier Energies' financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the recent quarters and years. Hereâ€™s a summary of their consolidated financial results: Quarterly Results: The company has demonstrated strong quarterly performance, with both revenue and net profit showing an upward trend.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,657.37 CroreRs 1,527.22 CroreRs 1,713.32 CroreRs 1,620.84 CroreRs 1,820.74 CroreNet ProfitRs 197.50 CroreRs 205.90 CroreRs 255.08 CroreRs 277.93 CroreRs 307.55 CroreEPS5.505.715.666.166.83Revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,820.74 Crore, which is an increase compared to Rs 1,657.37 Crore in June 2024. Similarly, the net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 307.55 Crore, up from Rs 197.50 Crore in June 2024. title: Nifty top gainers: Reliance, Coal India, NTPC stocks leading the index in early trade
content: Indian markets opened with positive momentum on Tuesday, September 2, 2025, with several stocks showing notable gains. Among the top performers on the Nifty 50 were Reliance, Coal India, and NTPC. At 09:25 am, Reliance was trading at Rs 1,370.80, marking a 1.25% increase. Coal India followed with a price of Rs 381.90, up by 1.06%. NTPC was also up, trading at Rs 333.15, a gain of 0.74%. Other gainers included Bajaj Finance, trading at Rs 894.05 with a 0.53% increase, and TATA Cons. Prod, which reached Rs 1,080.20, up by 0.42%. Coal India Financial Overview: Coal India has also shown strong financial results. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 143,368 Crore, compared to Rs 142,323 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 34,839 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 36,942 Crore reported in the year-ending March 2024. Key financial ratios for Coal India include a basic EPS of Rs 57.37 and a diluted EPS of Rs 57.37 as of March 2025. The book value per share was Rs 160.81. The company's return on net worth stood at 35.67%, with a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.09 as of the year-ending March 2025. The following table summarizes the key financial figures for Coal India:HeadingMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021RevenueRs 143,368 CroreRs 142,323 CroreRs 138,251 CroreRs 109,713 CroreRs 90,026 CroreNet ProfitRs 34,839 CroreRs 36,942 CroreRs 28,133 CroreRs 17,387 CroreRs 12,705 CroreEPSRs 57.37Rs 60.69Rs 45.70Rs 28.17Rs 20.61BVPSRs 160.81Rs 135.62Rs 94.14Rs 71.10Rs 59.97ROE35.6745.2149.2040.2334.77Debt to Equity0.090.080.070.080.16NTPC Financial Overview: NTPC's financial performance also reflects growth. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 188,138 Crore, up from Rs 178,500 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 21,739 Crore, an increase from the Rs 19,696 Crore reported in the year-ending March 2024. Key financial ratios for NTPC show a basic EPS of Rs 20.34 and a diluted EPS of Rs 20.34 as of March 2025. The book value per share was Rs 189.83. The company's return on net worth stood at 12.72%, with a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.34 as of the year-ending March 2025. The following table summarizes the key financial figures for NTPC:HeadingMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021RevenueRs 188,138 CroreRs 178,500 CroreRs 176,206 CroreRs 132,669 CroreRs 111,531 CroreNet ProfitRs 21,739 CroreRs 19,696 CroreRs 16,341 CroreRs 15,940 CroreRs 14,285 CroreEPSRs 20.34Rs 21.46Rs 17.44Rs 17.20Rs 14.87BVPSRs 189.83Rs 165.74Rs 155.68Rs 143.49Rs 133.31ROE12.7212.9511.5012.3111.63Debt to Equity1.341.461.501.551.57TATA Cons. Prod Financial Overview: TATA Cons. Prod also exhibited consistent financial growth. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 17,618 Crore, compared to Rs 15,205 Crore in the previous year. Net profit for the same period was Rs 1,380 Crore, slightly higher than the Rs 1,300 Crore reported in the year-ending March 2024. Key financial ratios for TATA Cons. Prod show a basic EPS of Rs 13.06 and a diluted EPS of Rs 13.06 as of March 2025. The book value per share was Rs 202.13. The company's return on net worth stood at 6.39%, with a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.09 as of the year-ending March 2025. The following table summarizes the key financial figures for TATA Cons. In addition, the company had a bonus issue on September 5, 2024, with an ex-bonus date of October 28, 2024, in the ratio of 1:1. Coal India:Provisional Production And Off-Take Performance Of CIL And Subsidiary Companies For The Month Of August'25 And For The Period Apr'25-Aug'25General Updates- Disclosure under Regulation 30 of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements), Regulations 2015Appointment Of M/S. T Chatterjee & Associates, Company Secretaries, FRN. Bajaj Finance:Allotment of equity shares under Employee Stock Option Scheme, 2009Newspaper publication regarding Special window for re-lodgement of transfer deedsMoody s Ratings has assigned the Company a new rating Baa3 Corporate family rating (CFR) with outlook as StableBajaj Finance announced a final dividend of Rs 44 per share (2200%) with an effective date of May 30, 2025 and a special dividend of Rs 12 per share (600%) with an effective date of May 9, 2025. The company also had a bonus issue on April 29, 2025, with an ex-bonus date of June 16, 2025, in the ratio of 4:1, and also the company had a stock split from old FV of 2 to new FV of 1 on 16 Jun, 2025. TATA Cons. Prod:Allotment of equity shares under Employee Stock Option Scheme, 2009Intimation of Analyst/Institutional Call/ Meet is enclosedTATA Cons. Prod announced a final dividend of Rs 8.25 per share (825%) with an effective date of May 29, 2025. With Reliance trading at Rs 1,370.80, Coal India at Rs 381.90 and NTPC at Rs 333.15, these stocks reflected positive investor sentiment in the early trading session.

title: JSW Infrastructure shares rise 2.01% in early trade on Nifty Midcap 150
content: JSW Infrastructure shares gained 2.01% to trade at Rs 304.45 in early trade on Tuesday. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On the financial front, JSW Infrastructure has demonstrated consistent growth in both quarterly and annual results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,223.85 Crore, compared to Rs 1,283.18 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the same quarter was Rs 389.57 Crore, against Rs 515.58 Crore in the previous quarter. The consolidated annual revenue for the year ending March 2025 reached Rs 4,476.14 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 3,762.89 Crore in the previous year. The net profit also saw a substantial rise, reaching Rs 1,521.48 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 1,160.69 Crore in the previous year. Key financial metrics for JSW Infrastructure are detailed below:ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,009.77 CroreRs 1,001.36 CroreRs 1,181.83 CroreRs 1,283.18 CroreRs 1,223.85 CroreNet ProfitRs 296.55 CroreRs 373.73 CroreRs 335.62 CroreRs 515.58 CroreRs 389.57 CroreEPS1.421.801.592.461.85The revenue for the quarter ending Jun 2025 was Rs 1,223.85 Crore, an increase compared to revenue of Rs 1,009.77 Crore in Jun 2024.Particulars20212022202320242025RevenueRs 1,603.57 CroreRs 2,273.06 CroreRs 3,194.74 CroreRs 3,762.89 CroreRs 4,476.14 CroreNet ProfitRs 284.62 CroreRs 330.44 CroreRs 749.51 CroreRs 1,160.69 CroreRs 1,521.48 CroreEPS1.621.824.126.017.27BVPS515.35579.3322.7440.1246.77ROE10.0710.0218.5214.4015.50Debt to Equity1.361.351.060.550.48The company's annual revenue has consistently increased, with a jump of approximately 19% from 2024 to 2025.Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 4,476 CroreRs 3,762 CroreRs 3,194 CroreRs 2,273 CroreRs 1,603 CroreOther IncomeRs 352 CroreRs 269 CroreRs 178 CroreRs 105 CroreRs 74 CroreTotal IncomeRs 4,829 CroreRs 4,032 CroreRs 3,372 CroreRs 2,378 CroreRs 1,678 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 2,760 CroreRs 2,234 CroreRs 1,965 CroreRs 1,533 CroreRs 1,057 CroreEBITRs 2,068 CroreRs 1,797 CroreRs 1,407 CroreRs 845 CroreRs 620 CroreInterestRs 265 CroreRs 332 CroreRs 596 CroreRs 419 CroreRs 227 CroreTaxRs 281 CroreRs 304 CroreRs 61 CroreRs 95 CroreRs 108 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,521 CroreRs 1,160 CroreRs 749 CroreRs 330 CroreRs 284 CroreJSW Infrastructure announced a final dividend of Rs 0.80 per share on April 30, 2025, with an effective date of July 1, 2025. Prior to this, a final dividend of Rs 0.55 per share was announced on May 3, 2024, and was effective from July 19, 2024. With the stock currently trading at Rs 304.45, JSW Infrastructure showcases significant financial growth and recent corporate actions.

The board of directors declared a final dividend of Rs 5 per share on May 17, 2024, with the ex-date as August 20, 2024. Phoenix Mills underwent a stock split, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split to a new face value of Rs 2. The ex-date for this split was February 13, 2008. The stock showed positive movement in today's session.

title: TVS Motor shares hit all time high of Rs 3,378.25 on BSE, slip into red later
content: Shares of TVS Motor Company reached an all-time high of Rs 3,378.25 on the BSE in the opening trade on Tuesday, gaining 0.7% from the previous close. The stock -- a constituent of the Nifty Next 50 index -- soon gave up gains and slipped into red, trading down 0.5% at Rs 3,339.6. title: UNO Minda shares gain to hit all-time high in early trade today
content: UNO Minda shares reached an all-time high of Rs 1,322.85 on the BSE in early trading hours, gaining 0.6% from the previous close. At 9:20 am, the stock was trading at Rs 1,314.60. This performance places the stock among the gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Highlights UNO Minda's financial performance shows consistent growth in both quarterly and annual results. Hereâ€™s a summary of the companyâ€™s financials: Consolidated Quarterly Results: The revenue and net profit for the recent quarters are as follows:QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPSJun 20243,817.51174.103.47Sep 20244,244.79217.734.27Dec 20244,183.99213.894.05Mar 20254,528.32234.574.63Jun 20254,489.09261.775.06The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 4,489.09 Crore, compared to Rs 3,817.51 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 261.77 Crore, up from Rs 174.10 Crore in June 2024. title: Eicher Motors shares gain to hit 52-week high of Rs 6,313 on BSE
content: Shares of Eicher Motors touched a 52-week high of Rs 6,313.00 on BSE in the opening trade on Tuesday. The stock gained 0.5%, before partially giving up the gains. Financial Performance: Eicher Motors' consolidated revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 5,041.84 Crore, compared to Rs 5,241.11 Crore in March 2025, Rs 4,973.12 Crore in December 2024, Rs 4,263.07 Crore in September 2024, and Rs 4,393.05 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 1,048.11 Crore, compared to Rs 1,114.16 Crore in March 2025, Rs 1,006.99 Crore in December 2024, Rs 986.58 Crore in September 2024, and Rs 926.90 Crore in June 2024. The EPS for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 43.95, compared to Rs 49.69 in March 2025, Rs 42.70 in December 2024, Rs 40.15 in September 2024, and Rs 40.21 in June 2024. The annual consolidated revenue for 2025 was Rs 18,870.35 Crore, compared to Rs 16,535.78 Crore in 2024, Rs 14,442.18 Crore in 2023, Rs 10,297.83 Crore in 2022 and Rs 8,720.35 Crore in 2021. title: IndusInd Bank appoints Pragati Gondhalekar as head of internal audit, days after Rajiv Anand takes over as CEO
content: IndusInd Bank has appointed Pragati Gondhalekar as the head of Internal Audit of the lender, a company filing said on September 1, a step that will be seen as a measure to enhance banks' oversight on internal operations. Share of IndusInd Bank are quiet in the trading session, after a 22 percent fall on YTD basis, and a 48 percent drop over the last one year. This comes following the appointment of Rajiv Anand as the managing director and chief executive officer of the bank. The lender has faced a series of exits at senior level since April this year, including CEO Sumant Kathpalia, after discrepancies in derivatives accounting and MFI books were reported. The irregularities in the microfinance book were reported as fraud committed against the bank. Prior to joining IndusInd Bank, Pragati Gondhalekar was the country head â€“ group audit, India at Deutsche Bank. She has also held leadership roles at L&T Financial, PwC, among others. The bank's net profit fell by 68% on-year during the June quarter, weighed down by a sharp rise in provisions. The lender has been focusing on rebuilding the senior leadership team after the recent setbacks on the accounting crisis, and the subsequent regulatory glare. "...wherever there were any open gaps, we are looking at both internal and external candidates and sort of filling that up. And I think all the building blocks from a management leadership team are being looked at very closely. And we are hopeful that a lot of these positions will get filled up in due course," chairman Sunil Mehta had told analysts during the June quarter earnings call. "I feel that whatever we have witnessed over the last 3 to 4 months, it should have never happened. But since it did happen, we have learnt a lot of lessons from the same. We are making good progress in addressing all those issues of the past and certainly looking forward in building the Bank of the future," Mehta had said at the analyst call in July.
summary_lexrank: IndusInd Bank has appointed Pragati Gondhalekar as the head of Internal Audit of the lender, a company filing said on September 1, a step that will be seen as a measure to enhance banks' oversight on internal operations.
summary_luhn: IndusInd Bank has appointed Pragati Gondhalekar as the head of Internal Audit of the lender, a company filing said on September 1, a step that will be seen as a measure to enhance banks' oversight on internal operations.
summary_lsa: The lender has faced a series of exits at senior level since April this year, including CEO Sumant Kathpalia, after discrepancies in derivatives accounting and MFI books were reported.
summary_textrank: We are making good progress in addressing all those issues of the past and certainly looking forward in building the Bank of the future," Mehta had said at the analyst call in July.

Other announcements include a collaboration with Mastercard to scale cross-border payments (August 28, 2025) and Uniting Financial Services, Australia subscribing to Infosys Finacle's Digital Banking SaaS Suite on AWS Cloud (August 20, 2025). The company announced a final dividend of Rs 22 per share (440%) on April 17, 2025, with an effective date of May 30, 2025. Prior dividends include an interim dividend of Rs 21 per share (420%) announced on October 17, 2024, and a final dividend of Rs 20 per share (400%) and a special dividend of Rs 8 per share (160%) announced on April 18, 2024. Infosys has a history of bonus issues, including a 1:1 bonus on July 13, 2018, June 15, 2015, December 2, 2014, and July 13, 2006, and a 3:1 bonus on July 1, 2004. A stock split was announced on November 30, 1999, with the old face value of Rs 10 split into a new face value of Rs 5, effective January 24, 2000. Moneycontrol analysis, as of August 28, 2025, suggests a neutral sentiment on Infosys stock.

title: ITC share price declines nearly 1% in Monday's trading session
content: Shares of ITC experienced a decline of 0.95% in the previous session, with the stock price settling at Rs 405.85. The stock traded between a high of Rs 410.20 and a low of Rs 405.00 on Monday. Financial Performance: ITC's financial performance reveals key insights from both quarterly and annual results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 21,494.79 Crore, marking an increase compared to Rs 18,457.33 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same quarter was Rs 5,274.65 Crore, up from Rs 5,169.37 Crore in the previous year. The EPS also increased to Rs 4.19 in June 2025 from Rs 4.08 in June 2024. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 75,323.34 Crore, an increase from Rs 70,881.00 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 19,926.05 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 20,723.75 Crore recorded in the previous year. The EPS, however, saw a significant rise, reaching Rs 27.79 in March 2025 compared to Rs 16.42 in March 2024. (x)4.464.956.897.187.32EV/EBITDA (x)13.4813.5517.0818.2317.86P/S (x)5.465.096.727.556.81Corporate Actions: ITC has announced several corporate actions, including the allotment of shares under the Employee Stock Option Schemes. According to an announcement on August 19, 2025, shares were allotted under the company's Employee Stock Option Schemes. The company also published a notice on August 12, 2025, regarding the re-lodgement of transfer requests for shares held in physical form. Additionally, ITC released its Media Statement and Investor Presentation for Q1 FY 2025-26 on August 1, 2025. Dividends and Bonus: ITC has a history of distributing dividends, with a final dividend of Rs 7.85 per share (785%) announced on May 22, 2025, and an effective date of May 28, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 6.50 per share (650%) was announced on February 6, 2025, with an effective date of February 12, 2025. ITC has also issued bonus shares in the past, with notable bonus ratios including 1:2 (announced on May 20, 2016, exbonus date July 1, 2016), 1:1 (announced on June 18, 2010, exbonus date August 3, 2010), and 1:2 (announced on June 17, 2005, exbonus date September 21, 2005). Stock Splits: ITC underwent a stock split on September 21, 2005, where the old face value of Rs 10 was split into a new face value of Rs 1. ITC's last traded price in Monday's trading was Rs 405.85. The company has a consistent history of rewarding shareholders through dividends and has undertaken corporate actions to enhance shareholder value.

title: Samvardhana Motherson shares rise 4.3% on Monday, among top gainers on Nifty Next 50
content: Shares of Samvardhana Motherson ended positively in Monday's session. The stock was among the top gainers on the Nifty Next 50 index, rising 4.3% to Rs 96.74 at yesterday's close. Financial Snapshot: Here's a look at the key financial figures for Motherson: Income Statement (Consolidated): Annual: In March 2025, the company's sales reached Rs 113,662 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 98,691 Crore in March 2024. Total income also increased to Rs 114,220 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 98,879 Crore in March 2024. The EBIT was Rs 6,616 Crore in March 2025, up from Rs 5,413 Crore in March 2024. (x)2.643.032.023.065.07EV/EBITDA (x)9.259.688.4814.6215.79P/S (x)0.810.800.580.991.11Corporate Actions: Samvardhana Motherson International Limited's board approved the acquisition of an 81% stake with voting rights in Yutaka Giken Co., Ltd on August 29, 2025. Additionally, the board approved a scheme by Motherson Technology Services Limited (MTSL) for the reduction of its share capital. The board also approved the acquisition of an additional 20% stake in Youngshin Motherson Auto Tech Limited. The company announced a bonus issue with a ratio of 1:2, with the ex-bonus date on July 18, 2025. Prior to this, a final dividend of Rs 0.35 per share (35%) was announced on May 29, 2025, with an effective date of June 23, 2025. An interim dividend of Rs 0.50 per share (50%) was announced on March 21, 2025, with an effective date of March 28, 2025. The company has a history of corporate actions, including a 1:5 rights issue announced on October 19, 1995, with the ex-rights date on October 23, 1995. Additionally, there have been stock splits, including one on January 16, 2004, where the face value changed from Rs 5 to Rs 1, and another on July 24, 2002, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 5. According to Moneycontrol analysis dated August 26, 2025, the sentiment for the stock is very bearish. Shares of Samvardhana Motherson ended positively in Monday's session, rising 4.3% to Rs 96.74.
