title: AB Capital appoints Vishakha Mulye as the MD and CEO for five years
content: Financial services company Aditya Birla Capital has appointed Vishakha Mulye as the Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer for five years, effective from September 1, 2025, a company filing said. Vishakha Mulye is a director on the board of Aditya Birla Management Corporation Private Limited (ABMCPL), which is the apex corporate body of Aditya Birla Group for strategic direction and vision to group entities. She is also on the board of ABCLâ€™s operating companies - Aditya Birla Housing Finance, Aditya Birla Sun Life AMC, Aditya Birla Sun Life Insurance and Aditya Birla Health Insurance. Aside of these, Vishakha has been an independent director on the board of NPCI International Payments. Before joining the Aditya Birla Group, Vishakha had held key positions at the ICICI Group, driving strategic changes. The company statement said Vishakha has been credited for envisioning the â€˜One ABC, One P&Lâ€™ strategy which has been central to Aditya Birla Capitalâ€™s transformative journey. She also reimagined AB Capitalâ€™s service model, branding via the mobile app ABCD - an omnichannel D2C platform - which consolidates loans, investments, insurance, and payments. AB Capital, under Vishakhaâ€™s guidance, had raised Rs 4,500 crore in growth capital through a combination of preferential issuances, QIP, and divestment of stakes in select businesses. The appointment of Rakesh Singh as an Executive Director and Chief Executive Officer(NBFC) has also been confirmed, for five years, subject to shareholder approval. Under his leadership, AB Capital's NBFC business has expanded to offer comprehensive lending, financing, and wealth management solutions to a diverse customer base across India. Prior to joining Aditya Birla Group, Rakesh Singh had spent 16 years at Standard Chartered Bank. Aditya Birla Capital has a market capitalisation of over Rs 73,000 crore, and the shares are higher by 57 percent on YTD basis.
summary_lexrank: Vishakha Mulye is a director on the board of Aditya Birla Management Corporation Private Limited (ABMCPL), which is the apex corporate body of Aditya Birla Group for strategic direction and vision to group entities.
summary_luhn: She is also on the board of ABCLâ€™s operating companies - Aditya Birla Housing Finance, Aditya Birla Sun Life AMC, Aditya Birla Sun Life Insurance and Aditya Birla Health Insurance.
summary_lsa: She also reimagined AB Capitalâ€™s service model, branding via the mobile app ABCD - an omnichannel D2C platform - which consolidates loans, investments, insurance, and payments.
summary_textrank: Vishakha Mulye is a director on the board of Aditya Birla Management Corporation Private Limited (ABMCPL), which is the apex corporate body of Aditya Birla Group for strategic direction and vision to group entities.

title: Hyundai Motor shares among top losers on Nifty Next 50 on Monday
content: Shares of Hyundai Motor were ended lower on Monday, with the stock among the top losers on the Nifty Next 50 index. At yesterday's close, Hyundai Motor stock was priced at Rs 2,455.60, a fall of 0.2%. title: Tata Consultancy Services shares gain 0.90% on Monday
content: Tata Consultancy Services stock closed at Rs 3,112.60 in the previous session, a gain of 0.90% on the Nifty 50. The stock touched a high of Rs 3,131.10 and a low of Rs 3,090.00 during Monday's session. Tata Consultancy Services is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. Financial Highlights: The financial performance of Tata Consultancy Services reveals the following trends based on the consolidated data: Quarterly Performance: Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,437 Crore, compared to Rs 62,613 Crore in June 2024, indicating an increase. Net profit for the same period was Rs 12,819 Crore, up from Rs 12,105 Crore in the previous year. The EPS also increased to Rs 35.27 from Rs 33.28. Annual Performance: Revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 255,324 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 240,893 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year also rose to Rs 48,797 Crore from Rs 46,099 Crore. Furthermore, the EPS improved to Rs 134.19 from Rs 125.88. The debt to equity ratio remains at 0.00, indicating a debt-free status. The dividend per share is Rs 126.00. Tata Consultancy Services announced a dividend of Rs 11 on June 27, 2025, with an effective date of July 16, 2025. Prior to this, a final dividend of Rs 30 was announced on April 11, 2025, effective from June 4, 2025, and a special dividend of Rs 66 was announced on January 9, 2025, effective from January 17, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a bullish sentiment for Tata Consultancy Services as of August 26, 2025. title: Hindustan Unilever share price falls 0.39% in previous session
content: Shares of Hindustan Unilever experienced a decline of 0.39% in the previous session, with the stock's last traded price at Rs 2,649.50. The stock traded between a high of Rs 2,673.30 and a low of Rs 2,639.30 in Monday's trading. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was 11.73, compared to 10.48 for the quarter-ending March 2025. title: Titan Company shares fall on Monday, among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Titan Company ended lower in Monday's session. The stock was among the top losers on Nifty 50. Titan Company closed at Rs 3,618.60 yesterday, a decline of 0.28% on the NSE. On the financial front, the consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 16,523 Crore, compared to Rs 13,266 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 1,091 Crore, up from Rs 715 Crore in the same quarter last year. The EPS stood at Rs 12.30 in June 2025, compared to Rs 8.06 in June 2024. The company's consolidated yearly revenue has shown consistent growth over the past five years. In March 2025, the revenue reached Rs 60,456 Crore, compared to Rs 51,084 Crore in March 2024, marking an increase of 18.34%. The net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 3,336 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 3,495 Crore reported in March 2024. Key financial ratios for Titan Company show a basic EPS of Rs 37.62 and diluted EPS of Rs 37.61 as of March 2025. The company reported a book value per share of Rs 130.61 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.56 as of the year-ending March 2025.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Mar 2021Rs 21,644 CroreRs 979 Crore10.96Mar 2022Rs 28,799 CroreRs 2,198 Crore24.49Mar 2023Rs 40,575 CroreRs 3,273 Crore36.61Mar 2024Rs 51,084 CroreRs 3,495 Crore39.40Mar 2025Rs 60,456 CroreRs 3,336 Crore37.62Titan Company announced a final dividend of Rs 11.00 per share on May 8, 2025, with the effective date being July 8, 2025. Other corporate actions include updates from CARE Ratings Ltd. and ICRA Ltd. regarding credit ratings, and intimation of analyst/investor meetings. Moneycontrol analysis, as of September 2, 2025, suggests a very bullish sentiment for the stock. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 3,618.60, Titan Company was among the top losers on Nifty 50 in yesterday's session.

title: Bajaj Auto shares jump nearly 4% on Monday, among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Bajaj Auto's stock ended at Rs 8,967 on Monday with a gain of 3.89%, making it one of the top gainers on the Nifty 50. The stock demonstrated positive movement during yesterday's trade. title: Sun Pharma shares fall 2% on Monday, among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Sun Pharma were among the top losers on the Nifty 50 in Monday's trading, with the stock declining 1.96%. The stock ended at Rs 1,563.30 in yesterday's session. On the financial front, Sun Pharma has demonstrated consistent growth. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 13,851.40 Crore, compared to Rs 12,652.75 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 2,302.62 Crore, while in the corresponding quarter of the previous year, it was Rs 2,871.25 Crore. The EPS stood at Rs 9.50 in June 2025, down from Rs 11.80 in June 2024. The company's annual consolidated revenue has also shown substantial growth, increasing from Rs 48,496.85 Crore in 2024 to Rs 52,578.44 Crore in 2025. The net profit rose from Rs 9,648.44 Crore in 2024 to Rs 10,980.10 Crore in 2025. The EPS increased from Rs 39.90 in 2024 to Rs 45.60 in 2025. Here is a more detailed look at Sun Pharma's financial performance:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity202133,498.142,284.6812.10206.236.240.07202238,654.493,405.8213.60212.846.810.02202343,885.688,560.8435.30247.2215.130.11202448,496.859,648.4439.90265.3615.040.04202552,578.4410,980.1045.60301.0015.130.03The revenue increased by 8.41 percent in 2025 compared to 2024. Net profit also increased by 13.80 percent during the same period.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPSJun 202412,6522,87111.80Sep 202413,2913,03012.70Dec 202413,6752,91712.10Mar 202512,9582,1609.00Jun 202513,8512,3029.50In terms of corporate actions, the company has announced several investor presentations and analyst/investor meetings. The company announced investor presentation in Aug 2025. The company had declared a final dividend of Rs 5.50 per share (550%) with effective date as July 7, 2025 and an interim dividend of Rs 10.50 per share (1050%) with effective date February 6, 2025. The company has a history of bonus issues, including a 1:1 bonus in 2013 and 2004, and a 2:1 bonus in 2000. Additionally, the stock has undergone splits, with the face value changing from Rs 5 to Rs 1 in 2010 and from Rs 10 to Rs 5 in 2002. Moneycontrol analysis indicated a very bearish sentiment on the stock as of August 26, 2025. With the stock ending at Rs 1,563.30 on Monday, Sun Pharma has seen a decline and was among the top losers on Nifty 50.

title: Sensex, Nifty to extend gains to second day? Key levels to track on September 2
content: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty are likely to be on firm footing on September 2, extending the positive momentum from the start of the new month, powered by gains in IT and auto stocks. At around 7:22 am, GIFT Nifty quoted 24,767, up 0.16 percent, signaling a steady start for Dalal Street. The optimism stems from Mondayâ€™s broad-based buying, driven by Indiaâ€™s stronger-than-expected GDP growth in the first quarter. IT and auto counters were the star performers, while India VIX slipped 4 percent, hinting at improving market stability. However, flows remained divergent - Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) offloaded equities worth Rs 1,430 crore, even as Domestic Institutional Investors (DIIs) stepped in aggressively with net purchases of Rs 4,345 crore. On the technical front, Nifty has broken out of a falling wedge patternâ€”a classic bullish reversal signal. â€œAs long as the index sustains above 24,540â€“24,500, the trend remains positive, with upside targets at 24,700â€“24,800 and possibly 24,900. A drop below 24,460 would be the first sign of weakness,â€ said Hariprasad K, SEBI-registered Research Analyst and Founder of Livelong Wealth. Global sentiment offered additional support. A US court declared most of President Trumpâ€™s tariffs illegal, though they will remain in effect until October 14 pending a Supreme Court review. Meanwhile, Asia-Pacific markets opened largely higher, as investors tracked developments at the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) leadersâ€™ meeting in Tianjin, even as tariff uncertainty lingered. Japanâ€™s Nikkei 225 advanced 0.3 percent, South Koreaâ€™s Kospi gained 0.4 percent, while Australiaâ€™s S&P/ASX 200 slipped 0.4 percent. US markets were shut on Monday for the Labor Day holiday, and futures traded flat in early Asian hours at the start of what has historically been a challenging month for equities, especially amid renewed trade-related jitters following the court ruling. title: Asian stocks edge up, Japan bond auction in focus
content: Asian stocks posted modest gains at the open Tuesday, with attention back on technology shares and the artificial intelligence sector following the surge in Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.â€™s shares. Shares in Japan and South Korea rebounded after Mondayâ€™s losses while Australiaâ€™s declined. US equity-index futures edged lower after cash markets were closed Monday for Labor Day. West Texas Intermediate crude oil climbed in early trading and gold extended its gains to a sixth day, its longest winning streak since April 2024. Treasuries retreated in early trading with yield on the benchmark 10-year rising three basis points to 4.26%. Japanâ€™s 10-year government bond auction Tuesday will be a key test of investor appetite amid growing expectations of rate hikes by the Bank of Japan and mounting political uncertainty. After a selloff in technology shares in Wall Street Friday, the record-breaking stock rally faces a pivotal test this month, with jobs numbers, inflation data and the Federal Reserveâ€™s rate call all landing within the next three weeks. Tariff tensions and questions over the Fedâ€™s independence are also compounding the risks in September, historically the weakest month of the year for US markets. â€œThe bar to derail a Fed rate cut on Sept. 17 appears high,â€ Deutsche Bank AG economist Peter Sidorov wrote. â€œBut with Fed funds futures now pricing over 140 basis points of easing by the end of 2026, markets are expecting an amount of easing that since the 1980s has only occurred around recessions.â€ A gauge tracking emerging-market equities notched its best session in a week amid thin liquidity due to the US holiday, boosted by AI-related stocks in Hong Kong and China. The MSCI EM Index closed 0.7% higher as Alibaba jumped 19% in Hong Kong â€” the most in three years â€” after the Chinese e-commerce giant reported a triple-digit percentage gain in AI-related product revenue as well as a better-than-anticipated 26% jump in sales from the cloud division. The rally marks a break from last weekâ€™s broader Asian market decline after a tech selloff hit Wall Street. Another key factor for the markets is the Cboe Volatility Index sitting at 16.12, not far off its 2025 closing low of 14.22. â€œThe fact that investors are still betting heavily on new lows in volatility, even with VIX at what appears to be a floor, and with markets up sharply from their April lows to all-time highs, should be viewed with caution,â€ said Jeff Jacobson, a strategist at 22V Research, in a note Monday. Traders will also be closely monitoring Indonesian markets after stocks tumbled the most in nearly five months on Monday. Political risks have recently flared, with President Prabowo Subianto canceling a China trip after deadly unrest over living costs and inequality. Stress also was evident in the bond market, with yields on the nationâ€™s 10-year government note rising to the highest in almost three weeks. Meanwhile, President Donald Trump said India offered to cut its tariff rates following the US imposition last week of 50% levies as punishment for its purchases of Russian oil. In Europe, bonds weakened broadly, with a week to go before a confidence vote that could topple Franceâ€™s government. The French-German 10-year spread, a key measure of risk, was little changed at 79 basis points. The gauge closed at 82 on Aug. 27, the highest since January. Longer-maturity bonds may be in for a treacherous September, if history is any guide. Over the last decade, government bonds globally with maturities of over 10 years posted a median loss of 2% in September, according to data compiled by Bloomberg. Thatâ€™s the worst monthly performance of the year.
summary_lexrank: Tariff tensions and questions over the Fedâ€™s independence are also compounding the risks in September, historically the weakest month of the year for US markets.
summary_luhn: â€œThe fact that investors are still betting heavily on new lows in volatility, even with VIX at what appears to be a floor, and with markets up sharply from their April lows to all-time highs, should be viewed with caution,â€ said Jeff Jacobson, a strategist at 22V Research, in a note Monday.
summary_lsa: Political risks have recently flared, with President Prabowo Subianto canceling a China trip after deadly unrest over living costs and inequality.
summary_textrank: â€œBut with Fed funds futures now pricing over 140 basis points of easing by the end of 2026, markets are expecting an amount of easing that since the 1980s has only occurred around recessions.â€ A gauge tracking emerging-market equities notched its best session in a week amid thin liquidity due to the US holiday, boosted by AI-related stocks in Hong Kong and China.

title: Goldman Sachs offloads 2.74% stake in Zinka Logistics Solutions for Rs 294.7 crore, ADIA exits Mobikwik
content: GSAM Holdings LLC, an affiliate of Goldman Sachs, offloaded a 2.7 percent stake in Zinka Logistics Solutions, the operator of digital trucking platform BlackBuck, via open market transactions on September 1. GSAM Holdings LLC sold 49,09,874 equity shares (equivalent to a 2.74 percent stake) in Zinka at an average price of Rs 600.32 per share, valued at Rs 294.7 crore. However, Nomura India Investment Fund Mother Fund acquired 41,16,557 shares (a 2.29 percent stake) in the company at an average price of Rs 599.77 per share, amounting to Rs 246.9 crore. Zinka shares ended the session with a 0.53 percent loss, closing at Rs 633.4 on the NSE. One Mobikwik Systems was also in focus on Monday, rising nearly 8 percent to close at Rs 237.41, despite the Abu Dhabi Investment Authority exiting the digital wallet service provider by offloading its entire holding of 16,44,438 shares (a 2.1 percent stake) at Rs 238.45 per share, valued at Rs 39.21 crore. Meanwhile, BofA Securities Europe SA purchased 5 lakh shares in Mobikwik at Rs 243.61 per share, amounting to Rs 12.18 crore. Action was also seen in Carborundum Universal, which gained 2.38 percent to close at Rs 933.3. Sandhya G Parikh purchased 3 lakh shares in the Chennai-based Murugappa Group companyâ€”known for manufacturing coated and bonded abrasives, super refractories, and electromineralsâ€”at Rs 915 per share, amounting to Rs 27.45 crore. The shares were acquired from promoter entity Murugappan Arunachalam Children Trust. Sellowrap Industries came under significant pressure, declining 14.5 percent to close at Rs 104.5 following notable stake sales. Viney Growth Fund sold 81,600 shares in Sellowrap at Rs 114.09 per share, valued at Rs 93.1 lakh, and Strategic Sixth Sense Capital Fund offloaded 72,000 shares at Rs 110.85 per share, amounting to Rs 79.81 lakh. The star performer of the day was Anondita Medicare, which soared 99.48 percent to finish its listing day at Rs 289.25. Sageone, through its two funds, acquired an additional 1.66 percent stake in the condom manufacturer. Sageone Flagship Growth OE Fund bought 2 lakh shares at Rs 275.5 per share, and Sageone Flagship Growth 2 Fund acquired 1.01 lakh shares at Rs 271.85 per share. Their total investment was valued at Rs 8.25 crore. As of August 31, Sageone Flagship Growth OE Fund already held 3.45 lakh shares (a 1.91 percent stake) in Anondita.

title: Brookprop Management Services settles case with SEBI in Brookfield REIT matter
content: Brookprop Management Services Private Limited, the manager of Brookfield India Real Estate Investment Trust (REIT) has settled case with Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi), over alleged violations linked to the use of borrowed funds for distributions. The case originated from a thematic inspection of REITs, where Sebi observed that the applicant had allegedly facilitated distribution of Net Distributable Cash Flow (NDCF) using borrowed funds, a practice not permitted under the REIT Regulations. The market regulator had alleged contravention of Regulation 7(d) of the Sebi (REIT) Regulations, 2014. Settlement order noted, â€œApplicant for alleged violation of the aforesaid provisions. Briefly stated, it was, inter alia, observed and alleged in respect of the Applicant that it had made use of borrowed funds for facilitating distribution of Net Distributable Cash Flowâ€. Following the observations, a show-cause notice was issued, initiating adjudication proceedings. While proceedings were pending, Brookprop Management Services filed a settlement application on July 26, 2024, under the Sebi settlement proceedings, proposing to resolve the matter without admitting or denying the findings. After discussions with Sebiâ€™s Internal Committee in October 2024, the applicant submitted revised terms in November. Also read: From today, listed firms must provide granular disclosures for related party transactions Sebiâ€™s High-Powered Advisory Committee (HPAC), in its meeting on June 5, 2025, recommended that the case be settled upon payment of Rs 20.47 lakh. The Panel of Whole-Time Members of Sebi accepted the recommendation on August 18, 2025, and the same was communicated to the applicant on August 21. Subsequently, on September 1, 2025, the applicant confirmed the remittance of the settlement amount, which Sebi acknowledged. Settlement proceedings under Sebi regulations provide entities an opportunity to resolve alleged violations through monetary or other terms, avoiding prolonged litigation while ensuring regulatory compliance. Also read: Sebi panel recommends open offer process may be faster with quicker payout to investors
summary_lexrank: Also read: From today, listed firms must provide granular disclosures for related party transactions Sebiâ€™s High-Powered Advisory Committee (HPAC), in its meeting on June 5, 2025, recommended that the case be settled upon payment of Rs 20.47 lakh.

title: Kaynes Tech, Dixon Tech, other EMS stocks surge up to 7% after PM Modi's visit to China
content: The shares of Electronic Manufacturing Services (EMS) companies jumped on September 1 as Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to China boosted investor sentiment. EMS companies have strong ties with Chinese component manufacturers. The earlier tensions between India and China following geopolitical disputes had impacted the stocks, as investors remained concerned over supply chain disruption. Prime Minister Narendra Modi attended the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) summit in Tianjin, China. At the summit, he met Chinese President Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin. This holds strong significance in global geopolitics after US President Donald Trump's administration increased tariffs on Indian imports to a whopping 50 percent. Kaynes Technology shares gained nearly 8 percent to trade at Rs 6,595 apiece. The company imports most of its raw materials from outside, including various electronic components that are mostly sourced from China. The easing tensions between India and China after PM Modi's visit will likely boost the stock, on expectations of easing impact on supply chains. Dixon Technologies (India) shares jumped around 6 percent to close at Rs 17,625 apiece. Earlier this year, Dixon Technologies formed a joint venture with China's HKC to produce display modules by September 2025. The company is also exploring similar partnerships for precision components, mechanicals, camera modules, and battery packs. "We have hired a senior resource and are building a team to execute these projects. The component PLI rollout by the government will strengthen our backward integration and open a massive market for Dixon," said Managing Director Atul Lall during the companyâ€™s Q3 earnings call. Notably, Dixon Tech in 2023 had announced a major partnership with Chinese smartphone brand Xiaomi, the Beijing-headquartered company which has faced heightened scrutiny over the years in India over souring ties with China. Amber Enterprises India shares meanwhile surged around 5 percent to end the session at 7,621.50. PG Electroplast shares rose over 4 percent to close at Rs 556 apiece.
summary_lexrank: Dixon Technologies (India) shares jumped around 6 percent to close at Rs 17,625 apiece.
summary_luhn: The shares of Electronic Manufacturing Services (EMS) companies jumped on September 1 as Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to China boosted investor sentiment.

title: Everest Kanto Cylinder Appoints Sanjay Patnaik as GM - Plant & Operations
content: Everest Kanto Cylinder (EKC) announced the appointment of Mr. Sanjay Patnaik as GM â€“ Plant and Operations at its Tarapur plant, effective September 1, 2025. Mr. Patnaik brings 21 years of experience to EKC. He holds a BE-Mechanical degree from Shivaji University, Kolhapur. His previous roles include positions at Walia Auto Ancillaries Private Limited, Bharat Fritz Werner Limited, and Cummins India Limited. He previously served as Head-Plant Operation with Walia Auto Ancillaries Private Limited. The company disclosed this information under Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015. The company's registered office is located at 204, Raheja Centre, Free Press Journal Marg, 214, Nariman Point, Mumbai-400 021. The disclosure was made by Vishal Totla, Company Secretary and Compliance Officer. title: Kapal Suresh Pansari Acquires 1.34% Stake in Rashi Peripherals via Gift
content: Rashi Peripherals Promoter Increases Stake Via Gift Kapal Suresh Pansari, a promoter of Rashi Peripherals Limited, has acquired a 1.34% stake in the company through an inter-se transfer by way of gift, according to a regulatory filing dated August 28, 2025. The acquisition involved 8,83,192 shares of Rashi Peripherals. Following the transaction, Kapal Suresh Pansari's total holding in the company increased to 40,90,742 shares, representing 6.21% of the total share capital. Prior to this acquisition, Kapal Suresh Pansari held 32,07,550 shares, which constituted 4.87% of the total share capital of Rashi Peripherals Limited. title: Borosil Scientific: Prashant Amin Resigns as Business Head, Eff. Aug 31
content: Borosil Scientific Limited (BOROSCI) announced the resignation of Mr. Prashant Gangadhar Amin, Business Head - Pharmaceutical Primary Packaging, effective close of business hours on August 31, 2025. The company disclosed that Mr. Amin is leaving to pursue a new opportunity outside the organization. The company filed the resignation details under Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015. Details of Resignation Resignation DetailsParticularsDetailsReason for ResignationTo pursue a new opportunity outside the organisationDate of CessationAugust 31, 2025 Sanjay Gupta, Company Secretary & Compliance Officer, confirmed the announcement (ICSI Membership No.: A24641). In his resignation letter dated August 29, 2025, Mr. Amin, addressed Mr. Vinayak Patankar, Whole-Time Director & CEO of Borosil Scientific Limited, and thanked senior management and colleagues for their support during his tenure. The company stated it has complied with all necessary regulatory requirements for announcing this senior management change. The resignation was disclosed under Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015.

title: Shoppers Stop Appoints Nabamita Banerjee as Customer Care Associate & CHRO
content: Shoppers Stop (532638.BSE; SHOPERSTOP.NSE) announced the appointment of Ms. Nabamita Banerjee as Customer Care Associate & Chief Human Resource Officer, effective September 01, 2025. The decision complies with Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015. Ms. Banerjee brings over 18 years of experience in Human Resources across IT, Retail, and QSR industries. Her expertise includes Business Partnering, Talent Management, Compensation & Benefits, Organization Development, HR Operations, Inclusion & Diversity, Social Impact, and Change Management. She previously held roles such as Head of Human Resources at Tata Starbucks, and positions at Patni Computers and the Apparel Group. Ms. Banerjee holds a Post Graduate Program in e-Business (Human Resources) from Welingkar Institute of Management, and a B.E. in Electronics and Communication from L.D. College of Engineering. The company has confirmed Ms. Banerjeeâ€™s appointment is a full-time employment position. The announcement complies with SEBI regulations, as detailed under Listing Regulations read with SEBI Master Circular No. SEBI/HO/CFD/P0D2/CIR/P/0155 dated November 11, 2024. Rakeshkumar Saini, Vice President â€“ Legal, CS & Chief Compliance Officer, officially communicated the change. The company stated Ms. Banerjee's leadership and proficiency in HR will bring tremendous value to the organization.

title: Apollo Pipes to Hold 39th AGM on September 26, 2025
content: Apollo Pipes Limited (APOLLOPIPE) will hold its Thirty Ninth (39th) Annual General Meeting (AGM) on Friday, September 26, 2025, to address key business items. Shareholders will consider the ratification of remuneration for cost auditors for the financial year 2025-26, the appointment of statutory auditors, and the re-appointment of a Whole Time Director. On the agenda is a resolution to ratify remuneration of â‚¹1,00,000 plus applicable taxes and out-of-pocket expenses for M/s. HMVN & Associates, the Cost Auditors, for FY2025-26. The board has recommended approval. Investors will also vote on the appointment of M/s. AKGVG & Associates as Statutory Auditors for a five-year term, concluding at the 44th AGM in 2030. Remuneration is proposed at â‚¹15,00,000 per annum, excluding expenses and taxes, for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2026. The board recommends approval. The AGM will also address the re-appointment of Mr. Arun Agarwal as a Whole Time Director, designated Joint Managing Director, for three years from April 1, 2026. Terms will be discussed during the meeting. The AGM will be conducted via Video Conferencing (VC) / Other Audio-Visual Means (OAVM) as per Companies Act, 2013, and related circulars from the Ministry of Corporate Affairs and Securities and Exchange Board of India. Apollo Pipes Limited will hold its Thirty Ninth (39th) Annual General Meeting on Friday, 26th September, 2025, at 11:00 A.M. (IST) via Video Conferencing (VC) / Other Audio-Visual Means (OAVM), to transact the following business: Key items on the meeting agenda: To receive, consider, and adopt the Audited Financial Statements (Standalone & Consolidated) for the year ended 31st March, 2025, and the Reports of the Board and Auditors. To declare a final dividend of â‚¹0.70 per equity share (@7%) for the year ended 31st March, 2025. To appoint a director in place of Mr. Arun Agarwal (DIN: 10067312), retiring by rotation and offering himself for re-appointment. To Appoint M/s. AKGVG & Associates, Chartered Accountants (Firm Registration No. 018598N) as the Statutory Auditors. To ratify the remuneration payable to the Cost Auditors for FY2025-26 To appoint M/s. Anjali Yadav & Associates, Company Secretaries as Secretarial Auditor. Mr. Jatin Gupta, Practicing Company Secretary, has been appointed as Scrutinizer to ensure fair and transparent e-voting and AGM voting. The meeting will also address approval of material related-party transactions with its subsidiary, Kisan Mouldings Limited, and other routine matters. The dividend for the year ended March 31, 2025, if declared, will be credited/dispatched within 30 days to members on the Register of Members as of September 5, 2025. The AGM notice and the Annual Report for FY2024-25 are available on the company's website and exchange websites. The meeting will be held on Friday, 26th September, 2025 at 11.00 A.M. (IST) via Video Conferencing (VC) / Other Audio-Visual Means (OAVM), to transact the following business.

title: Ajanta Pharma shares fall nearly 1% amid high volume; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Ajanta Pharma experienced a decline of 0.97% to Rs 2,453.60 in Monday's session amid volume surge. The stock is among the top losers on Nifty Midcap 150. The company's consolidated financial performance reveals steady growth. Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,302.65 Crore, compared to Rs 1,144.92 Crore in June 2024, marking an increase. Net profit for the same period was Rs 255.34 Crore, up from Rs 245.77 Crore in the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) also increased to Rs 20.44 in June 2025 from Rs 19.54 in June 2024. The consolidated annual financial data shows consistent growth over the years. Revenue increased from Rs 2,889.69 Crore in 2021 to Rs 4,648.10 Crore in 2025. Net profit also rose from Rs 653.87 Crore in 2021 to Rs 920.39 Crore in 2025. Similarly, EPS increased from Rs 75.09 in 2021 to Rs 73.56 in 2025. Book Value Per Share (BVPS) grew from Rs 344.52 in 2021 to Rs 302.38 in 2025. The Return on Equity (ROE) also showed a positive trend, increasing from 21.82% in 2021 to 24.28% in 2025. title: EV makers Ola, Atherâ€™s shares soar on hopes of easier access to Chinese rare earth magnets, GST reform benefits
content: Shares of EV two-wheeler makers sharply surged on September 1, with Ola Electric and Ather Energy rising more than 14 percent each on positive outcome from the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) summit in China, and the tailwind from proposed GST reforms that could drive sales. Ola Electric shares hit an intraday high of Rs 61.88 while Ather Energy shares hit an all-time high of Rs 512.80 apiece during the trade. PM Modi at SCO Summit Over the weekend, Prime Minister Modi met Chinese President Xi Jinping, at a time when India's automotive sector has been seeking further relaxation in Beijing's curbs on rare earths magnets, which have been in place since April, hampering EV makers' production plans. More than 50 Indian applications to import heavy rare earth magnets are awaiting approval in China, Bloomberg News had reported citing people familiar with the matter. China has, however, started lifting the restrictions on rare earth metals and critical minerals exports amid signs of a thaw in trade relations with China. While an official statement is still awaited, PM Modi's visit to China has likely boosted hopes for relaxation in export curbs, which will likely benefit EV-makers like Ola Electric and Ather Energy. GST Reforms Expectations The GST Council, chaired by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, is slated to meet in New Delhi on September 3-4 to deliberate on the Centre's proposal for a simplified two-rate structure of 5 percent and 18 percent. Market experts are attributing this to be a strong boost for several sectors, and autos, including EVs, are likely be benefitted from the reform. PLI push for Ola Electric Shares of Ola Electric Mobility have been extending gains after securing PLI certification from the Centre for its Gen 3 scooter portfolio. In an exchange filing on August 26, Ola Electric had said, "(Ola Electric) has received Certification for Compliance with the eligibility assessment requirements under the Production Linked Incentive (PLI) Scheme for automobile and auto components sector, for its Gen 3 scooter portfolio. This certification was granted by the Automotive Research Association of India (ARAI) under the aegis of the Ministry of Heavy Industries, Government of India to all of the seven Ola S1 Gen 3 scooters." The EV-scooter maker said its Gen 2 and Gen 3 scooter portfolio are now PLI-certified. Its Gen 3 portfolio, which comprises S1 Pro 3 kWh, S1 Pro 4 kWh, S1 Pro+ 4 kWh, S1 X 2 kWh, S1 X 3 kWh, S1 X 4 kWh and S1 X+ 4 kWh, comprises majority of its current sales. As a result, this certification is set to significantly enhance its profitability from Q2FY26 onwards, the company said. Investor interest in the shares have revived after Helios Mutual Fund recently added Ola Electric to its portfolio, Dinshaw Irani, CEO of the fund house had told The Economic Times. Irani compared Ola to Eternal (Zomato), to showcase Helios' early bet in the food delivery giant played out. Helios had bought Zomato shares for around Rs 40 apiece, and the shares are currently trading at around Rs 320 apiece. Ola Electric shares are currently trading over 14 percent higher at Rs 61.62 apiece, having rallied over 56 percent from its 52-week low of Rs 39.60 apiece, hit in July this year. Ather Energy shares were trading around 12 percent higher after hitting an all-time high earlier in the session, and the shares have gained 69 percent since listing in May this year. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: PLI push for Ola Electric Shares of Ola Electric Mobility have been extending gains after securing PLI certification from the Centre for its Gen 3 scooter portfolio.
summary_luhn: Its Gen 3 portfolio, which comprises S1 Pro 3 kWh, S1 Pro 4 kWh, S1 Pro+ 4 kWh, S1 X 2 kWh, S1 X 3 kWh, S1 X 4 kWh and S1 X+ 4 kWh, comprises majority of its current sales.
summary_lsa: More than 50 Indian applications to import heavy rare earth magnets are awaiting approval in China, Bloomberg News had reported citing people familiar with the matter.
summary_textrank: This certification was granted by the Automotive Research Association of India (ARAI) under the aegis of the Ministry of Heavy Industries, Government of India to all of the seven Ola S1 Gen 3 scooters."

title: BHEL Fined â‚¹5.37 Lakh Each by BSE, NSE for Non-Compliance
content: BHEL Faces Penalties from BSE, NSE for Non-Compliance Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited (BHEL) disclosed that it has received notices from both the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange of India (NSE) regarding fines levied for non-compliance with SEBI (Listing Obligations & Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015. The exchanges' notices, dated August 29, 2025, state that each has imposed a fine of â‚¹5,36,900 (inclusive of GST) on BHEL. The penalties stem from non-compliance with Regulation 17 (1) of the SEBI (LODR) Regulations, 2015, for the quarter ending June 2025. Specifically, the issue concerns the composition of BHEL's Board of Directors, where the number of Independent Directors fell below 50% of the required strength. BHEL stated it intends to seek a waiver of the fines, citing its status as a Government Company. The company clarified that the appointment of Directors, including Independent Directors, is managed by the Government of India. BHEL further noted that it is actively working with the Government of India to ensure the appointment of the necessary Independent Directors to meet regulatory requirements.
summary_lexrank: The company clarified that the appointment of Directors, including Independent Directors, is managed by the Government of India.
summary_luhn: BHEL Faces Penalties from BSE, NSE for Non-Compliance Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited (BHEL) disclosed that it has received notices from both the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange of India (NSE) regarding fines levied for non-compliance with SEBI (Listing Obligations & Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015.
summary_lsa: BHEL Faces Penalties from BSE, NSE for Non-Compliance Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited (BHEL) disclosed that it has received notices from both the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange of India (NSE) regarding fines levied for non-compliance with SEBI (Listing Obligations & Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015.
summary_textrank: Specifically, the issue concerns the composition of BHEL's Board of Directors, where the number of Independent Directors fell below 50% of the required strength.

title: Mid, smallcap indices surge up to 2%, snap multi-day losses: Here are the top gainers
content: The shares of several smallcap and midcap companies surged on September 1, tracking the broader uptrend in the market. The sharp rise in the share prices pushed the broader market indices into the green, snapping multi-session losing streaks. The Nifty Midcap 100 index surged nearly 2 percent to trade at 56,831.70, snapping a three-day losing streak. Nifty Smallcap 100 index gained more than 1.6 percent to trade at around 17,505.75. The index has now snapped a six-day losing streak. Ola Electric Mobility shares were the top gainer on the midcap index, rallying 14 percent to trade at around Rs 62 apiece. The stock has now rallied nearly 31 percent in just five sessions. Tube Investments of India shares followed, rising nearly 6 percent. Mphasis, Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail and Dixon Tech shares rose around 5 percent each, while Premier Energies, Hindustan Zinc and BSE shares jumped around 4 percent each. Rail Vikas Nigam Limited (RVNL), Voltas and Exide Industries shares gained over 3 percent each, while HUDCO, L&T Finance, Muthoot Finance, Astral, Tata Tech, National Aluminium Company (NALCO) and Yes Bank shares rose over 2.5 percent each. Max Health, Union Bank, HPCL, Coforge, Cochin Shipyard, Torrent Pharma, Persistent Systems, CONCOR and Paytm shares gained over 2 percent each, while PB Fintech (Policybazaar), Indian Bank, Suzlon Energy, APL Apollo, OIL, BHEL, IGL, HDFC AMC, MRF, Steel Authority of India (SAIL) and others gained nearly 2 percent each. Also read: BSE, MCX, other capital market stocks jump up to 5%; here are possible reasons behind sharp rally Among the smallcap stocks, Kaynes Tech was the top gainer, jumping nearly 7 percent to trade at Rs 6,534 apiece. MCX and GRSE shares surged around 5 percent each, while Manappuram Finance, IGIL, KFin Tech and CAMS shares gained around 4 percent each. CDSL, RailTel Corporation of India, Sagility India, IRCON, IIFL Finance, NCC, Angel One and others meanwhile rose over 2 percent each. "Global geopolitics is transforming fast in response to Trumpâ€™s tantrums. The coming together of China, India and Russia can have profound consequences on global power equations and thereby on global trade. This will have its impact on the stock market too," said VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Investments. "There are two developments, one global and the other domestic, that can weigh on markets. The U.S. court ruling that Trumpâ€™s tariffs are illegal is a big development and the U.S. Supreme Courtâ€™s final verdict on the issue will have to be awaited. Domestically, Indiaâ€™s Q1 GDP growth number at 7.8% came much better than expected. It appears that the fiscal stimulus provided in the Budget and monetary stimulus provided by the MPC are acting with a lag. The proposed GST reforms can accelerate growth in the coming quarters. This, along with the huge liquidity coming into mutual funds will continue to support the market," he added. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: MRF share price rises 2.25% in today's trading
content: MRF shares saw a gain of 2.25% with the price reaching Rs 144120.00 in Monday's session. The company's quarterly revenue shows a fluctuating trend. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 7,675.69 Crore, an increase compared to the Rs 7,074.82 Crore reported for the quarter-ending March 2025. The revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 was higher than the revenue for the quarter-ending December 2024, which stood at Rs 7,000.82 Crore. The revenue for the quarter-ending December 2024 was greater than the revenue for the quarter-ending September 2024, which was Rs 6,881.09 Crore. Lastly, the revenue for the quarter-ending September 2024 was lower than the revenue for the quarter-ending June 2024, which was Rs 7,196.45 Crore. The net profit also reflects a similar pattern. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 500.47 Crore, a decrease from the Rs 512.11 Crore recorded for the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the quarter-ending March 2025 was higher than the net profit for the quarter-ending December 2024, which was Rs 315.46 Crore. The net profit for the quarter-ending December 2024 was lower than the net profit reported for the quarter-ending September 2024, which stood at Rs 470.70 Crore. The net profit for the quarter-ending September 2024 was lower than the net profit for the quarter-ending June 2024, which was Rs 571.02 Crore. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,180.04, lower compared to Rs 1,207.48 for the quarter-ending March 2025. The EPS for the quarter-ending March 2025 was greater than the EPS for the quarter-ending December 2024, which was Rs 743.80. The EPS for the quarter-ending December 2024 was lower than the EPS reported for the quarter-ending September 2024, which stood at Rs 1,109.85. Lastly, the EPS for the quarter-ending September 2024 was lower than the EPS for the quarter-ending June 2024, which was Rs 1,346.38. The annual financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue. In 2025, the revenue was Rs 28,153.18 Crore compared to Rs 25,169.21 Crore in 2024. The revenue in 2024 was greater than the revenue in 2023, which stood at Rs 23,008.50 Crore. The revenue in 2023 was higher than the revenue in 2022, which was Rs 19,316.72 Crore. Also, the revenue in 2022 was greater than the revenue in 2021, which was Rs 16,163.19 Crore. However, the net profit saw a slight decrease in 2025. The net profit in 2025 was Rs 1,869.29 Crore compared to Rs 2,081.23 Crore in 2024. The net profit in 2024 was significantly higher than the net profit in 2023, which was Rs 768.96 Crore. Similarly, the net profit in 2023 was higher than the net profit in 2022, which was Rs 669.24 Crore. Lastly, the net profit in 2022 was lower than the net profit in 2021, which was Rs 1,277.07 Crore. The EPS in 2025 was Rs 4,407.51, lower compared to Rs 4,907.24 in 2024. The EPS in 2024 was considerably higher than the EPS in 2023, which was Rs 1,813.10. The EPS in 2023 was greater than the EPS in 2022, which was Rs 1,577.97. The EPS in 2022 was lower than the EPS in 2021, which was Rs 3,011.14. The BVPS in 2025 was Rs 43,604.86 compared to Rs 39,394.25 in 2024. The BVPS in 2024 was higher than the BVPS in 2023, which was Rs 34,688.25. The BVPS in 2023 was higher than the BVPS in 2022, which was Rs 33,094.10. Similarly, the BVPS in 2022 was greater than the BVPS in 2021, which was Rs 31,636.34. The ROE in 2025 stood at 10.11 compared to 12.46 in 2024. The ROE in 2024 was significantly higher than the ROE in 2023, which was 5.22. The ROE in 2023 was greater than the ROE in 2022, which was 4.76. The ROE in 2022 was lower than the ROE in 2021, which was 9.52. The debt to equity ratio in 2025 was 0.16 compared to 0.12 in 2024. The debt to equity ratio in 2024 was lower than the debt to equity ratio in 2023, which was 0.17. The debt to equity ratio in 2023 was lower than the debt to equity ratio in 2022, which was 0.20. title: Bosch shares rise 2.15% in Monday's trading session
content: Shares of Bosch gained 2.15% to trade at Rs 40,820.00 in Monday's session. The stock is a constituent of the NIFTY NEXT 50 index. On the financial front, Bosch has demonstrated robust performance. The consolidated annual revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 18,087.40 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 16,727.10 Crore in the previous year. Net profit for the same period was Rs 2,013.00 Crore, compared to Rs 2,490.20 Crore in the year prior. The company's Earnings Per Share (EPS) was reported as Rs 683.25, while the Book Value Per Share (BVPS) reached Rs 4,682.47. The Return on Equity (ROE) was 14.58%, and the company maintained a Debt to Equity ratio of 0.00. Bosch Consolidated Yearly Figures (Rs. title: Global Health shares rise 2.09% in today's trading
content: Shares of Global Health were trading higher at Rs 1,402.70, a gain of 2.09% in Monday's session. The stock is among the gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index as of 1:55 pm. Financial Performance: Global Health's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth. The company's revenue has increased steadily over the past few years. For the year-ending March 2025, the revenue stood at Rs 3,692.32 Crore, compared to Rs 3,275.11 Crore in the previous year and Rs 2,694.25 Crore in 2023. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 481.32 Crore, slightly higher than the Rs 478.06 Crore reported in the previous year. Earnings per share (EPS) also saw a marginal increase, rising to Rs 17.92 in March 2025 from Rs 17.80 in the previous year. Key financial ratios for Global Health include a P/E ratio of 69.75 and a P/B ratio of 9.20 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.10 as of the year-ending March 2025. title: Maruti Suzuki India AGM Approves Director Appointments, Object Clause Change
content: Maruti Suzuki Shareholders Greenlight Director Appointments, Auditor Selections at AGM Shareholders of Maruti Suzuki India Limited convened via video conference for the companyâ€™s 44th Annual General Meeting (AGM) on August 28, 2025, where they passed all proposed resolutions. Key decisions included director appointments, auditor selections, and amendments to the company's object clause. Key Resolutions Passed: Re-appointment of Mr. Kenichiro Toyofuku as Whole-time Director, designated as Director (Sustainability).Appointment of Mr. Koichi Suzuki as a Director.Appointment of Price Waterhouse Chartered Accountants LLP as Statutory Auditors.Declaration of dividend on equity shares.Appointment of RMG & Associates as Secretarial Auditors. J. Goel & Co.29,22,82,470100.00%1,4890.00%To appoint RMG & Associates as Secretarial Auditors29,22,96,932100.00%2,4850.00% The resolutions were approved by the shareholders with the required majority, complying with the stipulations of the Companies Act.

title: Jubilant Pharmova Announces Resignation of Key Management Personnel
content: Jubilant Pharmova announced the resignations of Dr. Ramakrishnan Arul, Whole-Time Director, and Dr. Tushar Gupta, Chief of Operations- Contract Research, Development, and Manufacturing Organization (CRDMO) Business. Both resignations are effective at the close of business hours on August 31, 2025. The departures are attributed to their transfer to Jubilant Biosys Limited, a subsidiary, where they will take on new roles starting September 1, 2025. The company stated that it has complied with disclosure requirements under Regulation 30 of the Listing Regulations, adhering to SEBI Master Circular No. SEBI/HO/CFD/PoD2/CIR/P/0155 dated November 11, 2024. Details of Resignations: Resignation DetailsParticularsDr. Ramakrishnan ArulDr. Tushar GuptaPositionWhole-Time DirectorChief of Operations- CRDMO BusinessEffective DateAugust 31, 2025August 31, 2025ReasonTransfer to Jubilant Biosys LimitedTransfer to Jubilant Biosys Limited Further information is available on the company website at www.jubilantpharmova.com. Copies of the resignation letters from Dr. Arul and Dr. Gupta are included as Annexure - 3 and 4 respectively. The information is also available on the company website at www.jubilantpharmova.com.

title: From today, listed firms must provide granular disclosures for related party transactions
content: Starting today, nearly 5,000 listed companies will be required to follow a new set of rules issued by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) for approval of related party transactions (RPTs). The framework, which becomes effective September 1, is aimed at bringing greater transparency and equipping shareholders with more detailed information to make informed decisions. Related party transactions are business dealings between a company and entities that share a pre-existing relationshipâ€”such as subsidiaries, key management personnel, or major shareholders. These dealings often raise governance concerns if not adequately disclosed, as they may result in conflicts of interest or potential misuse of company resources. In June this year, Sebi directed listed entities to adopt minimum disclosure standards as prescribed by the Industry Standards Forum (ISF), a body comprising representatives from industry chambers like FICCI, CII, and ASSOCHAM, working in collaboration with the regulator and stock exchanges. These standards mandate that companies share detailed information with audit committees and shareholders before seeking approval for RPT proposals. Also read: Sebi panel recommends open offer process may be faster with quicker payout to investors Greater clarity and explanatory statements According to Makarand M Joshi, Founder of MMJC & Associates, â€œExplanatory statements for approving material RPTs need to be made more self-explanatory. It shall contain information, not only meeting but significantly exceeding the requirements of the Companies Act, 2013 viz. Data placed before audit committee, pricing methodology, certification from KMP, QR code for report of any etc.â€ He further noted that drafting such explanatory statements will now require far more diligence to enable better informed shareholder decision-making. The ISF-prescribed format specifies that management must present details of related partiesâ€™ shareholding or contribution to profit and loss of the listed entity or its subsidiary, both directly and indirectly. Likewise, shareholding of the related party in the listed entity must also be disclosed.In addition, information such as the financial performance of the related party, details of past transactions, and specifics of the proposed transactionâ€”including nature, size, and rationaleâ€”must be clearly laid out. Wide coverage of transactions The new rules go beyond generic disclosures. For instance, transactions relating to loans, inter-corporate deposits, advances, or investments by the listed entity or its subsidiaries must now be accompanied by details of source of funds and rationale. Similarly, any proposed guarantee, indemnity, or comfort letter given by a company or subsidiary must be explained with the reasoning behind it. If transactions involve borrowings, sale, lease, or disposal of assets of subsidiaries or units, then audit committees must also be provided with bidding details and information about bidders.When it comes to royalty payments, the requirements are even more extensive. Companies will have to disclose the purpose of royalty paid during the last three years, break up payments made for brand use, technology know-how, professional or management fees, and compare royalty growth rates with growth in turnover, profit after tax, and dividends. Firms will also need to provide evidence of benefits derived from technology transfers and compare their royalty outgo with industry peers. Also read: Is Sebi revisiting F&O suitability? Recent remarks indicate entry criteria discussion is back on table and here's how it could look Sebiâ€™s study on royalty payments Sebi had earlier conducted a comprehensive study of royalty payments across 233 listed companies between FY14 and FY23. The regulator found several instances where firms paid royalty to related parties exceeding 20% of their net profits. Alarmingly, even loss-making firms were making royalty pay-outs. The study revealed 1,538 instances of royalty payments falling below the 5% turnover approval threshold, while 185 cases involved loss-making companies paying a cumulative Rs 1,355 crore as royalty. Sebi observed that such practices raised questions on governance and shareholder value. Certification to protect shareholders Under the new framework, companies must also provide certifications from the CEO, CFO, or other key managerial personnel, and from every promoter-director, confirming that the proposed RPTs are not prejudicial to public shareholders. If any promoter-director fails to provide such certification, the fact must be disclosed to the audit committee and shareholders before approval.Pavan Vijay, Founder, Corporate Professionals says, â€œThe RPT Industry Standards enhance investor confidence by ensuring greater transparency and comparability in related party disclosures at the time of approval. Investors can now better assess the fairness of transactions involving promoters or key stakeholders, identify governance lapses and benchmark disclosures across companies and industriesâ€. He further says, â€œProfessionals should ensure consistency with the structured format specified in Para 4 of the RPT Industry Standards, clearly disclose transaction terms, avoid vague or incomplete information and provide valuation or other external reports to the Audit Committee and shareholders (through a QR code or web-link), among other requirementsâ€. Anjali Malhotra, Partner- Regulatory, Nangia Andersen LLP says, "The requirement to have standardized formats for approval of RPTâ€™s emerged due to precedents wherein funds were diverted through related parties for personal use and information was camouflaged which could have enabled the audit committee o or shareholders to judiciously accord their approvals. The historic examples depict how gaps in transparency can disrupt stakeholders trust, threat business continuity and invite regulatory actions". Transparency and compliance The regulator had initially set July 1, 2025, as the effective date for the circular. However, based on industry feedback, the implementation was deferred to September 1 to allow companies more time to align their systems and processes. With the new rules now coming into force, experts believe Indian capital markets are poised to see stronger governance practices. By ensuring that shareholders receive more granular information, Sebi aims to reduce opacity in related party dealings and enhance investor confidence. Additionally, Sebi has proposed easing related party transaction rules by raising shareholder approval threshold to Rs 5,000 crore and waiving disclosures for deals below Rs 15 crore. The consultation paper issued last month proposes to simplify compliance, boost transparency, and strengthen corporate governance norms.
summary_lexrank: If any promoter-director fails to provide such certification, the fact must be disclosed to the audit committee and shareholders before approval.Pavan Vijay, Founder, Corporate Professionals says, â€œThe RPT Industry Standards enhance investor confidence by ensuring greater transparency and comparability in related party disclosures at the time of approval.
summary_luhn: If any promoter-director fails to provide such certification, the fact must be disclosed to the audit committee and shareholders before approval.Pavan Vijay, Founder, Corporate Professionals says, â€œThe RPT Industry Standards enhance investor confidence by ensuring greater transparency and comparability in related party disclosures at the time of approval.
summary_lsa: Data placed before audit committee, pricing methodology, certification from KMP, QR code for report of any etc.â€ He further noted that drafting such explanatory statements will now require far more diligence to enable better informed shareholder decision-making.

title: Berger Paints India shares rise 2.03%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Berger Paints India shares gained 2.03% to trade at Rs 543.80 in Monday's session, emerging as one of the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. This increase reflects a positive movement from its previous close. Regarding the company's financial performance, Berger Paints India has demonstrated consistent growth in both revenue and net profit over the past five years. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 11,544.71 Crore, compared to Rs 11,198.92 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 1,147.75 Crore, up from Rs 1,128.80 Crore in the previous year. Here is a summary of Berger Paints India's key financial data:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity20216,817.59725.337.4134.8421.310.1120228,761.78829.098.5840.5021.200.17202310,567.84873.578.8646.3519.120.17202411,198.921,128.8010.0246.2321.700.04202511,544.711,147.7510.1352.7819.180.02The company's revenue saw an increase of 3.1% from Rs 11,198.92 Crore in 2024 to Rs 11,544.71 Crore in 2025. Net profit also increased by 1.68%, from Rs 1,128.80 Crore in 2024 to Rs 1,147.75 Crore in 2025. The earnings per share (EPS) increased from Rs 10.02 in March 2024 to Rs 10.13 in March 2025. Here is a summary of Berger Paints India's key financial data on quarterly basis:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 20243,091.01344.413.03Sep 20242,774.61261.042.31Dec 20242,975.06288.732.53Mar 20252,704.03253.572.25Jun 20253,200.76303.872.70The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 3,200.76 Crore, while the net profit was Rs 303.87 Crore with an EPS of Rs 2.70. In comparison, for the quarter ending June 2024, the revenue was Rs 3,091.01 Crore, the net profit was Rs 344.41 Crore and the EPS was Rs 3.03. Berger Paints India announced a final dividend of Rs 3.80 per share on May 14, 2025, with an effective date of August 5, 2025. Other corporate actions include a 1:5 bonus ratio on August 9, 2023 (ex-bonus date: September 22, 2023) and a stock split (2:1) on November 4, 2014 (ex-split date: January 8, 2015). Moneycontrol analysis indicates very bearish sentiment on the stock as of September 1, 2025.

title: Eicher Motors' August 2025 Sales Surge 55% to 1,14,002 Units
content: Eicher Motors (EICHERMOT) August Motorcycle Sales Surge 55% Y-o-Y Eicher Motors reported a 55% year-on-year increase in total motorcycle sales for August 2025, reaching 1,14,002 units. Exports for the month grew by 39% to 11,126 units, indicating sustained international demand. In August 2025, sales of models with engine capacity up to 350cc reached 98,631 units, a 61% increase compared to 61,087 units in August 2024. Models exceeding 350cc saw sales of 15,371 units, a 23% rise from 12,542 units last year. August 2025 Sales Data (Units Sold) ParticularsAug-25Aug-24% ChangeModels with engine capacity upto 350cc98,63161,08761%Models with engine capacity exceeding 350cc15,37112,54223%Total1,14,00273,62955%International Business (included in the total above)11,1268,00639% Year-to-Date Sales Data (Units Sold) ParticularsApr-25 to Aug-25Apr-24 to Aug-24% ChangeModels with engine capacity upto 350cc4,02,1323,11,86029%Models with engine capacity exceeding 350cc65,44355,94117%Total4,67,5753,67,80127%International Business (included in the total above)59,66636,28464% B. Govindarajan, Managing Director, noted that the August performance indicates positive momentum heading into the festive season, a period typically associated with increased domestic demand. The continued strength in exports was also highlighted. Brand & Business Updates Royal Enfield launched the 2025 Hunter 350 in a new Graphite Grey colorway, complementing existing options like Rio White and Dapper Grey. This variant features a matte, minimalistic design with neon yellow accents. The company also introduced a new Shadow Ash colorway for the Guerrilla 450, priced at INR 2,49,000 (ex-showroom, Chennai). This edition features an olive-green tank with blacked-out detailing and the Tripper Dash. Motoverse 2025 will be held in Goa from November 21-23, 2025. Royal Enfield also announced the first edition of Himalayan Spirit, an off-road experience for Himalayan riders at BigRock Dirt Park in Kolar. Season 5 of Art of Motorcycling, themed Cine-Verse, invites artists from 12 countries to design movie posters featuring themselves and their Royal Enfield motorcycles. The company recently unveiled its new city+ motorcycle brand - the Flying Flea - a fresh take on urban mobility, blending authentic design with advanced technology.

title: Varun Beverages Announces Senior Management Change
content: Varun Beverages (VBL) announced a senior management change, effective August 31, 2025. According to a regulatory filing on September 1, 2025, Mr. Vikas Bhatia, Executive Director - Group ESG Head (Non-Board Member), has resigned from his position. The company stated that the disclosures are in compliance with Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015. title: Mahindra Auto Sales Flat at 75,901 Vehicles in August 2025
content: Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M Ltd) reports August 2025 auto sales at 75,901 vehicles, showing flat growth including exports. Utility Vehicle segment sees domestic sales of 39,399 units, reflecting a -9% de-growth. Total Utility Vehicle sales, including exports, reach 40,846 units. Commercial Vehicle domestic sales stand at 22,427 units. Nalinikanth Gollagunta, CEO, Automotive Division, M&M Ltd, notes "August witnessed robust demand in the SUV segment amidst GST rate anticipation. Mahindra reported 7.4% YoY growth in PV Vahan registrations. Commercial vehicles saw 16% YoY growth (<7.5T LCV category)." Gollagunta added, "Ahead of the final GST announcement, wholesale billing was consciously reduced to minimize dealer stock. The company anticipates GST rationalisation to drive demand through the festive season. Total vehicle sales mirror last year's figures at 75,901 units, while SUV sales declined -9% YoY to 39,399 units." title: Gujarat Gas shares rise 2.78%; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Gujarat Gas experienced a rise of 2.78% to Rs 431.10 in Monday's session, with the stock emerging as one of the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. At 1:37 pm, the stock was trading positively compared to its previous close. On August 31, 2025, the company made an announcement under Regulation 30 (LODR) regarding newspaper publication. Gujarat Gas is set to convene its 13th Annual General Meeting on September 25, 2025, at 3:00 P.M. through VC/OAVM, according to a notice issued on August 30, 2025. The companyâ€™s Business Responsibility and Sustainability Report, along with the BRSR Assurance Report of BRSR Core for the financial year 2024-25, was reported on August 30, 2025. Gujarat Gas had a stock split where the old face value of Rs 10 was split to a new face value of Rs 2. The exsplit date was January 15, 2019 and the record date was January 16, 2019. The company has consistently distributed dividends. On May 19, 2025, a final dividend of Rs 5.82 per share (291%) was announced, effective September 4, 2025. Prior dividends include Rs 5.66 per share (283%) on May 6, 2024, effective September 9, 2024, and Rs 6.65 per share (332.5%) on May 10, 2023, effective September 11, 2023. title: Dixon Technologies shares surge 4.91% amid high volume trading on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Dixon Technologies gained 4.91% to trade at Rs 17,509.00 in Monday's session, driven by high volume and unusual trading activity. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Dixon Technologies' financial performance shows consistent growth over the past few years. The consolidated annual revenue has increased significantly, with sales rising from Rs 6,448.17 Crore in 2021 to Rs 38,860.10 Crore in 2025. Net profit also saw a substantial increase from Rs 159.79 Crore in 2021 to Rs 1,215.20 Crore in 2025. The quarterly financial performance also reflects positive trends. For the quarter ending June 2025, the consolidated revenue stood at Rs 12,835.66 Crore, and the net profit was Rs 273.26 Crore. This compares to a revenue of Rs 6,579.80 Crore and a net profit of Rs 132.26 Crore for the quarter ending June 2024. title: M&M shares among top gainers on Nifty 50, up 3.73%
content: Shares of M&M gained 3.73% to trade at Rs 3,318.90 in Monday's session, making it one of the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index at 1:30 pm. Other top gainers on Nifty 50 were Bajaj Auto, Hero Motocorp, Trent and Tata Motors. Financial Snapshot: M&M's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 45,529.19 Crore, compared to Rs 42,599.31 Crore in March 2025, Rs 41,470.05 Crore in December 2024, Rs 37,923.74 Crore in September 2024, and Rs 37,217.72 Crore in June 2024. The company's net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 3,898.44 Crore, up from Rs 3,102.48 Crore in March 2025, Rs 3,317.22 Crore in December 2024, Rs 2,894.71 Crore in September 2024, and Rs 3,221.34 Crore in June 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 36.58, compared to Rs 29.52 in March 2025, Rs 28.51 in December 2024, Rs 28.43 in September 2024 and Rs 29.44 in June 2024. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 158,749.75 Crore, compared to Rs 138,279.30 Crore in 2024, Rs 121,268.55 Crore in 2023, Rs 90,170.57 Crore in 2022, and Rs 74,277.78 Crore in 2021. The company's net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 12,535.75 Crore, up from Rs 11,148.39 Crore in 2024, Rs 9,869.04 Crore in 2023, Rs 5,397.22 Crore in 2022 and Rs 2,425.26 Crore in 2021. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 115.91, compared to Rs 101.14 in 2024, Rs 92.41 in 2023, Rs 59.20 in 2022 and Rs 16.33 in 2021. The Book Value Per Share (BVPS) for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 690.13, compared to Rs 695.30 in 2024, Rs 602.37 in 2023, Rs 510.96 in 2022, and Rs 456.20 in 2021. The Return on Equity (ROE) for the year-ending March 2025 was 16.78%, compared to 17.02% in 2024, 18.24% in 2023, 13.95% in 2022, and 4.35% in 2021. The Debt to Equity ratio for the year-ending March 2025 was 1.57, compared to 1.56 in 2024, 1.57 in 2023, 1.58 in 2022, and 1.43 in 2021. With the stock's price at Rs 3,318.90, M&M has shown strong performance and is among the top gainers on the Nifty 50.

title: MMTC to Hold 62nd AGM on September 26, 2025
content: MMTC Sets Date for 62nd AGM on September 26, 2025; To Be Held Via Video Conferencing MMTC Limited announced that its 62nd Annual General Meeting (AGM) will convene on September 26, 2025. In line with regulatory guidelines, the meeting will be conducted via Video Conferencing (VC) and Other Audio-Visual Means (OAVM), as per the Companies Act, 2013, and directives from the Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA) and SEBI. The AGM is scheduled for 11:30 AM (IST) and will be accessible from the company's registered office at Core-1, 'SCOPE Complex', 7 Institutional Area, Lodhi Road, New Delhi-110003. Key Agenda Items: Shareholders will address the following key business items: Review and adoption of the company's Financial Statements for the year ending March 31, 2025, alongside the Directors' Report, Statutory Auditors' Report, and Secretarial Auditor's Report.Granting authority to the Board of Directors for the appointment and remuneration of Statutory/Branch Auditors for the financial year 2025-26.Decision regarding filling the vacancy resulting from the retirement of Smt. Arti Bhatnagar.Appointment of M/s. BLAK & Co. as Secretarial Auditors.Appointment of Smt. Aishvarya Singh as a Non-Executive Director, Government Nominee Director.Appointment of Shri Dinesh Dubey as an Independent Director.Appointment of Shri Nitin Kumar Yadav as CMD.Appointment of Smt. Anoopa Sankarankutty Nair as Director (Finance). Participation and Voting: Shareholders can participate in the AGM using the VC/OAVM facility provided by Central Depository Services Ltd. (CDSL). Access will be available 15 minutes before and after the scheduled start time. The company is facilitating electronic voting for members, both remotely and during the AGM. Remote e-voting commences on September 22, 2025, at 9:00 AM and concludes on September 25, 2025, at 5:00 PM. Important Dates: The Register of Members and Share Transfer books will be closed from September 20, 2025, to September 26, 2025, inclusive. The AGM notice and the Annual Report for 2024-25 are being disseminated electronically to members with registered email addresses. These documents will also be accessible on the company's website and the CDSL website. The 62nd AGM will be conducted via VC/OAVM.
summary_lexrank: MMTC Sets Date for 62nd AGM on September 26, 2025; To Be Held Via Video Conferencing MMTC Limited announced that its 62nd Annual General Meeting (AGM) will convene on September 26, 2025.
summary_luhn: Key Agenda Items: Shareholders will address the following key business items: Review and adoption of the company's Financial Statements for the year ending March 31, 2025, alongside the Directors' Report, Statutory Auditors' Report, and Secretarial Auditor's Report.Granting authority to the Board of Directors for the appointment and remuneration of Statutory/Branch Auditors for the financial year 2025-26.Decision regarding filling the vacancy resulting from the retirement of Smt.

title: KEI Industries shares rise 2.08%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of KEI Industries gained 2.08% to trade at Rs 3,889.80 in Monday's session. The stock's performance placed it among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Here is a summary of KEI Industries' financial performance: Consolidated Quarterly Financials:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 2,060.50 CroreRs 2,279.65 CroreRs 2,467.27 CroreRs 2,914.79 CroreRs 2,590.32 CroreNet ProfitRs 150.25 CroreRs 154.81 CroreRs 164.81 CroreRs 226.55 CroreRs 195.75 CroreEPS16.6517.1617.8723.7120.49The company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 2,590.32 Crore, compared to Rs 2,914.79 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 195.75 Crore, compared to Rs 226.55 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was 20.49, compared to 23.71 for the quarter-ending March 2025. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was 75.65, compared to 64.37 for the year-ending March 2024. On September 4, 2025, a meeting was organized by Goldman Sachs (India) Securities Pvt. Ltd. in Hong Kong. The company announced an interim dividend of Rs.4.00 per share (200%) with an effective date of January 27, 2025. Other previous dividends include Rs 3.50 per share (effective March 19, 2024), Rs 3.00 per share (effective February 3, 2023), Rs 2.50 per share (effective February 7, 2022) and Rs 2.00 per share (effective March 9, 2021). The company had a stock split on December 21, 2006, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 2. Moneycontrol's analysis on August 26, 2025, indicated a neutral sentiment on the stock. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 3,889.80, KEI Industries has shown a positive movement in today's session and has achieved a place among top gainers.

title: Tube Investments of India shares surge 4.81% amid high volume; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Tube Investments of India Ltd's stock price jumped 4.81% to Rs 3,104.20 in Monday's session, witnessing a surge in volume and emerging as one of the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. The stock experienced a notable increase, reflecting positive investor interest. The company's financial performance reveals a steady increase in revenue over the past few quarters. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 5,309.06 Crore, up from Rs 5,149.96 Crore in March 2025, Rs 4,812.22 Crore in December 2024, Rs 4,924.55 Crore in September 2024, and Rs 4,577.92 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 303.28 Crore, compared to Rs 158.22 Crore in March 2025. On an annual basis, the company's revenue has also shown substantial growth. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 19,464.65 Crore, compared to Rs 16,890.33 Crore in March 2024. Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 1,054.67 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 1,187.51 Crore reported in March 2024. Key financial ratios for Tube Investments of India show a basic EPS of Rs 34.83 and diluted EPS of Rs 34.80 as of March 2025. The company reported a book value per share of Rs 286.08 as of the year-ending March 2025. The following table summarizes the key financial performance indicators:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Mar 20216,083.29304.6915.13Mar 202212,525.30994.3139.89Mar 202314,964.731,177.9849.50Mar 202416,890.331,187.5162.12Mar 202519,464.651,054.6734.83The company has also announced dividends. A final dividend of Rs 1.50 per share (150%) was announced on May 15, 2025, with an effective date of July 25, 2025. Earlier, an interim dividend of Rs 2.00 per share (200%) was announced on February 3, 2025, and was effective from February 7, 2025. Tube Investments of India is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. With the stock's price surge to Rs 3,104.20, Tube Investments of India demonstrates strong market activity and financial growth.

title: Hero Motocorp shares rise 2.05% in Monday's session
content: Shares of Hero Motocorp were trading higher at Rs 5,192.00, up 2.05% in Monday's session. The stock demonstrated positive movement compared to its previous close. On the financial front, Hero Motocorp has shown consistent performance. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 9,727.75 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 10,210.79 Crore reported for the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 1,076.21 Crore, compared to Rs 1,086.35 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS stood at Rs 85.26 in June 2025, significantly higher than Rs 52.31 in June 2024. Here's a summary of the company's quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 10,210.79 CroreRs 10,482.93 CroreRs 10,259.89 CroreRs 9,969.81 CroreRs 9,727.75 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,086.35 CroreRs 1,152.75 CroreRs 1,200.12 CroreRs 1,097.71 CroreRs 1,076.21 CroreEPS52.3153.1955.3858.0885.26The company's annual financial performance also reflects growth. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 40,923.42 Crore, an increase from Rs 37,788.62 Crore in March 2024. The net profit rose to Rs 4,536.93 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 3,862.41 Crore in the previous year. The EPS also increased to Rs 218.96 in March 2025 from Rs 187.36 in March 2024. Here's an overview of Hero Motocorp's yearly financial performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 30,959.19 CroreRs 29,551.28 CroreRs 34,158.38 CroreRs 37,788.62 CroreRs 40,923.42 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,982.61 CroreRs 2,528.10 CroreRs 2,796.79 CroreRs 3,862.41 CroreRs 4,536.93 CroreEPS146.07115.96140.62187.36218.96BVPS778.76800.54839.66892.17963.60ROE18.9214.6216.8721.1522.71Debt to Equity0.020.020.020.020.02The company has announced dividends, including a final dividend of Rs 65 per share (3250%) announced on May 13, 2025, with an effective date of July 24, 2025, and an interim dividend of Rs 100 per share (5000%) announced on February 6, 2025, effective from February 12, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment on the stock as of September 1, 2025. Shares of Hero Motocorp were trading higher at Rs 5,192.00 in Monday's session.
