title: Kamdhenu Ltd Board to Consider â‚¹0.25 Dividend, Reappointments on Sept 25
content: Kamdhenu Limited's board to convene its 31st Annual General Meeting September 25, 2025, via video conference to deliberate on key agenda items, including a proposed final dividend. Key items for consideration include: Audited financial statements for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2025Reports from both auditors and the board of directorsProposed declaration of a final dividend for FY25Appointment of a director to succeed Shri Saurabh Agarwal, who is retiring by rotationRe-appointment of Shri Satish Kumar Agarwal as Chairman & Managing DirectorRe-appointment of Shri Sunil Kumar Agarwal as Whole-Time DirectorRe-appointment of Shri Sachin Agarwal as Whole-Time DirectorRe-appointment of Shri Baldev Raj Sachdeva as an Independent Director for a second termAppointment of M/s. Chandrasekaran Associates as Secretarial Auditors The board will review a proposal to declare a final dividend of â‚¹0.25 per equity share (@ 25%) with a face value of â‚¹1 each, fully paid up, for the fiscal year 2024-25. The record date is set for Thursday, September 18, 2025. The AGM will also address the re-appointment of Shri Satish Kumar Agarwal as Chairman & Managing Director. His proposed remuneration is outlined below: Proposed Remuneration for Shri Satish Kumar AgarwalPeriodRemunerationApril 1, 2026 to March 31, 2027â‚¹40,00,000 per monthApril 1, 2027 to March 31, 2028â‚¹45,00,000 per monthApril 1, 2028 to March 31, 2029â‚¹50,00,000 per month In addition to the base remuneration, he is eligible for perks and benefits, including reimbursement for telephone bills, car repairs, driver salary, fuel expenses, and periodicals, capped at â‚¹1,00,000 per month, effective April 1, 2026. Shareholders will also consider the re-appointment of Shri Sunil Kumar Agarwal as a Whole-Time Director. His proposed remuneration is detailed in the table below: Proposed Remuneration for Shri Sunil Kumar AgarwalPeriodRemunerationApril 1, 2026 to March 31, 2027â‚¹40,00,000 per monthApril 1, 2027 to March 31, 2028â‚¹45,00,000 per monthApril 1, 2028 to March 31, 2029â‚¹50,00,000 per month Besides the stated remuneration, he will also be entitled to perks and other benefits up to â‚¹1,00,000 per month, effective April 1, 2026, covering expenses such as telephone, car maintenance, driver salary, and fuel. The re-appointment of Shri Sachin Agarwal as a Whole-Time Director will also be up for consideration, with his remuneration as follows: Proposed Remuneration for Shri Sachin AgarwalPeriodRemunerationApril 1, 2026 to March 31, 2027â‚¹40,00,000 per monthApril 1, 2027 to March 31, 2028â‚¹45,00,000 per monthApril 1, 2028 to March 31, 2029â‚¹50,00,000 per month Similar to the other directors, Shri Sachin Agarwal will receive perks capped at â‚¹1,00,000 monthly, commencing April 1, 2026. Shri Baldev Raj Sachdeva's re-appointment as an Independent Director for a subsequent five-year term, from May 2, 2026, to May 1, 2031, will also be considered. The AGM will also address the appointment of M/s. Chandrasekaran Associates as Secretarial Auditors for a 5-year term, auditing from FY 2025-26 to FY 2029-30. The firm will receive annual remuneration of â‚¹4,00,000, plus reimbursement of audit-related expenses as agreed with the board, for permissible services under relevant laws. Shareholders are encouraged to participate remotely in the video conference meeting.

title: Ola Electric shares surge 14.12%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150

On August 29, 2025, Mr. Madhur Deora ceased to be the Director and Executive Director of One 97 Communications Paytm.Financial PerformanceThe following table summarizes the consolidated quarterly financial performance of One 97 Communications Paytm:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,501.60 CroreRs 1,659.50 CroreRs 1,827.80 CroreRs 1,911.50 CroreRs 1,917.50 CroreNet Profit-Rs 838.80 CroreRs 925.70 Crore-Rs 208.30 Crore-Rs 544.30 CroreRs 122.10 CroreEPS-Rs 13.00Rs 14.59-Rs 3.27-Rs 8.47Rs 1.92The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,917.50 Crore, slightly up from Rs 1,911.50 Crore in March 2025. title: Larsen & Toubro shares trade lower; stock hits day's high of Rs 3,628.60
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading at Rs 3,593.70 in Monday's session. The stock is down 0.20% from its previous close and is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index as of 12:30 pm. Earlier in the day, the stock touched a high of Rs 3,628.60 and a low of Rs 3,581.90. Financial Performance: Larsen & Toubro's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the past five years. The company has demonstrated a strong ability to increase its earnings, as reflected in its growing EPS. Here's an overview of the company's key financial metrics: Consolidated Revenue (Annual):YearRevenue (Rs Crore)2021Rs 135,979.03 Crore2022Rs 156,521.23 Crore2023Rs 183,340.70 Crore2024Rs 221,112.91 Crore2025Rs 255,734.45 CroreThe revenue for Larsen & Toubro has steadily increased over the years, with a significant jump from Rs 135,979.03 Crore in 2021 to Rs 255,734.45 Crore in 2025. title: TVS Motor Company shares rise 2.11%; among top gainers on Nifty Next 50
content: TVS Motor Company shares increased by 2.11% to Rs 3345.70 in Monday's session, with the stock among the top gainers on the Nifty Next 50 index. This movement reflects a positive shift from the previous close. TVS Motor Company is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Next 50 index. Financial Snapshot: The following table summarizes the consolidated quarterly financial performance of TVS Motor Company:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 10,406.86 CroreRs 11,301.68 CroreRs 11,134.63 CroreRs 11,542.00 CroreRs 12,210.05 CroreNet ProfitRs 502.85 CroreRs 606.96 CroreRs 630.55 CroreRs 713.57 CroreRs 653.78 CroreEPS9.7011.8011.9113.6412.84The companyâ€™s revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 12,210.05 Crore, a notable increase compared to Rs 10,406.86 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 653.78 Crore, up from Rs 502.85 Crore in the previous year. The EPS also increased from 9.70 to 12.84. The following table summarizes the consolidated yearly financial performance of TVS Motor Company:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 19,420.82 CroreRs 24,355.31 CroreRs 31,973.99 CroreRs 39,144.74 CroreRs 44,089.01 CroreNet ProfitRs 615.25 CroreRs 728.39 CroreRs 1,350.19 CroreRs 1,822.01 CroreRs 2,424.02 CroreEPS12.5115.9327.9735.5047.05BVPS88.71106.36124.39142.78178.98ROE15.5217.2024.1324.8526.29Debt to Equity2.443.483.933.733.25The companyâ€™s revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 44,089.01 Crore, which increased from Rs 39,144.74 Crore in March 2024. The net profit saw a rise, reaching Rs 2,424.02 Crore, compared to Rs 1,822.01 Crore in the previous year. The EPS also improved from 35.50 to 47.05. The income statement for the year ending March 2025 shows sales of Rs 44,089 Crore, other income of Rs 69 Crore, and total income of Rs 44,158 Crore. Total expenditure amounted to Rs 38,485 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 5,672 Crore. Interest paid was Rs 2,093 Crore, and tax expenses were Rs 1,155 Crore, leading to a net profit of Rs 2,424 Crore. Corporate Actions: TVS Motor Company announced a bonus issue with a ratio of 4:1, with the ex-bonus date being August 25, 2025. Additionally, the company announced an interim dividend of Rs 10 per share (1000%) on March 20, 2025, with an effective date of March 26, 2025. As of March 2025, key financial ratios include a basic EPS of Rs 47.05, a book value per share of Rs 178.98, and a dividend per share of Rs 10.00. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 3.25 as of the year-ending March 2025. The P/E ratio stood at 10.29, the P/B ratio at 13.52, and the EV/EBITDA at 20.71. According to a Moneycontrol analysis, the sentiment for TVS Motor Company is very bullish as of September 1, 2025.

title: Bajaj Auto shares among top gainers on Nifty 50, M&M and Trent follow

M&M followed, trading at Rs 3,291.20 with a 2.87% increase, and Trent at Rs 5,421.50, gaining 2.33%. Tata Motors and Asian Paints also saw increases, trading at Rs 683.70 (up 2.2%) and Rs 2,566.20 (up 1.89%) respectively at 12:30 pm. Financial Overview: Nippon Life India Asset Management's financial performance shows consistent growth in key metrics. title: ITC shares fall 1% in today's session; over 38.7 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of ITC were trading lower in Monday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 405.65, a 1% decline from the previous close as of 12:20 pm. Over 38.7 lakh shares were traded in today's session so far.Financial PerformanceITC's financial performance reveals key insights into its revenue and profitability trends. The following tables provide a detailed overview of the company's consolidated quarterly and annual results.Quarterly ResultsHere's a summary of ITC's consolidated quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 18,457.33 CroreRs 19,990.36 CroreRs 18,790.17 CroreRs 18,765.00 CroreRs 21,494.79 CroreNet ProfitRs 5,169.37 CroreRs 5,050.28 CroreRs 5,009.08 CroreRs 19,709.47 CroreRs 5,274.65 CroreEPS4.083.993.9515.774.19The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 21,494.79 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 18,457.33 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 5,274.65 Crore as compared to Rs 5,169.37 Crore in June 2024. The EPS increased to 4.19 in June 2025 from 4.08 in June 2024.Annual ResultsThe following table presents ITC's consolidated annual financial performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 49,272.78 CroreRs 60,668.09 CroreRs 70,936.85 CroreRs 70,881.00 CroreRs 75,323.34 CroreNet ProfitRs 13,389.80 CroreRs 15,485.65 CroreRs 19,427.68 CroreRs 20,723.75 CroreRs 19,926.05 CroreEPS10.7012.3715.5016.4227.79BVPS49.3150.9855.9559.9955.96ROE21.8024.4027.7527.4549.61Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The annual revenue saw an increase to Rs 75,323.34 Crore in 2025 from Rs 70,881.00 Crore in 2024. However, the net profit decreased to Rs 19,926.05 Crore in 2025, from Rs 20,723.75 Crore in the previous year. The EPS increased to 27.79 in 2025 from 16.42 in 2024.Income Statement - YearlyThe following table shows the yearly income statement:Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 75,323 CroreRs 70,881 CroreRs 70,936 CroreRs 60,668 CroreRs 49,272 CroreOther IncomeRs 2,529 CroreRs 2,727 CroreRs 1,980 CroreRs 1,836 CroreRs 2,632 CroreTotal IncomeRs 77,853 CroreRs 73,608 CroreRs 72,917 CroreRs 62,504 CroreRs 51,905 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 50,991 CroreRs 46,450 CroreRs 47,008 CroreRs 41,742 CroreRs 33,915 CroreEBITRs 26,861 CroreRs 27,158 CroreRs 25,909 CroreRs 20,762 CroreRs 17,989 CroreInterestRs 45 CroreRs 45 CroreRs 43 CroreRs 39 CroreRs 44 CroreTaxRs 6,890 CroreRs 6,388 CroreRs 6,438 CroreRs 5,237 CroreRs 4,555 CroreNet ProfitRs 19,926 CroreRs 20,723 CroreRs 19,427 CroreRs 15,485 CroreRs 13,389 CroreThe sales for March 2025 was Rs 75,323 Crore compared to Rs 70,881 Crore in March 2024. The company announced a bonus issue with a ratio of 4:1, with the ex-bonus date set as August 25, 2025. Additionally, the company has a history of paying dividends, with the most recent interim dividend of Rs 10.00 per share (1000%) announced on March 20, 2025, and an effective date of March 26, 2025. The company also launched TVS ORBITER, New India's Smart, Sustainable, Urban EV Commute on August 28, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis indicates very bullish sentiment on the stock as of September 1, 2025. With the stock hitting a 52-week high, TVS Motor Company showcases strong financial performance and positive market sentiment.

title: Nifty 50 top losers today: ITC, Sun Pharma, Tata Consumer Products stocks drag
content: Shares of ITC are trading among the top losers on the Nifty 50, with the stock priced at Rs 405.50, a decline of 1.04% in Monday's session at 12:30 pm. Other top losers on the Nifty 50 included Sun Pharma, TATA Cons. Prod, Larsen, and HDFC Bank. Here's a review of ITC's recent financial performance and corporate actions:ITC Financial HighlightsITC's financial performance reveals key insights into its revenue, profitability, and overall financial health. Below is a summary of the consolidated financial results.Consolidated Quarterly ResultsThe following table summarizes ITC's consolidated quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 18,457.33 CroreRs 19,990.36 CroreRs 18,790.17 CroreRs 18,765.00 CroreRs 21,494.79 CroreNet ProfitRs 5,169.37 CroreRs 5,050.28 CroreRs 5,009.08 CroreRs 19,709.47 CroreRs 5,274.65 CroreEPS4.083.993.9515.774.19In the quarterly results, there is an increase in revenue from Rs 18,457.33 crore in June 2024 to Rs 21,494.79 crore in June 2025. The net profit also increased from Rs 5,169.37 crore to Rs 5,274.65 crore for the same period. Earnings per share (EPS) increased from 4.08 to 4.19.Consolidated Yearly ResultsThe yearly performance is captured in the table below:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 49,272.78 CroreRs 60,668.09 CroreRs 70,936.85 CroreRs 70,881.00 CroreRs 75,323.34 CroreNet ProfitRs 13,389.80 CroreRs 15,485.65 CroreRs 19,427.68 CroreRs 20,723.75 CroreRs 19,926.05 CroreEPS10.7012.3715.5016.4227.79BVPS49.3150.9855.9559.9955.96ROE21.8024.4027.7527.4549.61Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The yearly results show a progressive increase in revenue from Rs 49,272.78 crore in 2021 to Rs 75,323.34 crore in 2025. However, net profit increased until 2024 and then slightly decreased in 2025. The Earnings per share (EPS) have seen an increase, and the company maintains a debt-free status with a Debt-to-Equity ratio of 0.00.Consolidated Yearly Income StatementThe following table presents Here are some key highlights:Allotment of ESOP/ESPS: On August 19, 2025, ITC announced the allotment of shares under its Employee Stock Option Schemes.Newspaper Publication: On August 12, 2025, ITC published a notice regarding the re-lodgement of transfer requests for shares held in physical form.Media Statement and Investor Presentation: On August 1, 2025, ITC released its media statement and investor presentation for Q1 FY 2025-26.In addition to these recent announcements, ITC has a history of distributing dividends and bonus shares, as well as executing stock splits.DividendsITC has consistently distributed dividends to its shareholders. Notable dividends include:Final Dividend (May 22, 2025): Rs.7.85 per share (785%)Interim Dividend (Feb 06, 2025): Rs.6.50 per share (650%)Bonus SharesITC has issued bonus shares at various times, including:May 20, 2016: 1:2 bonus ratioJune 18, 2010: 1:1 bonus ratioStock SplitsITC executed a stock split on September 21, 2005, changing the face value from Rs 10 to Rs 1. In conclusion, ITC's stock is currently trading among the top losers on the Nifty 50, and its financial performance shows steady growth in revenue but fluctuating net profits. The company continues to engage in corporate actions to enhance shareholder value.

title: Sensex rises 350 pts, Nifty above 24,550 as auto, IT stocks soar; India VIX eases 2%
content: Nifty and Sensex powered ahead on Monday afternoon, September 1, riding a strong wave in IT, auto, and metal stocks, while mid- and smallcaps stole the spotlight with an even sharper rally. At 12:20 pm, the Sensex was up 348.04 points or 0.44 percent at 80,157.69, and the Nifty was up 124.40 points or 0.51 percent at 24,551.25. About 2447 shares advanced, 1215 shares declined, and 156 shares remained unchanged. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates At mid-day, the market was trading firm with broad-based gains across sectors. Nifty IT led the charge, up 1.6 percent, followed by auto and consumer durables, both rising over 1 percent. Energy, metals, and midcaps also advanced more than 1 percent each, while PSU banks, infra, and realty posted modest gains. FMCG and media were marginally in the red, while the India VIX eased nearly 2 percent, reflecting lower volatility. PG Electroplast surged 3 percent after its subsidiary, Next Generation Manufacturers, entered into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Government of Maharashtra. This upcoming project is part of the stateâ€™s Magnetic Maharashtra initiative and aims to develop integrated manufacturing capacities for air conditioners, washing machines, refrigerators, and related products. The facility is expected to generate over 5,000 direct and indirect employment opportunities, strengthening the consumer electronics ecosystem in western India. Also read: BSE, MCX, other capital market stocks jump up to 5%: Here are possible reasons behind sharp rally Two-wheeler major Bajaj Auto rallied as much as 3.5 percent on Monday after the company posted a sales uptick for August. Total sales climbed 5 percent year-on-year to 4,17,616 units, while year-to-date sales for Aprilâ€“August stood at 18,94,853 units, up 2 percent from 18,54,029 units a year earlier. Ashok Leyland shares traded higher on Monday after the company reported August sales of 15,239 units, surpassing CNBC-TV18â€™s poll estimate of 14,967 units. Total sales rose 5 percent from 14,463 units a year ago, driven by an 8 percent jump in medium and heavy commercial vehicle (M&HCV) sales to 9,381 units from 8,663 units last year. Technical View "While it took 8 days for Nifty to swing higher from the lower bollinger band to the upper bollinger band, we are close to the lower bollinger band again in just another 6 days. August low of 24337 is precariously close, a break of which could expose 24077, the 200 day moving average, and the fibo support of 23860," Anand James of Geojit Investments Ltd said. "But, it cannot be ignored that, except for the indecisive day on August 25th, the declines so far have been large, raising the possibility of a mean reversion move higher. For this to materialise, a quick swing back above 24350, in the event of a first half collapse, or a push above 24550-608 band needs to be seen," he added. Bajaj Auto, M&M, Trent, Infosys, Asian Paints, and Power Grid Corp were the top gainers on the Nifty. Laggards on the index included ITC, Sun Pharma, Reliance Industries, Tata Consumer Products, and HDFC Bank. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Swan Energy to Meet Investors on September 4, 2025
content: Swan Energy (503310.BO) has scheduled meetings with institutional investors, including a conference with Samco MF in Mumbai on September 4, 2025. The meeting is slated as an in-person event in Mumbai. The company noted that the schedule is subject to change and that no unpublished price-sensitive information will be disclosed during the meetings. This announcement is made in compliance with Regulation 30 of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015. Swan Energy's registered office is at 6 FELTHAM HOUSE, 2nd FLOOR, 10, J. N. HEREDIA MARG, BALLRD ESTATE, MUMBAI 400 001. The company's scrip code is 503310, and its symbol is SWANENERGY. Paresh Merchant, Whole-time Director of Swan Energy Limited, signed the announcement. The meeting schedule remains subject to change based on exigencies of analysts, investors, or the Company.

title: Solar Industries India shares rise 2.04% in today's trading session
content: Shares of Solar Industries India gained 2.04% to trade at Rs 14076.00 on Monday at 12:11 pm. The stock is among the gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On the financial front, Solar Industries India has demonstrated consistent growth in both quarterly and annual results. The company's consolidated quarterly revenue has increased steadily, with the latest figure for the quarter-ending June 2025 at Rs 2,154.45 Crore. This is an increase compared to Rs 1,694.78 Crore in June 2024. Similarly, the net profit has risen from Rs 298.47 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 352.56 Crore in June 2025. The EPS has also seen an upward trend, moving from Rs 31.66 to Rs 37.43 over the same period. Looking at the consolidated annual figures, Solar Industries India has shown substantial growth over the years. Revenue has increased from Rs 2,515.63 Crore in 2021 to Rs 7,540.26 Crore in 2025. The net profit has grown from Rs 288.07 Crore in 2021 to Rs 1,282.38 Crore in 2025. The EPS has also risen significantly from Rs 30.54 to Rs 133.65 during the same period. The BVPS has increased from Rs 181.45 in 2021 to Rs 484.68 in 2025.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 2,515.63 CroreRs 3,947.61 CroreRs 6,922.53 CroreRs 6,069.52 CroreRs 7,540.26 CroreNet ProfitRs 288.07 CroreRs 455.47 CroreRs 811.44 CroreRs 874.88 CroreRs 1,282.38 CroreEPS30.5448.7783.6892.38133.65BVPS181.45222.64303.94378.70484.68ROE17.4923.0529.0025.2827.57Debt to Equity0.400.450.450.330.21The annual income statement shows consistent growth. title: Atul Auto Sales Rise 6.77% to 3,026 Units in August 2025
content: Atul Auto (BSE: 531795) reports August 2025 sales, with total units sold reaching 3,026, a 6.77% increase compared to the 2,834 units sold in August 2024. Domestic Sales: Atul Auto's domestic sales for August 2025 totaled 2,601 units, a 4.83% decrease from the 2,733 units sold in August 2024. Key figures include: Three-wheeler IC Engine vehicles: 1,894 units, up 5.99% from 1,787 units year-over-year.EV-L3 vehicles: 575 units, a 31.14% decrease from 835 units year-over-year.EV-L5 vehicles: 132 units, an 18.92% increase from 111 units year-over-year. Year-to-date (YTD) domestic sales show a 1.44% increase, with 11,396 units sold in FY 25-26 compared to 11,234 units in FY 24-25. Key details: Three-wheeler IC Engine vehicles: 2,319 units, a 22.83% increase from 1,888 units year-over-year.EV-L3 vehicles: 575 units, a 31.14% decrease from 835 units year-over-year.EV-L5 vehicles: 132 units, an 18.92% increase from 111 units year-over-year. YTD combined sales show a 5.13% increase, with 12,675 units sold in FY 25-26 compared to 12,057 units in FY 24-25. title: Infosys shares gain 1.82% in today's session; over 20.5 lakh shares traded
content: Infosys shares were trading with a gain of 1.82% at Rs 1,496.30 on the NSE at 12:20 pm. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index; over 20.5 lakh shares changed hands in today's session. Trading Volume and Market Impact The traded volume for Infosys shares on the NSE reached over 20.5 lakh shares. Financial Performance Infosys's financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the years. The net profit also saw an increase from Rs 26,248 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 26,750 Crore in March 2025. Consolidated Income Statement (Quarterly)Jun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024SalesRs 42,279 CroreRs 40,925 CroreRs 41,764 CroreRs 40,986 CroreRs 39,315 CroreOther IncomeRs 1,042 CroreRs 1,190 CroreRs 859 CroreRs 712 CroreRs 838 CroreTotal IncomeRs 43,321 CroreRs 42,115 CroreRs 42,623 CroreRs 41,698 CroreRs 40,153 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 33,476 CroreRs 32,350 CroreRs 32,852 CroreRs 32,337 CroreRs 31,027 CroreEBITRs 9,845 CroreRs 9,765 CroreRs 9,771 CroreRs 9,361 CroreRs 9,126 CroreInterestRs 105 CroreRs 102 CroreRs 101 CroreRs 108 CroreRs 105 CroreTaxRs 2,816 CroreRs 2,625 CroreRs 2,848 CroreRs 2,737 CroreRs 2,647 CroreNet ProfitRs 6,924 CroreRs 7,038 CroreRs 6,822 CroreRs 6,516 CroreRs 6,374 CroreThe quarterly sales for Infosys increased from Rs 40,925 Crore in March 2025 to Rs 42,279 Crore in June 2025. The net profit decreased from Rs 7,038 Crore in March 2025 to Rs 6,924 Crore in June 2025. Key Financial Ratios Infosys reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 for the year ending March 2025. The basic EPS (Rs.) stood at 64.50 and diluted EPS (Rs.) was 64.34 as of March 2025. Corporate Actions Infosys announced allotment of ESOPs on August 30, 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 22.00 per share (440%) with an effective date of May 30, 2025. The company has also announced bonus issues in the past, including a 1:1 bonus on July 13, 2018. A split with an exsplit date of January 24, 2000, involved changing the face value from Rs 10 to Rs 5. Moneycontrol analysis as of 2025-08-25 suggests a bullish sentiment for Infosys. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,496.30, Infosys has seen a positive movement from its previous close.

title: KPIT Technologies shares rise 2.01% in intraday trade
content: Shares of KPIT Technologies gained 2.01% to trade at Rs 1,214.40 on Monday. The stock is among the top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150 index, showing positive momentum in today's session at 12:13 pm. On the financial front, KPIT Technologies has demonstrated consistent growth. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,538.76 Crore, compared to Rs 1,364.63 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same quarter was Rs 177.02 Crore, a decrease compared to Rs 204.82 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS stood at Rs 6.32 in June 2025, down from Rs 7.53 in June 2024. Looking at the annual consolidated results, the revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 5,842.35 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 4,871.54 Crore in March 2024. The net profit also increased significantly to Rs 836.80 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 599.05 Crore in March 2024. The EPS rose from Rs 21.95 in March 2024 to Rs 30.93 in March 2025. The following table summarizes the key financial figures:Financials (Consolidated)Mar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 2,035.74 CroreRs 2,432.39 CroreRs 3,365.04 CroreRs 4,871.54 CroreRs 5,842.35 CroreNet ProfitRs 147.10 CroreRs 276.05 CroreRs 384.47 CroreRs 599.05 CroreRs 836.80 CroreEPS5.4310.1714.1021.9530.93BVPS44.9649.0861.5279.75107.18ROE12.1020.9423.0627.7028.83Debt to Equity0.000.000.030.020.00KPIT Technologies has demonstrated steady financial performance over the past five years. Sales have increased year-over-year, from Rs 2,035 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 5,842 Crore in March 2025. Other income has fluctuated, reaching Rs 167 Crore in March 2025. Total expenditure has risen in line with income, with EBIT showing consistent growth, reaching Rs 1,172 Crore in March 2025. Net profit has also shown a steady increase, reaching Rs 836 Crore in March 2025. The company announced several investor meet outcomes under Regulation 30 (LODR) on August 18, 20, and 21, 2025. The company has also announced dividends. A final dividend of Rs 6.00 per share (60%) was announced on April 28, 2025, with an effective date of July 28, 2025. An interim dividend of Rs 2.50 per share (25%) was announced on January 29, 2025, with an effective date of February 4, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a bearish sentiment on the stock as of September 1, 2025.
summary_lexrank: The net profit also increased significantly to Rs 836.80 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 599.05 Crore in March 2024.

title: Bajaj Finance shares trade flat; stock down 0.27% in last 1 hour
content: Shares of Bajaj Finance were trading at Rs 884.95, a decline of 0.81% in Monday's session. The stock experienced a slight downturn of 0.27% in the last one hour, with its previous hour price at Rs 887.35 at 11:50 am. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. The company has demonstrated consistent financial performance over the past several years. The consolidated annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 69,683.51 Crore, a notable increase compared to Rs 54,969.49 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also saw an increase, reaching Rs 16,761.67 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, up from Rs 14,443.53 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. Here is a summary of Bajaj Finance's key financial data:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity202126,668.104,419.8273.58613.6711.973.57202231,632.427,028.23116.64724.5616.073.78202341,397.3811,506.02190.53899.5321.163.99202454,969.4914,443.53236.891,241.0318.843.82202569,683.5116,761.67268.941,557.4317.203.74The companyâ€™s revenue has consistently increased, with a rise from Rs 54,969.49 Crore in 2024 to Rs 69,683.51 Crore in 2025. Similarly, the net profit has grown from Rs 14,443.53 Crore in 2024 to Rs 16,761.67 Crore in 2025. Here is a summary of Bajaj Finance's key quarterly financial data:QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPSJun 202416,098.673,909.4663.28Sep 202417,090.274,010.2964.66Dec 202418,035.114,305.1768.63Mar 202518,456.854,536.7572.35Jun 202519,523.884,764.557.57The quarterly revenue also shows a growth trend, with revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 at Rs 19,523.88 Crore, up from Rs 16,098.67 Crore in the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 4,764.55 Crore, compared to Rs 3,909.46 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. Bajaj Finance announced several corporate actions, including allotment of equity shares under Employee Stock Option Scheme, 2009, and newspaper publication regarding Special window for re-lodgement of transfer deeds. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 44 per share (2200%) with effective date of May 30, 2025. Earlier, a special dividend of Rs 12 per share (600%) was announced on April 29, 2025, effective from May 9, 2025. The company also announced a bonus issue with bonus ratio of 4:1. The record and ex-bonus date was June 16, 2025. The company announced stock split with old face value of Rs 2 and new face value of Rs 1. The record and ex-split date was June 16, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis on August 25, 2025, indicated a bullish sentiment for the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 884.95, Bajaj Finance has shown a marginal decline in today's session and a slight downturn in the last hour.

title: Larsen & Toubro shares trade flat; stock hits day's high of Rs 3,628.60
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading flat in Monday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 3,598.40. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. This comes as the stock touched a day's high of Rs 3,628.60 and a day's low of Rs 3,581.90 at 11:40 am. In corporate actions, Larsen & Toubro announced a final dividend of Rs 34 per share on May 8, 2025, with an effective date of June 3, 2025. Prior to this, a final dividend of Rs 28 per share was announced on May 8, 2024, and became effective on June 20, 2024. Here is a summary of Larsen & Toubro's financial performance:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)2021Rs 135,979.03 CroreRs 4,668.96 Crore82.492022Rs 156,521.23 CroreRs 10,291.05 Crore61.712023Rs 183,340.70 CroreRs 12,624.87 Crore74.512024Rs 221,112.91 CroreRs 15,569.72 Crore93.962025Rs 255,734.45 CroreRs 17,687.39 Crore109.36The company has shown consistent growth in both revenue and net profit over the past five years. Revenue increased from Rs 135,979.03 Crore in 2021 to Rs 255,734.45 Crore in 2025. Net profit also rose significantly from Rs 4,668.96 Crore in 2021 to Rs 17,687.39 Crore in 2025.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 2024Rs 55,119.82 CroreRs 3,440.11 Crore20.26Sep 2024Rs 61,554.58 CroreRs 4,112.81 Crore24.69Dec 2024Rs 64,667.78 CroreRs 4,001.03 Crore24.43Mar 2025Rs 74,392.28 CroreRs 6,133.44 Crore39.98Jun 2025Rs 63,678.92 CroreRs 4,325.57 Crore26.30The quarterly financials also reflect a positive trend. Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 63,678.92 Crore, and net profit was Rs 4,325.57 Crore. The earnings per share (EPS) for the same period was Rs 26.30. Larsen & Toubro's balance sheet as of March 2025 shows a share capital of Rs 275 Crore and reserves & surplus of Rs 97,380 Crore. The company's total liabilities amounted to Rs 379,524 Crore, with total assets matching the same value.RatioMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025Basic EPS (Rs.)82.4961.7174.5193.96109.36Diluted Eps (Rs.)82.4161.6574.4593.88109.28Book Value [Excl. Reval Reserve]/Share (Rs.)625.97678.79736.87746.01710.12Dividend/Share (Rs.)36.0022.0024.0034.0034.00Key financial ratios for Larsen & Toubro show a P/E (x) ratio of 31.93 and a P/B (x) ratio of 4.92 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.33 as of the year-ending March 2025. Larsen & Toubro has a history of bonus issues, with the most recent one declared on May 29, 2017, in the ratio of 1:2, with an ex-bonus date of July 13, 2017. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 3,598.40, Larsen & Toubro witnessed volatility in today's session, touching a day's high of Rs 3,628.60.

title: Mahindra and Mahindra shares rise 2.02% in morning trade
content: Shares of Mahindra and Mahindra gained 2.02% to trade at Rs 3,264 at 11:47 am on Monday. This increase reflects a positive movement compared to the previous close. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 25.30 per share (506%) on May 5, 2025, with an effective date of July 4, 2025. Earlier dividends include Rs 21.10 per share (422%) on May 16, 2024, and Rs 16.25 per share (325%) on May 26, 2023. The company has also issued bonus shares. A 1:1 bonus ratio was announced on November 10, 2017, with an ex-bonus date of December 21, 2017. Another 1:1 bonus was announced on June 14, 2005. Additionally, Mahindra and Mahindra had a stock split on January 25, 2010, with the old face value of Rs 10 split into a new face value of Rs 5, effective March 29, 2010. Recent announcements include an analyst/investor meet and a press release/media release, as per disclosures to the BSE. Moneycontrol analysis, as of August 29, 2025, indicates bearish sentiment on the stock. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 3,264, Mahindra and Mahindra has seen a positive movement in today's session.

title: Buy Suzlon Energy; target of Rs 80: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Suzlon Energy We recently hosted Mr. J.P. Chalasani, Group CEO of Suzlon Energy (SUEL), for an expert session on the wind industry. Mr. Chalasani has reiterated his long-term commitment to SUEL, highlighting that his position as CEO carries no defined sunset clause. He noted that an approved list of models and manufacturers (ALMM) in wind turbine generator (WTG) manufacturing is likely the first step toward reducing Indiaâ€™s import dependence, with the government possibly extending localization mandates further in the coming years. He believes that foreign OEMsâ€™ transition to building domestically may entail multiple complex and time-consuming challenges. However, more details about the localization order are still awaited and can add to the complexity of indigenization. Outlook Overall, we continue to believe SUEL remains well-placed to benefit from favorable policy tailwinds, localized supply chain advantages, in-house R&D, and execution readiness vs. global and domestic peers. We reiterate our BUY rating on SUEL with a target price of INR 80. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Motilal_Suzlon

title: Buy Reliance Industries; target of Rs 1,700: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Reliance Industries RJio has reached the milestone of 500m subscribers (498m at Junâ€™25 end) and accelerated the pace of home broadband net adds to 1m+ per month. RILâ€™s Chairman announced that the company has made all arrangements to file for JPLâ€™s IPO, with an aim to list the company by 1HCY26. We currently value JPL at an Enterprise value of INR13.3t (USD151b), based on 13.5x Sepâ€™27 EV/EBITDA, which implies an overall equity value of INR 11.9t (USD135b) for JPL (INR 585/share attributable to RIL). Outlook We value RJio based on DCF â€“ implied 13.5x Sepâ€™27E EV/EBITDA to arrive at our enterprise valuation of INR 12.5t (USD142b) and assign USD9b valuation to other offerings under JPL. Factoring in net debt and the 33.6% minority stake, the attributable value for RIL comes to INR 585/share. Using the SoTP method, we value the O2C/E&P segments at 7.5x/5.0x Sepâ€™27E EV/EBITDA to arrive at an enterprise value of INR 5.5t (or INR407/sh) for the standalone business. We ascribe an equity valuation of INR 585/sh and INR 605/sh to RILâ€™s stake in JPL and RRVL, respectively. We assign INR 110/sh (INR 1.5t equity value) to the New Energy business and INR 26/sh to RILâ€™s stake in JioStar. We reiterate our BUY rating with an unchanged TP of INR 1,700. title: Buy SRF; target of Rs 3,650: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on SRF The Kigali Amendment categorizes countries into Non-Article 5 (developed nations) and Article 5 (developing nations, split into Group 1 and Group 2) with differentiated baseline periods and freeze years. For India (A5 Group 2), the baseline is the average of CY24-26 plus 65% of HCFC usage, with CY28 as the freeze year. Outlook Asia is expected to remain the key growth driver for HFC demand as developed nations transition to lower-GWP alternatives. With HCFC consumption concentrated in Asia, the region particularly India is poised for incremental growth, driven by the ongoing shift from HCFCs to HFCs and regulatory controls on trade. We expect SRF to post a CAGR of 16%/30%/42% in revenue/EBITDA/adjusted PAT over FY25-27. We reiterate BUY with our FY27 SoTP-based TP of INR 3,650. title: BSE, MCX, other capital market stocks jump up to 5%: Here are possible reasons behind sharp rally
content: The shares of capital market stocks surged on September 1 amid a broader uptrend in the markets. The sharp rise in the share prices pushed the Nifty Capital Markets index up around 2.5 percent to snap a four-day losing streak. Nifty Capital Markets index was trading in the deep green at around 4,193 in the morning trading hours of Monday, after closing in the red for the entire holiday-shortened last week. Here are some of the key reasons behind the sharp rise in the capital market stocks: Markets in green: After three consecutive sessions of closing in the red, benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty were trading in green as strong GDP numbers and other key factors boosted investor sentiment. Sensex gained over 300 points (0.4 percent) to hover near 80,100, while Nifty 50 rose over 100 points (0.4 percent) to reclaim the 24,500-mark. The optimism in the stock markets could have provided a boost to the capital market stocks. Rising gold, silver prices: Gold and silver prices have been rallying over the past couple of sessions, as rising global uncertainties polished the safe-have appeal of the precious metals. Goldâ€™s future contracts with October expiry on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) hit a fresh all-time high of Rs 1,05,937 per 10 grams today. Silver futures with December expiry were also at a lifetime high level of Rs 1,24,470 per kilogram on MCX. The sharp rise in the metal futures may have boosted the share price on MCX, which is up around 5 percent. "Along with increasing rate cut expectations, tensions between Israel and Gaza and other geo-political tensions and the tariff escalations are continuously supporting buying in bullions, as increased expectations of a U.S. Federal Reserve interest rate cut this month lifted bullion's allure. U.S. consumer spending increased solidly in July while underlying inflation picked up as tariffs on imports raised prices of some goods, but that data will probably not prevent the Fed from cutting interest rates this month...Increase in festive and wedding demand, ETF buying and increased premiums in China are some of the additional factors supporting gold's bull run," said Manav Modi, Analyst of Precious Metal - Research, Motilal Oswal Financial Services. NSE revises quantity freeze limits for index derivatives: Effective from today, NSE has revised the quantity freeze limits for index derivatives contracts. As per the revised framework, the applicable freeze limits for key indices will be: Bank Nifty at 900, Nifty 50 at 1,800, Finnifty at 1,800, Nifty Midcap Select at 2,800, and Nifty Next 50 at 600. Under the earlier circular effective July 1, the limit was lower for Bank Nifty at 600. The latest revision effectively increases the permissible order size for Bank Nifty futures and options, while retaining the freeze limits for other contracts. Quantity freeze limits act as a safeguard to prevent erroneous or abnormally large orders that could disrupt market stability. By increasing the ceiling, NSE can see some larger trades being placed in the stock market. This may have had an impact on the capital market stocks today. Value buying: The capital market stocks have seen strong downturn in the recent days, tracking the overall the downturn in the stock markets. After a four-day fall, investors may have now resorted to value buying. The stocks see heavy volumes today, with nearly 3 lakh shares of Anand Rathi being involved in active trade in just two hours into the session. This is around 3 times that of its 10-day average volumes. MCX and Anand Rathi Wealth shares gained around 5 percent each to trade at Rs 7,754 apiece and Rs 2,929 apiece respectively. The shares of Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and KFin Tech shares jumped nearly 4 percent each. Motilal Oswal Financial Services shares rose over 3 percent, while Central Depository Services (CDSL) and CAMS shares were up over 2 percent each. NAM India, Angel One and Indian Energy Exchange (IEX) shares were up around 2 percent each, while UTI AMC, 360 One WAM, HDFC AMC and Nuvama shares were up around 1 percent each. Newly-listed NSDL, which is not part of the index, gained around 3 percent. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates
summary_lexrank: MCX and Anand Rathi Wealth shares gained around 5 percent each to trade at Rs 7,754 apiece and Rs 2,929 apiece respectively.

title: Bajaj Auto shares rise 2.03% in Monday's trading session
content: Shares of Bajaj Auto gained 2.03% to trade at Rs 8,806.50 in today's session. At 11:09 am, the stock demonstrated positive movement compared to its previous close, reflecting positive investor activity. title: United Breweries shares decline 2.14% amid volume surge
content: United Breweries shares experienced a decline of 2.14% to trade at Rs 1,810.50 in Monday's session, driven by high volume. The scrip is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Performance: United Breweries' financial performance reveals the following trends: Consolidated Quarterly Results:Revenue: The company's revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,864.32 Crore, compared to Rs 2,475.13 Crore in June 2024.Net Profit: The net profit for the June 2025 quarter was Rs 184.03 Crore, up from Rs 173.80 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year.EPS: The Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased to Rs 6.95 for June 2025, from Rs 6.56 in June 2024.Consolidated Yearly Results:Revenue: The company's revenue for the year ending March 2025 increased to Rs 8,915.09 Crore, compared to Rs 8,122.68 Crore in March 2024.Net Profit: The net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 442.41 Crore, up from Rs 410.86 Crore in March 2024.EPS: The Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased to Rs 16.71 for March 2025, from Rs 15.51 in March 2024.Income Statement (Consolidated - Yearly): The following table presents the key figures from the income statement:Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 8,915 CroreRs 8,122 CroreRs 7,499 CroreRs 5,838 CroreRs 4,243 CroreOther IncomeRs 35 CroreRs 73 CroreRs 49 CroreRs 29 CroreRs 50 CroreTotal IncomeRs 8,950 CroreRs 8,196 CroreRs 7,549 CroreRs 5,868 CroreRs 4,293 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 8,333 CroreRs 7,638 CroreRs 7,127 CroreRs 5,359 CroreRs 4,101 CroreEBITRs 617 CroreRs 558 CroreRs 421 CroreRs 509 CroreRs 192 CroreInterestRs 12 CroreRs 6 CroreRs 4 CroreRs 14 CroreRs 22 CroreTaxRs 162 CroreRs 140 CroreRs 112 CroreRs 128 CroreRs 55 CroreNet ProfitRs 442 CroreRs 410 CroreRs 304 CroreRs 366 CroreRs 113 CroreThe company's sales increased from Rs 4,243 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 8,915 Crore in March 2025. Similarly, the net profit increased from Rs 113 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 442 Crore in March 2025. 2025. Earlier corporate actions include a stock split on June 9, 2006, and rights issues in 2004 and 2008. The company has made several announcements under Regulation 30 of SEBI (LODR) Regulations 2015, including updates on capacity addition and newspaper publications. The company also issued a notice for a postal ballot. The stock reflects very bearish sentiment, according to a Moneycontrol analysis. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,810.50, United Breweries experienced a decline of 2.14% amid volume surge.

title: Ola Electric shares surge 11.45% amid high volume trading in today's session
content: Shares of Ola Electric Mobility experienced a significant surge of 11.45% in Monday's session, with the stock price reaching Rs 60.24. Trading activity suggested a substantial increase in investor interest, marked by a notable jump in volume. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Snapshot: Key financial metrics for Ola Electric Mobility include both quarterly and annual results. All data is consolidated. Income Statement - Quarterly: The quarterly performance overview shows fluctuating revenue and persistent net losses. title: Buy Reliance Industries; target of Rs 1,555: PL Capital
content: PL Capital's research report on Reliance Industries The company highlighted how it has crossed 500mn customers and has emerged as the worldâ€™s largest wireless data carrier. The next leg of growth is expected from building simple, scalable and secure platforms for MSMEs and enterprises. In addition to the earlier announced Jio AI Cloud, the company announced two new features this AGM- Jio PC and Jio Frames. The first enables converting any TV or screen into AI-ready computer by plugging a keyboard into Jio Set-Top Box. The latter is an AI powered wearable platform and ecosystem and enables clicking photos and recording videos. It aims to list Jio in H1CY26 subject to necessary approvals. Outlook The company has successfully demonstrated its ability to execute large scale unrelated diversifications through its foray into retail as well as digital services in the past. Since 2021, it has been working on its New Energy segment where it has also partnered with several technology companies. In absence of further details, we have valued its New Energy segment at 2x its stated capex of Rs 750bn, valuing it at Rs111/share. However, New Energy segment faces 1) overcapacity and ability of the Chinese to crash prices, 2) rapid changes in technologies, 3) tight control of Chinese over the supply-chain, and 4) lack of ecosystem in the country. We have also highlighted in our thematic note the difficulties faced by non-Chinese companies in this segment, which has seen ten large size bankruptcies in 2024 alone. We use SOTP to value the company at Rs 1,555 (unchanged). The stock has corrected by 7% since our last note. Due to the same, we upgrade the stock to BUY from Accumulate. title: Buy Torrent Pharmaceuticals; target of Rs 4,024: Sharekhan
content: Sharekhan's research report on Torrent Pharmaceuticals Torrent Pharmaâ€™s acquisition of JB Chemicals opens the door to multiple growth opportunities, especially a foray into the therapeutic segment and the untapped CDMO space. JB has leading brands in the chronic space. Six of JBâ€™s brands are in the top 300 of the Indian pharmaceutical market (IPM) and continue to perform well on account of proven efficacy and favourable patient outcomes. JB is also strong in nephro, IV, pediatrics, ophthalmology and other segments. The ophthalmology segment (currently under a distribution model) will move into a licensing phase in January 2027, thus boosting margins. CDMO constitutes 11% of the revenues as of FY25 and is among the top 5 global lozenge manufacturers. Torrent will look to further expand the CDMO business. The acquisition will also help the firm penetrate further into the tier-2 and tier-3 markets. Outlook Strong focus and outperformance in the domestic market, successful integration of acquired firms/ products have led to improved valuations in recent times. Going forward too, the companies further foray into new segments/ diversification with strong revenue outlook bodes for the firm. We factor in revenue growth of 13%, and EBITDA growth of 16% CAGR over FY25-27E, leading to EBITDA margin improvement of 250 bps. Owing to triggers for revenue growth in FY26E, FY27E and beyond, we value the stock at 45x on FY27 EPS of Rs 89.4 and arrive at a price target of Rs 4,024. title: Petronet LNG shares rise 2.02%; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Petronet LNG gained 2.02% to trade at Rs 274.95 in Monday's session. The stock was among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at 11:02 am. Here is a review of Petronet LNG's recent financial performance: Quarterly Financials: Petronet LNG's consolidated quarterly revenue has shown a fluctuating trend. The revenue for June 2024 was Rs 13,415.13 Crore, which decreased to Rs 13,024.29 Crore in September 2024. It further declined to Rs 12,226.86 Crore in December 2024 and slightly increased to Rs 12,315.75 Crore in March 2025. The latest quarter, June 2025, reported a revenue of Rs 11,879.86 Crore. Net profit followed a similar trend, with Rs 1,100.76 Crore in June 2024, dropping to Rs 848.99 Crore in September 2024, then rising to Rs 866.59 Crore in December 2024 and Rs 1,067.58 Crore in March 2025, before falling again to Rs 824.44 Crore in June 2025. The EPS also mirrored this pattern, starting at Rs 7.37 in June 2024 and ending at Rs 5.61 in June 2025.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 13,415.13 CroreRs 13,024.29 CroreRs 12,226.86 CroreRs 12,315.75 CroreRs 11,879.86 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,100.76 CroreRs 848.99 CroreRs 866.59 CroreRs 1,067.58 CroreRs 824.44 CroreEPS7.375.806.017.305.61Annual Financials: The consolidated annual revenue for Petronet LNG has generally increased over the years. In 2021, the revenue was Rs 26,022.90 Crore, which grew to Rs 43,168.57 Crore in 2022 and further to Rs 59,899.35 Crore in 2023. However, there was a decrease in the following years, with Rs 52,729.33 Crore in 2024 and Rs 50,982.03 Crore in 2025. The net profit also showed an upward trend, from Rs 2,920.30 Crore in 2021 to Rs 3,883.92 Crore in 2025. Similarly, the EPS increased from Rs 19.59 in 2021 to Rs 26.48 in 2025. Book Value Per Share (BVPS) rose consistently from Rs 78.71 in 2021 to Rs 132.52 in 2025. Return on Equity (ROE) has decreased slightly over the years, from 24.89% in 2021 to 19.98% in 2025. The company has maintained a low Debt to Equity ratio, remaining at 0.00 in recent years.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 26,022.90 CroreRs 43,168.57 CroreRs 59,899.35 CroreRs 52,729.33 CroreRs 50,982.03 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,920.30 CroreRs 3,339.46 CroreRs 3,187.80 CroreRs 3,527.02 CroreRs 3,883.92 CroreEPS19.5922.9222.1724.3526.48BVPS78.7191.12101.76116.07132.52ROE24.8925.1521.7820.9719.98Debt to Equity0.010.000.000.000.00Annual Income Statement: The annual income statement provides further insights into Petronet LNG's financial performance. Sales have increased from Rs 26,022 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 50,982 Crore in March 2025. Other income has fluctuated, with the highest being Rs 772 Crore in March 2025. Total income has risen from Rs 26,381 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 51,755 Crore in March 2025. Total expenditure has also increased, from Rs 22,107 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 46,264 Crore in March 2025. Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT) have varied, with Rs 5,490 Crore in March 2025. Interest expenses have remained relatively stable, around Rs 300 Crore annually. The company's tax expenses have also been consistent, approximately Rs 1,000 Crore each year. Net profit has grown from Rs 2,920 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 3,883 Crore in March 2025. Cash Flow: The cash flow statement shows that cash flow from operating activities was Rs 4,397 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 3,559 Crore in March 2021. Investing activities resulted in a cash outflow of Rs -3,188 Crore in March 2025. Financing activities also led to a cash outflow of Rs -2,151 Crore in March 2025. Overall, the net cash flow was Rs -942 Crore in March 2025. Balance Sheet: The balance sheet indicates that share capital has remained constant at Rs 1,500 Crore. Reserves and surplus have increased from Rs 10,306 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 18,377 Crore in March 2025. Current liabilities have risen from Rs 2,074 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 4,060 Crore in March 2025. Total liabilities have grown from Rs 19,090 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 27,296 Crore in March 2025. Fixed assets have remained relatively stable, around Rs 10,000 Crore. Current assets have increased from Rs 8,161 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 15,202 Crore in March 2025. Total assets have increased from Rs 19,090 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 27,296 Crore in March 2025. Financial Ratios: Key financial ratios for Petronet LNG show a Basic EPS of Rs 26.48 and a Diluted EPS of Rs 26.48 as of March 2025. The Book Value per Share (Excluding Revaluation Reserve) was Rs 132.52. The companyâ€™s Return on Networth/Equity was 19.98%. The Debt to Equity ratio stood at 0.00, indicating low leverage. The P/E ratio was 11.09, and the P/B ratio was 2.21. Corporate Actions:Newspaper Publication: The company has enclosed the newspaper publication regarding the 27th AGM notice.Business Responsibility and Sustainability Reporting: The Business Responsibility and Sustainability Report for FY 2024-25 has been attached.Annual Report: The Notice of AGM and Annual Report for FY 2024-25 has been attached.The company announced a final dividend of Rs 3.00 per share (30%) on May 19, 2025, with an effective date of July 4, 2025. A bonus issue was announced on May 9, 2017, with a bonus ratio of 1:1; the ex-bonus date was July 3, 2017. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bearish sentiment for the stock as of September 1, 2025. Petronet LNG's stock currently trades at Rs 274.95, marking a gain of 2.02% in today's session; the stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index.

title: Tata Consultancy Services shares gain 1.01% in morning trade
content: Shares of Tata Consultancy Services were trading higher in Monday's session, with the stock price at Rs 3,115.80, a 1.01% increase from the previous close, as of 11:00 am. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. title: NHPC shares rise 2.16% in morning trade
content: Shares of NHPC were trading higher at Rs 78.90 as of 10:40 am in Monday's session, a 2.16% increase from the previous close. The stock is part of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Performance: NHPC's recent financial performance reveals the following trends based on consolidated figures: Quarterly Results:Revenue: The company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,213.77 Crore, compared to Rs 2,346.97 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025 and Rs 2,694.20 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024.Net Profit: The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 1,130.54 Crore, up from Rs 919.52 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025 and Rs 1,107.75 Crore in the quarter-ending June 2024.EPS: The earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 1.06, compared to Rs 0.85 for the quarter-ending March 2025 and Rs 1.02 for the quarter-ending June 2024.Annual Results:Revenue: The company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 10,379.86 Crore, compared to Rs 9,632.16 Crore for the year-ending March 2024.Net Profit: The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 3,409.37 Crore, compared to Rs 4,023.61 Crore for the year-ending March 2024.EPS: The earnings per share (EPS) for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 2.72, compared to Rs 3.61 for the year-ending March 2024.Here is a detailed look at the consolidated financial performance of NHPC:Financials (Consolidated)Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Revenue (Rs Crore)Rs 10,379.86 CroreRs 9,632.16 CroreRs 10,607.40 CroreRs 9,188.78 CroreRs 9,647.89 CroreNet Profit (Rs Crore)Rs 3,409.37 CroreRs 4,023.61 CroreRs 4,239.83 CroreRs 3,775.72 CroreRs 3,587.62 CroreEPS2.723.613.874.713.24The annual sales for March 2025 reached Rs 10,379 Crore, compared to Rs 9,632 Crore in March 2024. Other income increased to Rs 1,349 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 1,361 Crore in March 2024. Total income was Rs 11,729 Crore in March 2025, up from Rs 10,993 Crore in the previous year. Total expenditure decreased to Rs 5,775 Crore from Rs 5,552 Crore. The earnings before interest and taxes (EBIT) stood at Rs 5,953 Crore, compared to Rs 5,441 Crore in the previous period. Interest expenses were Rs 1,188 Crore, and tax expenses amounted to Rs 1,355 Crore. The net profit for March 2025 was Rs 3,409 Crore, compared to Rs 4,023 Crore in March 2024. Key financial ratios for NHPC show a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.99 as of the year-ending March 2025, compared to 0.84 in March 2024. The interest coverage ratio is 5.78. The basic EPS stood at Rs 2.72 in March 2025, compared to Rs 3.61 in March 2024. Corporate Actions: NHPC announced a final dividend of Rs 0.51 per share (5.1%) on May 20, 2025, with an effective date of August 14, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 1.40 per share (14%) was announced on February 7, 2025, and was effective from February 13, 2025. In other corporate actions, the 49th Annual General Meeting (AGM) of NHPC Limited was held on August 30, 2025, via VC/OAVM. The details of voting results along with the scrutinizer's report were submitted in compliance with Regulation 44(3) of SEBI LODR. Shares of NHPC were trading higher at Rs 78.90, a 2.16% increase from the previous close, in Monday's session.

title: Buy JK Cement; target of Rs 8,500: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securitie`s research report on JK Cement JK Cement (JKCE) has embarked on an express growth track, offering strong visibility of 16% CAGR capacity creation over FY25- 30 (vs. FY15â€“25â€™s 9%). JKCE has a rather cogent roadmap to achieve its 50mtpa target by 2030. First off, it recently announced a 7mtpa project in Jaisalmer which, in conjunction with projects in-hand, should catapult capacity to 38mtpa by Q2FY28 (24mtpa in FY25). Complementing this, the low-hanging brownfield expansion potential (to add 12mtpa) shall make the remaining job that much easier while increased cashflow may support project execution simultaneously. This setting is reminiscent of Shree Cement (SRCM), which in its high-growth years (FY14â€“18) commanded premium valuation of an average 22x EV/EBITDA. Outlook JKCE is set to tread a robust growth path with low-cost expansions guarding its industry-superior RoE along the way. Jaisalmerâ€™s greenfield project is pegged to cost a mere USD 78/t (special incentive package to boost returns further); other brownfield expansions should cost USD 60/t. The clear path to high-quality growth is reminiscent of SRCM, which in its high-growth years commanded a valuation multiple of 22x EV/EBITDA. Drawing confidence from JKCEâ€™s proven project execution prowess, its robust volume ramp-up, and disciplined approach to leverage, we now value the stock at 22x FY27E EV/EBITDA (being SRCMâ€™s FY14â€“18 average). Upgrade to BUY. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. ICICI_JK Cement

title: Exide Industries shares rise 2.13%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150 in morning trade
content: Shares of Exide Industries gained 2.13% to trade at Rs 404.70 in Monday's session. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. The rise reflects a positive investor activity in the stock. On the financial front, Exide Industries has demonstrated consistent performance. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 17,237.85 Crore, compared to Rs 16,769.73 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 800.00 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 882.27 Crore reported in the previous year. The company's quarterly performance shows a similar trend. For the quarter-ending June 2025, the consolidated revenue was Rs 4,695.12 Crore, up from Rs 4,435.71 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The net profit for the same quarter increased to Rs 274.24 Crore from Rs 220.65 Crore. title: ITC shares marginally lower in today's session; over 15.5 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of ITC were trading marginally lower in Monday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 409.25. At 10:20 am, the stock experienced a slight decrease of 0.12% from its previous close, with over 15.5 lakh shares traded on the NSE. ITC is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty 50 index. The company's debt-to-equity ratio is 0.00 as of March 2025. Corporate Actions: ITC has announced several corporate actions, including allotment of shares under the Employee Stock Option Schemes. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 7.85 per share on May 22, 2025, with an effective date of May 28, 2025. Additionally, ITC has a history of bonus issues, with the most recent being on May 20, 2016 (ex-bonus date was July 1, 2016, bonus ratio of 1:2). A stock split was announced on June 17, 2005, with an ex-split date of September 21, 2005. Moneycontrol's analysis on August 29, 2025, indicated a neutral sentiment for ITC. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 409.25, ITC has seen a marginal decrease of 0.12% in today's session with over 15.5 lakh shares traded.

title: United Breweries share price falls 2.53%; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of United Breweries declined 2.53%, trading at Rs 1,803.20 in Monday's session. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. At 10:30 am, the stock was trading lower compared to its previous close. Here is a look at the recent financial performance of United Breweries:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPSROEDebt to Equity20214,243.09113.834.28135.633.160.0320225,838.44366.0813.82148.999.280.0020237,499.92304.6811.50150.137.660.0020248,122.68410.8615.51158.239.810.0220258,915.09442.4116.71165.0510.120.13The company's revenue increased from Rs 4,243.09 Crore in 2021 to Rs 8,915.09 Crore in 2025. title: Bharti Airtel shares gain 0.49% in today's session; over 9.7 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading positively in Monday's session. At 10:20 am, the stock was priced at Rs 1,898, a 0.49 percent increase from its previous close. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. Over 9.7 lakh shares were traded on NSE so far. Financial Performance: Consolidated Financials: The following table presents key consolidated financial figures for Bharti Airtel.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 38,506.40 CroreRs 41,473.30 CroreRs 45,129.30 CroreRs 47,876.20 CroreRs 49,462.60 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,805.80 CroreRs 3,079.50 CroreRs 14,474.90 CroreRs 12,418.10 CroreRs 7,339.00 CroreEPS7.216.2125.5419.0210.26The revenue for Bharti Airtel has shown consistent growth over the quarters, increasing from Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 49,462.60 Crore in June 2025. Net profit saw a significant rise in the December 2024 and March 2025 quarters before decreasing to Rs 7,339.00 Crore in June 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) followed a similar trend, peaking in December 2024 and then declining in the subsequent quarters. Annual Consolidated Financials:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 100,615.80 CroreRs 116,546.90 CroreRs 139,144.80 CroreRs 149,982.40 CroreRs 172,985.20 CroreNet Profit-Rs 23,327.90 CroreRs 5,882.00 CroreRs 11,535.30 CroreRs 5,848.60 CroreRs 33,778.30 CroreEPS-27.657.6714.8013.0958.00BVPS147.90164.46210.95216.40226.16ROE-25.586.399.197.3925.58Debt to Equity2.202.001.821.501.13The annual revenue for Bharti Airtel has steadily increased over the years, from Rs 100,615.80 Crore in 2021 to Rs 172,985.20 Crore in 2025. After a net loss in 2021, the company has seen increasing profits, with a significant surge to Rs 33,778.30 Crore in 2025. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) has also improved, reaching Rs 58.00 in 2025. The book value per share has risen consistently, reflecting a strengthening financial position. The company's Return on Equity (ROE) has significantly improved to 25.58% in 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio has decreased from 2.20 in 2021 to 1.13 in 2025. final dividend of Rs 16.00 per share (320%) on May 13, 2025, with an effective date of July 18, 2025. Earlier dividends include Rs 8.00 per share in 2024, Rs 4.00 per share in 2023, Rs 3.00 per share in 2022, and Rs 2.00 per share in 2020. Bharti Airtel had a rights issue with exrights_date of September 27, 2021, with rights ratio of 1:14. Before that, rights issue was announced on February 28, 2019, with rights ratio of 19:67 with exrights_date of April 23, 2019. Moneycontrol analysis on August 25, 2025, indicated a bullish sentiment for the stock. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,898, Bharti Airtel has shown positive movement in today's session, with over 9.7 lakh shares traded.

title: Larsen & Toubro shares trade lower; over 1.3 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading at Rs 3,585.90 in Monday's session, a decline of 0.42% on the NSE. A total of 137,851 shares were traded as of about 10.30 am. Financial Performance: Larsen & Toubro's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth in both quarterly and annual results. Quarterly Results: The company has demonstrated strong quarterly performance, showcasing growth in revenue and net profit. title: Sensex gains 555 pts, Nifty above 24,600: Upbeat Q1 GDP data among key factors behind market rise
content: Benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty took a breather on September 1, closing in green after three consecutive sessions of recording losses. Sensex gained nearly 555 points (over 0.7 percent) to end the session at 80,364.49, while Nifty 50 rose nearly 200 points (over 0.8 percent) to close above the 24,600-mark. The broader market indices also recorded strong gains, with the smallcap and midcap indices rising up to 2 percent. Most of the major sectoral indices, expect media and pharma, were trading in the green. Here are the key factors behind the uptrend in Indian stock markets today: Strong Q1 GDP numbers: Indian economy grew 7.8 percent in the April-June quarter of the ongoing financial year. This is the highest growth recorded in five consecutive quarters, beating economists' estimates. Gross domestic product (GDP) topped both the RBI's 6.5 percent projection and the 6.6 percent median recorded in a Moneycontrol poll. The GDP growth was also stronger than the 7.4 percent rate recorded in the preceding three months (Q4 FY25) and 6.5 percent recorded a year earlier (Q1 FY25). "The key driver for this upbeat opening is Indiaâ€™s strong GDP data, which has boosted investor confidence and supported sentiment across sectors. Backed by healthy economic momentum and stable global cues, the market is set to begin on a firm note, though moves may turn stock-specific as the day progresses," said Mandar Bhojane, Senior Technical & Derivative Analyst - Research at Choice Equity Broking Private Limited. Optimism over PM Modi attending SCO Summit in China: Prime Minister Narendra Modi attended the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) summit in Tianjin, China. At the summit, he has met Chinese President Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin. This holds strong significance in global geopolitics after US President Donald Trump's administration increased tariffs on Indian imports to a whopping 50 percent. Additionally, the cooling tensions between India and China also may have boosted the markets. "Global geopolitics is transforming fast in response to Trumpâ€™s tantrums. The coming together of China, India and Russia can have profound consequences on global power equations and thereby on global trade. This will have its impact on the stock market too," said VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Investments Limited. Strong auto sales: Several automakers like Maruti Suzuki, Bajaj Auto, Hyundai and others released strong sales data for the month of August, beating expectations. This boosted the stocks, and the overall index as well. The sharp rise in the share prices pushed the Nifty Auto index up nearly 3 percent to close at 25,660. US court rules Trump tariffs illegal: A US appeals court last week ruled that most of Donald Trump's tariffs are illegal. The court has allowed the tariffs to remain effective till October 14, giving the Trump administration time to file an appeal with the US Supreme Court. Trump has GST Council, saying, "If these Tariffs ever went away, it would be a total disaster for the Country." The court ruling may have also provided some relief to the Indian stock markets, which earlier fell sharply after the additional tariffs took effect. VK Vijayakumar noted that the US court ruling on Trump's tariffs is a big development, and investors will await the final verdict by the US Supreme Court on the issue. Value buying: After three days of fall, investors may have resorted to value buying now. Sensex dropped more than 1,800 points (over 2 percent) to fall below the 80,000 mark, while Nifty 50 fell 541 points (over 2 percent) to fall below the 24,500-mark between August 26 and August 29. "The Nifty 50 is trading below its 100-DEMA, showing a weak trend with risks of further downside if 24,350 breaks. Key supports are at 24,350 and 24,150, while resistance lies at 24,600â€“24,800. Traders are advised to stay cautious, avoid aggressive positions, and consider buying near 24,350 with a stop-loss at 24,280 and profit booking around 24,700â€“24,800," said Mandar Bhojane, while explaining the technical side of the benchmark index. India Vix, which measures volatility in the markets, also dropped nearly 4 percent to 11.29 on September 1. IT stocks lead gains: IT stocks rose 1.3 percent after data showed the US Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) rose in line with estimates, keeping alive the expectations of a rate cut in September. The Federal Reserve tracks the PCE price measures for its 2 percent inflation target. Lower interest rates in the US make emerging markets such as India more attractive for foreign investors. All 10 constituents of the Nifty IT index traded in positive territory, with Mphasis leading the pack. The surge followed Morgan Stanleyâ€™s overweight rating on the stock, along with a revised target price of Rs 3,625 per share, up from Rs 3,500 earlier. GST reforms expectations: The GST Council, chaired by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, is slated to meet in New Delhi on September 3-4 to deliberate on the Centre's proposal for a simplified two-rate structure of 5 percent and 18 percent. According to market experts, this will likely act as a strong boost for several sectors. "The proposed GST reforms can accelerate growth in the coming quarters. This, along with the huge liquidity coming into mutual funds will continue to support the market," VK Vijayakumar said. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: India Vix, which measures volatility in the markets, also dropped nearly 4 percent to 11.29 on September 1.

title: Infosys shares gain 1.87% in morning session; over 11.5 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Infosys were trading positively in Monday's session, with the stock price at Rs 1,497.10, a 1.87% increase from the previous close. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. Over 11.5 lakh shares changed hands in today's session as of 10.15 am on NSE. On the financial front, a review of the consolidated financial performance reveals consistent growth. The quarterly revenue increased steadily from Rs 39,315.00 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 42,279.00 Crore in June 2025. Net profit also saw an increase, rising from Rs 6,374.00 Crore to Rs 6,924.00 Crore over the same period. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) rose from Rs 15.38 in June 2024 to Rs 16.70 in June 2025. The following table summarizes the quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 39,315.00 CroreRs 40,986.00 CroreRs 41,764.00 CroreRs 40,925.00 CroreRs 42,279.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 6,374.00 CroreRs 6,516.00 CroreRs 6,822.00 CroreRs 7,038.00 CroreRs 6,924.00 CroreEPS15.3815.7116.4316.9816.70The company's annual financial performance also demonstrates growth. Revenue increased from Rs 100,472.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 162,990.00 Crore in 2025. Net profit rose from Rs 19,423.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 26,750.00 Crore in 2025. EPS increased from Rs 45.61 in 2021 to Rs 64.50 in 2025. The table below presents a summary of Infosys' consolidated annual financials:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 100,472.00 CroreRs 121,641.00 CroreRs 146,767.00 CroreRs 153,670.00 CroreRs 162,990.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 19,423.00 CroreRs 22,146.00 CroreRs 24,108.00 CroreRs 26,248.00 CroreRs 26,750.00 CroreEPS45.6152.5257.6363.3964.50BVPS180.75180.50183.17212.74231.11ROE25.3429.3431.9529.7727.87Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The income statement for the year ending March 2025 shows sales of Rs 162,990 Crore, other income of Rs 3,600 Crore, and total expenditure of Rs 128,566 Crore. The Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT) stood at Rs 38,024 Crore, with interest payments of Rs 416 Crore and taxes of Rs 10,858 Crore. The net profit for the year was Rs 26,750 Crore. Compared to the year ending March 2024, sales increased from Rs 153,670 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 162,990 Crore in March 2025. Key financial ratios for Infosys show a P/E ratio of 24.35, a P/B ratio of 6.80, and a dividend per share of Rs 43.00 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. Infosys announced the allotment of ESOPs on August 30, 2025. Additionally, Infosys and Mastercard announced a collaboration to scale cross-border payments on August 28, 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 22 per share (440%) on April 17, 2025, with an effective date of May 30, 2025. Bonus shares were last issued on July 13, 2018, in the ratio of 1:1. The company's stock split on January 24, 2000, with the face value changing from Rs 10 to Rs 5. Moneycontrol analysis from August 25, 2025, indicated a bullish sentiment on the stock. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,497.10, Infosys has shown positive momentum in today's session, supported by strong financial performance and recent corporate announcements.
