title: Hindustan Unilever shares fall 0.54%, among top losers on Nifty 50 in Monday's trading
content: Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading lower in Monday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 2,645.50, as of 10:10 am, a 0.54% decline from its previous close. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty 50 index. Hindustan Unilever's quarterly revenue has shown a fluctuating trend. The revenue for June 2024 stood at Rs 15,707.00 Crore, which then increased to Rs 15,926.00 Crore in September 2024. December 2024 saw a slight decrease to Rs 15,818.00 Crore, followed by another dip to Rs 15,670.00 Crore in March 2025. However, the company bounced back in June 2025, recording revenue of Rs 16,514.00 Crore. The net profit also experienced some fluctuation. It was Rs 2,614.00 Crore in June 2024, slightly decreasing to Rs 2,601.00 Crore in September 2024. The company saw an increase to Rs 2,988.00 Crore in December 2024, but then a decrease to Rs 2,476.00 Crore in March 2025. By June 2025, the net profit was Rs 2,769.00 Crore. The earnings per share (EPS) followed a similar pattern. The EPS was Rs 11.11 in June 2024, Rs 11.03 in September 2024, and Rs 12.70 in December 2024. It then decreased to Rs 10.48 in March 2025, and rose again to Rs 11.73 in June 2025.Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 15,707.00 CroreRs 15,926.00 CroreRs 15,818.00 CroreRs 15,670.00 CroreRs 16,514.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,614.00 CroreRs 2,601.00 CroreRs 2,988.00 CroreRs 2,476.00 CroreRs 2,769.00 CroreEPS11.1111.0312.7010.4811.73Hindustan Unilever's annual financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the past five years. The company's revenue increased from Rs 47,028.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 63,121.00 Crore in 2025. Similarly, net profit rose from Rs 8,000.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 10,679.00 Crore in 2025. The company's earnings per share (EPS) also saw a steady increase, from Rs 34.03 in 2021 to Rs 45.32 in 2025. Book Value Per Share (BVPS) has remained relatively stable, with a slight decrease in 2025. Return on Equity (ROE) has improved from 16.77% in 2021 to 21.55% in 2025, and the company maintains a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00.20212022202320242025RevenueRs 47,028.00 CroreRs 52,446.00 CroreRs 60,580.00 CroreRs 61,896.00 CroreRs 63,121.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 8,000.00 CroreRs 8,887.00 CroreRs 10,145.00 CroreRs 10,286.00 CroreRs 10,679.00 CroreEPS34.0337.7943.0743.7445.32BVPS202.95208.88214.99217.95210.22ROE16.7718.0920.1120.0621.55Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The annual income statement for Hindustan Unilever reveals a consistent increase in sales and total income over the years. Sales have grown from Rs 47,028 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 63,121 Crore in March 2025. Total income has also risen from Rs 47,438 Crore to Rs 64,138 Crore during the same period. The company's total expenditure has increased from Rs 36,715 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 49,320 Crore in March 2025. Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT) have increased from Rs 10,723 Crore to Rs 14,818 Crore. Interest expenses have fluctuated, while tax expenses have increased from Rs 2,606 Crore to Rs 3,744 Crore. Consequently, net profit has grown from Rs 8,000 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 10,679 Crore in March 2025.Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 63,121 CroreRs 61,896 CroreRs 60,580 CroreRs 52,446 CroreRs 47,028 CroreOther IncomeRs 1,017 CroreRs 811 CroreRs 512 CroreRs 258 CroreRs 410 CroreTotal IncomeRs 64,138 CroreRs 62,707 CroreRs 61,092 CroreRs 52,704 CroreRs 47,438 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 49,320 CroreRs 48,443 CroreRs 47,632 CroreRs 40,724 CroreRs 36,715 CroreEBITRs 14,818 CroreRs 14,264 CroreRs 13,460 CroreRs 11,980 CroreRs 10,723 CroreInterestRs 395 CroreRs 334 CroreRs 114 CroreRs 106 CroreRs 117 CroreTaxRs 3,744 CroreRs 3,644 CroreRs 3,201 CroreRs 2,987 CroreRs 2,606 CroreNet ProfitRs 10,679 CroreRs 10,286 CroreRs 10,145 CroreRs 8,887 CroreRs 8,000 CroreHindustan Unilever has announced several corporate actions, including newspaper publications regarding the appointment of Ms. Priya Nair as Managing Director and CEO. The company also announced a postal ballot for the same appointment and has scheduled analyst/investor meetings. The company has declared multiple dividends. A final dividend of Rs 24.00 per share (2400%) was announced on April 24, 2025, with an effective date of June 23, 2025. Additionally, an interim dividend of Rs 19.00 per share (1900%) and a special dividend of Rs 10.00 per share (1000%) were announced on October 10 and 11, 2024, respectively, both with an effective date of November 6, 2024. Hindustan Unilever has issued bonus shares in the past. On September 30, 1991, the company announced a bonus issue with a ratio of 1:2, with exbonus date as July 19, 1991. Other bonus issues were announced on June 22, 1987 (1:1), June 22, 1983 (3:5), and June 22, 1979 (1:3). The company had one stock split on July 5, 2000, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split into a new face value of Rs 1, with exsplit date as July 03, 2000. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment on Hindustan Unilever as of September 1, 2025. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 2,645.50, Hindustan Unilever is currently among the top losers on the Nifty 50 index.

title: TCS shares gain 1.1%, among top gainers on Nifty 50 in Monday's trading
content: Shares of Tata Consultancy Services were among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 in Monday's session, with the stock price rising 1.14%. At 10:10 am, the stock was trading at Rs 3,120.00. Financial Performance Tata Consultancy Services' consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth. The quarterly revenue has increased from Rs 62,613.00 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 63,437.00 Crore in June 2025. The net profit also saw an increase from Rs 12,105.00 Crore to Rs 12,819.00 Crore during the same period. EPS has increased from 33.28 in June 2024 to 35.27 in June 2025. The yearly revenue has shown a steady increase from Rs 164,177.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 255,324.00 Crore in 2025. Net profit also increased from Rs 32,562.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 48,797.00 Crore in 2025. The EPS has grown from 86.71 in 2021 to 134.19 in 2025. Here is a summary of the company's consolidated quarterly and annual financial performance:ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 62,613.00 CroreRs 64,259.00 CroreRs 63,973.00 CroreRs 64,479.00 CroreRs 63,437.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 12,105.00 CroreRs 11,955.00 CroreRs 12,444.00 CroreRs 12,293.00 CroreRs 12,819.00 CroreEPS33.2832.9234.2133.7935.27 Particulars20212022202320242025RevenueRs 164,177.00 CroreRs 191,754.00 CroreRs 225,458.00 CroreRs 240,893.00 CroreRs 255,324.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 32,562.00 CroreRs 38,449.00 CroreRs 42,303.00 CroreRs 46,099.00 CroreRs 48,797.00 CroreEPS86.71103.62115.19125.88134.19BVPS235.43245.48249.20252.26261.76ROE37.5242.9946.6150.7351.24Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00 The annual income statement shows consistent growth in sales, other income, and total income. Sales have increased from Rs 164,177 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 255,324 Crore in March 2025. The net profit has also risen from Rs 32,562 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 48,797 Crore in March 2025. Corporate Actions Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has announced several press releases including one regarding Philippines Pharma Major, Unilab, Selecting TCS For Cloud-Led Enterprise Modernization on August 28, 2025. Additionally, the company has scheduled Analyst/Institutional Investors Meetings and announced that TCS enables ICICI Lombard To Deliver a Fully Automated Multi-Region Disaster Recovery On AWS Cloud. The company has announced multiple dividends. Most recently, an interim dividend of Rs 11.00 per share (1100%) was announced on June 27, 2025, with an effective date of July 16, 2025. Earlier, a final dividend of Rs 30.00 per share (3000%) was announced on April 11, 2025, effective June 4, 2025. In addition, a special dividend of Rs 66.00 per share (6600%) was announced on January 9, 2025, and an interim dividend of Rs 10.00 per share (1000%) was announced on December 31, 2024, both with an effective date of January 17, 2025. TCS has also issued bonus shares in the past. The company issued bonus shares on April 19, 2018 (ex-bonus date: May 31, 2018), April 20, 2009 (ex-bonus date: June 16, 2009), and April 17, 2006 (ex-bonus date: July 28, 2006), each with a bonus ratio of 1:1. With the stock's price at Rs 3,120.00, Tata Consultancy Services is currently among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index.

title: ITC shares fall, among top losers on Nifty 50 in Monday's trading session
content: Shares of ITC were trading at Rs 408.50, a decline of 0.31% in Monday's session, with the stock featuring among the top losers on the Nifty 50 index at 10:10 am. On August 19, 2025, the company announced the allotment of shares under its Employee Stock Option Schemes. ITC had announced a final dividend of Rs 7.85 per share on May 22, 2025, which was effective from May 28, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 6.50 per share was announced on February 6, 2025, with effect from February 12, 2025. The company has a history of bonus issues, including a 1:2 bonus ratio on July 1, 2016, a 1:1 bonus ratio on August 3, 2010, and a 1:2 bonus ratio on September 21, 2005. ITC had a stock split on September 21, 2005, where the old face value of Rs 10 was split into a new face value of Rs 1. title: Sterlite Tech shares lower after US court affirms $96.5 million order in non-compete breach, company plans to appeal
content: Optical fiber cables company Sterlite Tech's shares were sharply lower in early trade on September 1, down by over 3 percent, after an exchange filing said an American company - Prysmian Cables - has filed a lawsuit against STL's US subsidiary over breach of non-compete and confidentiality agreements. Prysmian Cables and Systems USA, LLC sued the company and Stephen Szymanski, an employee of Sterlite Tech Inc over violation of 'certain non-compete and confidentiality agreements', which have provided Sterlite Tech with an 'alleged unjust competitive advantage', an exchange filing said. Sterlite Tech has denied these allegations, and said the company is 'not a party to this dispute and no claims have been made against STL'. A South Carolina jury had awarded $200,000 against Szymanski and $96.5 million against Sterlite Tech, and the Court affirmed the verdict on August 29, 2025, but denied pre-judgment interest. A pre-judgment interest refers to any compensation to the winning side in a lawsuit for the loss of the use of money between the date of the final judgment, and the claim becoming due. "On August 9, 2024, following a three week trial, a Jury returned a verdict of $200,000 against Szymanski and USD 96.5 million against STI. On August 29, 2025, the Court affirmed the verdict but denied Plaintiffâ€™s post-trial motion for pre-judgment interest," the company informed. Sterlite Tech has disputed the ruling and intends to appeal the verdict. The judgment is 'unsupported by the testimony and evidence presented at trial' said Sterlite Tech. The company intends to 'vigorously pursue all available post-trial remedies, including an appeal', the statement said. "Matter is sub-judice and given STI intends to file an appeal, the ultimate financial implications, if any, will be assessed on the ultimate resolution of the matter," Sterlite Tech added. Having recovered from early lows, the shares of Sterlite Tech are sharply down in the trading session. On a YTD basis, shares of STL are down by over 4 percent, and lower by 16 percent over past one year.
summary_lexrank: Sterlite Tech has disputed the ruling and intends to appeal the verdict.
summary_luhn: Optical fiber cables company Sterlite Tech's shares were sharply lower in early trade on September 1, down by over 3 percent, after an exchange filing said an American company - Prysmian Cables - has filed a lawsuit against STL's US subsidiary over breach of non-compete and confidentiality agreements.
summary_lsa: Optical fiber cables company Sterlite Tech's shares were sharply lower in early trade on September 1, down by over 3 percent, after an exchange filing said an American company - Prysmian Cables - has filed a lawsuit against STL's US subsidiary over breach of non-compete and confidentiality agreements.
summary_textrank: A pre-judgment interest refers to any compensation to the winning side in a lawsuit for the loss of the use of money between the date of the final judgment, and the claim becoming due.
